The sessions were held in 13 hospitals and aimed to present medical studies, promote discussion among professionals, and resolve medical issues related to Allergology. During the closing ceremony, awards were given to the best clinical cases presented by residents of Allergology at the Guadalajara hospital. Aikaterini Tsopana's work, directed by Arantza Vega and Juan María Beitia, won the Best Clinical Case of 2022 for unexpected anaphylaxis caused by peanuts. Silvia Sampedro's work, directed by Arantza Vega and Inés Torrado, won the Best Clinical Case of 2023 for anaphylaxis caused by cucurbitaceae. The jury praised the exhaustive studies conducted to find solutions for patients' allergies. The event was supported by the Local Committee, led by Dr. Arantza Vega Castro and Dr. Juan María Beitia Mazuecos.

title: ¿Vienen más fuertes las alergias esta primavera?
hco: FUNDACION SOCIEDAD DE MADRID Y CASTLA MANCHA DE ALERGOLOGIA E INMUNOLOCLINICA
summary: According to Dr. Álvaro Moreno Ancillo from the allergy service at the Hospital Nuestra Señora del Prado in Talavera de la Reina, people living in the west will have a worse spring for allergies, while those living towards the east will be better off. In Castilla-La Mancha, allergies will be heavily affected by grasses, but pollen levels will affect all regions of the area, except for Toledo, which will be worse. The doctor clarifies that it is very common for children to suffer from atopic dermatitis on the skin, which can influence food allergies, but if parents suspect their young child may have an allergy, tests can be done from five months of age. He also advises that if someone has an allergy, they should consult with a doctor and not self-treat, as they could make a mistake.

title: Sigüenza ha reunido a 140 alergólogos de Madrid y Castilla-La Mancha durante la clausura de sus Jornadas ...
hco: FUNDACION SOCIEDAD DE MADRID Y CASTLA MANCHA DE ALERGOLOGIA E INMUNOLOCLINICA
summary: Around 140 allergists from Madrid and Castilla-La Mancha gathered in Sigüenza for the closing of the Interhospitalary Allergy Sessions organized by the Society of Madrid and Castilla-La Mancha of Clinical Allergology and Immunology. The sessions were held in 13 hospitals in both communities to present medical studies on allergies, provide a forum for professionals in the sector, and discuss real practical cases in the field. Two residents of the Guadalajara hospital, Aikaterini Tsopana and Silvia Sampedro, were awarded prizes for their clinical cases. The work of third-year resident Aikaterini Tsopana, "Unexpected Anaphylaxis from Peanuts," won the Best Clinical Case of 2022. Meanwhile, second-year resident Silvia Sampedro won the Best Clinical Case of 2023 for her work on "Anaphylaxis from Cucurbitaceae." Both cases were praised for offering solutions to patients through thorough studies. Inés Torrado Español was one of the directors of Silvia Sampedro's work.

title: Heat-killed Mycobacterium tuberculosis induces trained immunity in vitro and in vivo administered systemically or ...
summary: Heat-killed Mycobacterium tuberculosis has been found to induce trained immunity (TI) both in vitro and in vivo when administered systemically or intranasally. This effect represents a truly trained process, as it confers boosted inflammatory responses against various heterologous challenges. The mechanism behind this relies on epigenetic mechanisms in a Syk/HIF-1α-dependent manner. The research has demonstrated that HK Mtb has the potential to act as a mucosal immunotherapy that can successfully induce trained responses. Laura Bravo-Robles was one of the authors of the study.

title: Illinois Comptroller provides portal to track migrant-related spending
summary: Illinois Comptroller, Susana Mendoza, has created a website portal to provide taxpayers with more information about state expenditures on asylum seekers coming to Illinois. The portal will display expenditures, including the vendor's name, the agency that paid the vendor, the state fund the money came from, contract information, and the total amount paid. Governor J.B. Pritzker recently announced an additional spending commitment of $182m to assist the migrants, most of whom were transported from Texas to Chicago by Texas Gov. Greg Abbott. Comptroller Mendoza encourages Cook County and the city of Chicago to provide similar portals to show their spending on this significant issue. According to a statement from the comptroller's office, 11 vouchers totaling $31m were reported as of Tuesday, Feb 20, with more expected in the coming months.

title: Illinois Comptroller Susana Mendoza Honors SHENIX CEO Olga Camargo During Women's History Month
summary: Illinois Comptroller Susana Mendoza recognized Olga Camargo, CEO and founder of SHENIX, as a 2024 Women's History Month honoree during a ceremony on March 21 in Springfield. SHENIX is a fintech company that provides educational resources and tools to empower Latinas in their financial journeys. The company's app is designed specifically for Latinas and offers financial guidance, personal, and professional growth tools. Camargo has over two decades of experience in the financial services industry and is the first Latina Chair of Northeastern Illinois University's Foundation Board. She is also the Emeritus Board Chair of the Hispanic Alliance for Career Enhancement and is actively involved in various boards and councils. Mendoza applauded Camargo's efforts to help other women make well-informed decisions about things like investing, buying a home, and retirement planning.

title: Comptroller urges awareness of tax scams
summary: Illinois Comptroller Susana Mendoza is warning taxpayers about email, telephone, and mail tax scams as the 2024 filing season begins. Mendoza's office has noted that some Illinois residents have been targeted for false unemployment claims. The state sends 1099-G forms to people who have claimed unemployment. If you receive such a form but did not collect such benefits, you can contact the Illinois Department of Employment Security to report fraud. If you receive an email like this, you can report it to the IRS at phishing@irs.gov. Individuals should also avoid tax preparers who are unwilling to sign the forms they have prepared. Once tax returns are filed, Illinois residents can track their state tax refund at myrefund.illinoiscomptroller.gov.

title: Comptroller Susana Mendoza honors LGBTQ+ leaders in central Illinois during pride month celebration
summary: Comptroller Susana Mendoza held an award ceremony to honor state and local leaders from central Illinois who have contributed to the advancement of LGBTQ+ rights in Illinois during Pride Month. Illinois ranks as the ninth-best state for members of the LGBTQ community to live, according to Center Link Pride Centers. One of the honorees during the ceremony was Illinois' first gay sheriff, Dustin Heuerman from Champaign County. Mendoza expressed gratitude towards the contributors and people who are changing lives and wants people to be in leadership and positions of power that can help make the path for those who are behind them easier.

title: ITIA - Alberto Rojas Maldonado, Christopher Díaz Figueroa, José Antonio Rodríguez Rodríguez, Antonio Ruiz Rosales ...
summary: The International Tennis Integrity Agency (ITIA) has penalized five tennis players for violating the Tennis Anti-Corruption Program (TACP) related to a match-fixing scheme in Belgium. The sanctions were imposed by Independent Anti-Corruption Hearing Officer Professor Richard McLaren after all five players failed to challenge the charges against them. Mexican player Alberto Rojas Maldonado has been banned for life from the sport and fined $250,000 for committing 92 TACP violations. Guatemalan player Christopher Díaz Figueroa has been banned for life and fined $75,000 for 13 additional TACP breaches. Mexican player José Antonio Rodríguez Rodríguez has been suspended for 12 years and fined $25,001 for eight TACP violations, while Mexican player Antonio Ruiz Rosales has been suspended for 10 years and fined $30,000 for seven violations. Mexican player Orlando Alcántara Rangel has been suspended for two years and fined $10,000 for two violations. The ITIA is an independent organization formed by its tennis members to protect the credibility of professional tennis around the world.

title: «Muchos pacientes no tienen síntomas hasta que el cáncer de colon está muy avanzado»
hco: ASOCIACION CACEREÑA PARA LALA INVESTIGACIÓN Y DESARROLLODE LA ONCOLOGÍA MÉDICA - ACIDEOMOx
summary: Jorge Muñoz, an oncology specialist, emphasizes the importance of attending SES screenings for colon cancer, as many patients do not show symptoms until the cancer is advanced. Early detection is crucial to increase the chances of survival.

title: Suben los casos de cáncer de colon: «El 70% está relacionado con el estilo de vida»
hco: ASOCIACION CACEREÑA PARA LALA INVESTIGACIÓN Y DESARROLLODE LA ONCOLOGÍA MÉDICA - ACIDEOMOx
summary: The incidence of colon cancer is increasing, particularly among young people, due to lifestyle factors such as a diet low in fruits and vegetables, increased consumption of red meat and saturated fats, alcohol, and sedentary behavior. Early detection through screening tests such as a blood test for hidden blood in feces and colonoscopies can lead to high survival rates, but many people do not participate in screening programs. In Extremadura, Spain, only 40% of those invited to participate in the screening program for colon cancer actually did so. Jorge Muñoz Luengo, an oncologist specializing in digestive tumors, emphasizes the importance of prevention through lifestyle changes and screening programs to catch the cancer early.

title: Kurt-Keil-Archiv-Dr. Carmen Pérez González
summary: Dr. Carmen Pérez González, who is a photo historian and a lecturer in history at the University of Wuppertal, is currently curating photographer Kurt Keil's collection in the university archive along with her students. The archive was previously kept in Keil's family cellar until it got flooded in 2021, and the university archivist helped to secure the collection at the university. The collection spans from 1967 to 2007 and comprises numerous negatives, exhibits from a previous exhibition, newspaper cuttings, and contact prints. Pérez González and her team are currently taking inventory of the material, with a focus on the years 1967 to 1969. Keil's collection is a pure reflection of city history, covering various events and celebrities, including political figures such as Erich Honecker, Helmut Kohl, Hans-Dietrich Genscher, and Angela Merkel, as well as showbiz stars such as Hans Rosenthal, Rudi Carrell, and Udo Lindenberg. Pérez González plans to curate an exhibition of Keil's entire oeuvre, including his cameras, negatives, and photos.

title: Escuela para pacientes con cáncer de mama
summary: The Asociación Española contra el Cáncer del Hospital 12 de Octubre is organizing a weekly workshop for patients with breast cancer. The program includes topics such as the definition of breast cancer, types and treatments, nutrition and exercise, menopause and breast cancer, hereditary breast cancer, and the effects of treatments and care. The workshops also provide advice on social benefits and legal issues for oncology patients. The program is coordinated by Dr. Lara Iglesias, Dr. Laura Lema, and Sagrario Alegre. The workshops will be held at the Hospital 12 de Octubre in Madrid, Spain, from October 11 to November 22, 2023, and patients can register through the Oncosur website or at the AECC offices.

title: Dra. Iglesias: «Hay que animar a los pacientes con cáncer de cabeza y cuello a salir y relacionarse”
summary: December 10th is the National Day of Head and Neck Cancer, which is the seventh most common cancer in Spain. It is estimated that there will be 12,500 new cases in 2023. This disease is a significant global health challenge as it affects various parts of the body such as the mouth, throat, salivary glands, and larynx. To raise awareness, several initiatives are being carried out to highlight the importance of prevention, early detection, and effective treatment. One such initiative is the "Blue Scarves" campaign launched by Merck to generate greater social awareness of this type of cancer, its symptoms, and risk factors for early detection. In an interview with OkSalud, Doctor Lara Iglesias, an oncologist at the Hospital 12 de Octubre, explains the importance of these initiatives and how everyone can help improve the quality of life of people suffering from this type of cancer.

title: Mexican virologist Susana López Charretón uncovered rotaviruses' secrets
summary: Mexican virologist Susana López Charretón has been studying rotaviruses for over four decades. Her research, along with her husband Carlos Arias Ortiz and other scientists around the world, built the scientific foundation for the development of rotavirus vaccines, which have dramatically reduced the burden of disease. López Charretón's work has defined the multistep processes and specific molecular players that allow the viruses to invade the cells of the intestine and rapidly replicate their genetic material, the first steps in rotavirus infection and gastroenteritis. She continues to work on rotaviruses, trying to figure out how they pervert the entire cellular machinery within intestinal cells. López Charretón has also worked to build a pipeline of scientists in Mexico by mentoring young virologists. She has been awarded the UNESCO–Carlos J. Finlay Prize for Microbiology and the L’Oréal-UNESCO For Women in Science award.

title: Pérez Andrés recibe emocionado el Premio a la Concordia de los hosteleros de España: "Justifica muchos añ
summary: Javier Pérez Andrés, un periodista especializado en vino, agricultura, turismo y desarrollo rural, recibió el Premio Concordia de la industria hotelera española. Pérez Andrés, quien ha estado practicando durante más de 30 años, fue acompañado por el alcalde de Valladolid, Jesús Julio Carnero, y el presidente de los hoteleros de Valladolid, Jaime Fernández. El periodista destacó la importancia del premio, que justifica sus años de trabajo en el periodismo y su compromiso con la industria hotelera. Hostelería España también presentó otros premios a chefs, empresas e instituciones que ejemplificaron la excelencia en la industria este año. José Luis Coca Pérez fue uno de los galardonados.

title: Ángela González, nueva responsable de comunicación digital de Varma
summary: Ángela González ha sido nombrada como la nueva Directora de Comunicación Digital del Grupo Varma. Será responsable de definir la estrategia digital y gestionar la red de influencia asociada a las marcas del grupo, incluyendo Ron Barceló, Vermut Yzaguirre, Fireball, Moskovskaya, White Claw y Hendrick's Gin. La experiencia de González en la creación y ejecución de estrategias de comunicación digital ayudará a llevar las marcas de Varma a la vanguardia del sector. Beatriz García Cabañas, directora de comunicación de Varma, considera a González como un miembro clave del equipo de comunicación y digital. La promoción de González destaca el compromiso de la empresa con la excelencia en la comunicación digital y refuerza su posición de liderazgo en la industria.

title: The Doctor Estivill says that sleep is more important than eating
summary: Dr. Eduard Estivill, the author of the book "Go to sleep kid" and Director of the Sleep Clinic Estivill, gave a talk on the importance of sleep and its impact on the working day. Estivill discussed common sleep disorders and provided a Decalogue to sleep better, including taking a hot bath before bed, avoiding copious dinners, not taking stimulant substances, drinking warm milk before bedtime, avoiding intense intellectual effort before bed, and sleeping in optimal environmental conditions. Estivill emphasizes that sleep is a physiological need with hormonal, metabolic, temperature, and biochemical changes essential for the proper functioning of the human being during the day. He suggests that every time we sleep less and worse, we compromise our health and well-being.

title: Eduard Estivill, especialista europeo en medicina del sueño
summary: Eduard Estivill, a European specialist in sleep medicine, was featured on the RTVE Play Radio show "Las tardes de RNE" to discuss the importance of sleep in daily life. The program emphasized the significance of sleep and its impact on overall health.

title: Las recetas de Eduardo Estivill, el gurú del sueño, para que España duerma: deja a tu hijo llorar y sigue sus consejos
summary: Eduard Estivill, a sleep disorder specialist who is 75 years old, is highly respected in the field of sleep disorders in Spain. He believes that Spaniards are the most sleep-deprived people in Europe, with the average person sleeping almost an hour less than their European counterparts. Estivill suggests that changes in societal habits are necessary to improve sleep quality, such as ending school and work earlier and going to bed earlier. He has authored books on sleep, including "Duérmete niño," which promotes the "Estivill method" of sleep training for infants, involving allowing a baby to cry themselves to sleep. The Estivill Sleep Foundation, led by his daughter Carla Estivill, conducts research on sleep disorders and collaborates with pharmaceutical companies to develop new treatments. They are currently studying the sleep patterns of the Catalan police force.

title: Dr. Eduard Estivill: «Dormir es lo más importante que hacemos a lo largo de la vida»
summary: Dr. Eduard Estivill, a European specialist in sleep medicine, stresses the significance of having a good night's sleep for overall health and well-being. He is renowned for his technique of teaching babies and children to sleep, which is based on behavioral techniques related to the circadian rhythm. He cautions that insufficient sleep can result in fatigue, irritability, and other metabolic and psychiatric problems. He also emphasizes the importance of developing good sleep habits from childhood, as poor sleep habits can lead to long-term sleep problems and the need for medication. Finally, he recommends adhering to good sleep hygiene practices, such as establishing a regular sleep schedule and avoiding electronic devices before bedtime.

title: Explicación científica de por qué no tenemos que dormir en pareja
summary: Eduard Estivill, a sleep expert, explains that sleeping with a partner has negative consequences on personal rest. He defines the process of sleeping as "the process of going down a scale" and any movement or noise from a partner can interfere with the process of going into a deeper sleep. Therefore, Estivill defends that sleeping alone is more beneficial for personal rest. He also mentions that the practice of sleeping separately from a partner is becoming increasingly common among older people who understand that "sleeping" has nothing to do with "affection". Estivill suggests that young couples should also try sleeping separately until they realize the advantages of sleeping alone.

title: Beneficios de la luz natural para nuestra salud
summary: Exposure to natural light during the day helps improve sleep quality at night, according to several medical studies. The intense light received in the morning helps synchronize the circadian rhythm of wakefulness-sleep. Dr. Eduard Estivill, director of the Sleep Unit at the General University Hospital of Catalonia, emphasizes the role of natural light in promoting good sleep and the negative impact of lack of daylight on health. Estivill suggests that we need a lot of light during the day and darkness at night to ensure the quality of sleep. Other benefits of natural light for our health include better circadian rhythm, concentration, cognitive performance, and productivity, as well as reducing irritability, fatigue, and mild ailments. It also contributes to the production of vitamin D, which protects against certain types of cancer and helps with bone formation and good health.

title: Eduard Estivill explica por qué el cambio de hora nos afecta más a los españoles: "En este país somos un
summary: Eduard Estivill, a sleep specialist, explains on the show "Más Vale Tarde" that Spaniards are more affected by the time change because they go to bed later and wake up at the same time as the rest of Europe. He warns of the dangers of having more daylight hours and gives advice on how to adapt to the time change, such as gradually adjusting schedules, exercising, and maintaining regular sleep patterns. Estivill also discusses the effects of the time change on the elderly, children, and even animals. He suggests that it is better not to make time changes and that the previous system was better. He concludes that Spaniards are a little "lazy" and will suffer from a lack of sleep due to the change in time.

title: Estivill: "A los niños el hábito del sueño se les tiene que enseñar y eso se hace con normas y rutinas"
summary: Eduard Estivill, a pediatrician and sleep specialist, highlights the significance of instilling good sleep habits in children through routines and rules. He recently participated in a sleep conference organized by the Sleep Chair of the University of Murcia. Estivill suggests that stress and fast-paced lifestyles are the main causes of sleep deprivation, which affects 30% of the population. He also points out that women tend to experience more sleep problems than men, especially during pregnancy, postpartum, and menopause. As a pediatrician, Estivill has authored books on teaching babies to sleep and stresses the importance of parents learning the steps to establish sleep routines. He recommends that sleep habits should be taught through repetition and consistency, and that parents should be mindful of the impact of disruptions on weekends and vacations.

title: Consejos del doctor Estivill a los deportistas para lograr un sueño de calidad
summary: Dr. Eduard Estivill, an expert in the diagnosis and treatment of sleep disorders, emphasizes the importance of quality sleep for athletes. He explains that sleep is a fundamental pillar for physical, physiological, metabolic, and mental recovery. Studies show that sleep is the best strategy for the recovery of elite athletes. Dr. Estivill offers five recommendations for athletes to improve their sleep before a competition, including determining their chronotype, sleeping for at least nine hours, taking short naps, using artificial light to stimulate alertness, and maintaining a consistent routine. After a competition, athletes may have difficulty falling asleep due to the secretion of endorphins. Dr. Estivill recommends taking melatonin to help with sleep, but also emphasizes the importance of understanding that athletes may experience myoclonus, or muscle twitches, after intense exercise, which can disrupt sleep.

title: Las mujeres sufren más el mal dormir
summary: On World Sleep Day, Dr. Eduard Estivill discusses the gender perspective of sleep disorders, highlighting that women suffer from sleep disorders during pregnancy, postpartum, and menopause. He also warns about the dangers of working night shifts, which can lead to a shorter lifespan due to disruptions in sleep cycles. Sleep deprivation can increase the risk of mental disorders and death by 20%. The doctor advises against using medication to help sleep, as it can lead to dependence and negative mental health consequences. He recommends taking a nap of at least 90 minutes to compensate for a night shift and avoiding exposure to sunlight after work. Estivill also emphasizes the need for society to change its schedules to prioritize health. Women are more affected by sleep disorders, which can lead to irritability, depression, hormonal changes, and more painful and prolonged menstrual cycles.

title: HDF Energy could become Mexico's green hydro...
summary: French energy firm HDF Energy prévoit d'investir 2,5 milliards de dollars dans sept projets d'hydrogène vert au Mexique d'ici 2030, avec une construction commençant l'année prochaine à Energía Los Cabos et le reste en 2025. La vice-présidente de la société pour l'Amérique latine, Cristina Martín, a déclaré que la société deviendra le premier producteur indépendant d'hydrogène vert au Mexique une fois qu'Energía Los Cabos commencera ses opérations en 2025. HDF Energy construira deux projets similaires en Basse-Californie du Sud et trois dans la péninsule du Yucatan, et un autre projet est prévu pour l'isthme de Tehuantepec. La société se concentrera sur un type de projet appelé renouvelable et stable, et utilisera principalement l'hydrogène pour la production d'électricité. HDF Energy développera, investira, construira et exploitera les projets, qui sont entièrement privés mais ouverts à la participation du public. La société prévoit d'embaucher des fournisseurs locaux et internationaux.

title: Universitarios de varias titulaciones harán prácticas en el Sescam
summary: The government of Castilla-La Mancha and public universities in the region have signed agreements allowing students from various degree programs, not just those in healthcare, to undertake internships with the Servicio de Salud de Castilla-La Mancha (Sescam). The agreements were signed by the president of the Junta, Emiliano García-Page, the rector of the University of Castilla-La Mancha (UCLM), Julián Garde, and the rector of the University of Alcalá (UAH), José Vicente Saz. The initiative aims to combine the need for training and internships with “the most complex administration of an administration, which is healthcare”. The program will start with around 100 students, but the number of beneficiaries will increase exponentially in the coming years. The rector of the UCLM celebrated that students from new degrees, such as Physics or Mathematics, can now also undertake internships with Sescam.

title: Protección social y movilidad internacional de las personas trabajadoras
summary: A meeting was held at the University of Alcalá to analyze the challenges faced by Europe and Ibero-America in the current migratory work environment, identify common problems and opportunities, and share experiences of institutions from both continents. The meeting was opened by the rector of the university, José Vicente Saz Pérez, and attended by representatives from 16 countries and international organizations. The Secretary-General of the Ibero-American General Secretariat made a special mention of the Multilateral Ibero-American Social Security Convention and called on six countries to join it. The need to regulate and manage labor migration and ensure it contributes positively to the development of countries of origin and destination was discussed. The meeting concluded with the importance of advancing labor equality and paying attention to vulnerable groups, and the proposal to strengthen synergies between European coordination mechanisms and the Multilateral Ibero-American Social Security Convention.

title: La descarbonización, un reto para las industrias y una oportunidad para Andalucía
summary: Directors of four major companies in the Andalusian region, including Francisco Fernández de la Mata of Acerinox, discussed the challenges and opportunities of the energy transition and the implementation of green hydrogen in factories. The companies, committed to reducing their carbon footprint, are exploring renewable energy, sustainable fuels, and green hydrogen as alternatives to fossil fuels. However, the transition is not without uncertainties and challenges, particularly when it comes to factory renovation. The EU aims to achieve climate neutrality by 2050, with a 55% reduction in emissions by 2030. The companies also discussed the need for a flexible regulatory framework, support from the administration, and training programs to adapt to the new energy landscape.

title: La Ciuden evalúa con tres empresas los riesgos de implantar la energía solar
summary: The Fundación Ciudad de la Energía (Ciuden) has partnered with three private companies to launch the Flexgenera project, which aims to evaluate the risks and benefits of implementing photovoltaic energy as an alternative to decarbonization. The project will last for a year, with a budget of €400,000, and will use the new solar park with bifacial panels of 300 kilowatts installed at Ciuden's headquarters in Cubillos del Sil. The project will test cybersecurity, environmental sustainability, and carbon footprints, as well as hybridization between technologies that facilitate energy storage. The CEO of Isemaren highlighted the importance of verifying that the energy produced by a solar park is reliable and possible to store. The project is an example of public-private collaboration and aims to develop renewable energy projects for a minimum of 25 to 30 years. F. Javier de la Mata de la Mata, the director of operations of Ciuden, is leading the project.

title: ATA Aragón elige nuevo presidente: Jorge Serrano, autónomo desde hace más de 28 años
summary: Jorge Serrano Pérez ha sido elegido como el nuevo presidente de la Asociación de Trabajadores Autónomos de Aragón (ATA Aragón). Ha sido trabajador autónomo desde marzo de 1994 y anteriormente ha sido presidente de las asociaciones de transporte Tradime y Fetransa. Serrano ha prometido trabajar para dignificar la figura del trabajador autónomo y fomentar su papel en la economía. También ha reconocido los desafíos que enfrentan los trabajadores autónomos en términos de obstáculos económicos y burocráticos. Aragón cuenta con casi 100.000 trabajadores autónomos, lo que supone una disminución del 1% respecto al año anterior. El sector del comercio ha sido uno de los más afectados, con una disminución del 3,3% en trabajadores autónomos en el último año. Mayte Mazuelas, la presidenta anterior de ATA Aragón, seguirá siendo miembro de la junta directiva del nuevo presidente.

title: La Universidad de Alcalá y la AECC firma un protocolo de colaboración
summary: The University of Alcalá (UAH) and the Spanish Association Against Cancer (AECC) in the province of Guadalajara have signed a collaboration agreement to carry out joint activities aimed at promoting interdisciplinary competencies and cooperation, volunteering, and sustainability, among others. UAH students, particularly those studying Nursing, Medicine, Psychology, and Teaching, will be able to undertake voluntary activities within the Association and transfer actions in educational centers. The agreement was signed by Carmen Heredia Martínez, President of the AECC in Guadalajara, and Carmelo García Pérez, Vice-Rector of the Campus of Guadalajara of the UAH. The signing ceremony was attended by other officials from both organizations.

title: 52 artistas con discapacidad intelectual reúnen su obra en la web de arte Plena inclusión
summary: The Plena inclusión website has collected the work of 52 artists who have intellectual and developmental disabilities from 13 regions in Spain. They have showcased 87 pieces in different fields such as painting, sculpture, illustration, and literature. The objective of the website is to promote the professional growth of these artists in the art world and to highlight their artistic proposals. One of the featured artists is Miguel Rodríguez Blanco, an artist with intellectual disabilities from Madrid. Plena inclusión emphasizes the significance of culture as a common ground where everyone can develop their talents and contribute their unique perspective. The website encourages other artists with intellectual and developmental disabilities to submit their work to be featured.

title: Former Palomar Student Recognized with Marine Corps Association Top Award - Palomar News
summary: Former Palomar College student, Staff Sgt. Victoria J. Graham, has been recognized as the Training and Education Command (TECOM) Faculty Advisor of the Year. As Chief Faculty Advisor at the Staff Non Commission Officer Academy (SNCOA) Camp Pendleton training program, Graham encourages Marines to take the Military Leadership program offered by Palomar College. She was one of six finalists from Marine Corps SNCO academies throughout the nation. Graham completed the Military Leadership Program at Palomar College last August. Palomar College started the Military Leadership Program in 2020, which allows Marines in Sergeant School to apply their coursework toward credits at the college. Students can earn 12 credit units followed by 2,000 hours on the job that can lead to an associate degree in Military Leadership from Palomar College.

title: Former Palomar Student Recognized with Marine Corps Association Top Award - Palomar News
summary: Former Palomar College student, Staff Sgt. Victoria J. Graham, has been recognized as the Training and Education Command (TECOM) Faculty Advisor of the Year by the Marine Corps Association. Graham is the Chief Faculty Advisor at the Staff Non Commission Officer Academy (SNCOA) Camp Pendleton training program, where she encourages Marines to take the Military Leadership program offered by Palomar College. The program, which began in 2020, allows Marines in Sergeant School to apply their coursework toward credits at the college and earn an associate degree in Military Leadership. Graham completed the program last August and says it encourages Marines to pursue a college degree and shows them the experience they are gaining will serve them. Palomar College Superintendent/President, Dr. Star Rivera-Lacey, says the program provides an educational pathway for students who may not think of a college degree as they serve their country.

title: Phylogenetic relationships of the Geoplaninae land planarians (Platyhelminthes, Tricladida) assessed with a total ...
summary: The article discusses the evaluation of the evolutionary relationships of Geoplaninae land planarians using both physical and genetic data. The study resulted in the most accurate hypothesis for the Geoplaninae phylogeny to date, but some older clades are still unknown. The phylogenetic tree indicates that most of the identifying physical characteristics of the species are similar, but some higher-level groupings have unique shared characteristics. In a previous study, Marta Álvarez-Presas contributed to the genetic analysis of land and freshwater planarians. Additionally, a new species of the little-known genus Gigantea is described in the article. While this study is a step towards a complete understanding of Geoplaninae phylogeny, some older nodes remain unknown.

title: Marta Álvarez: «La medalla de plata de Doha me enorgullece y se la dedico a mi familia y al Club Natación La Venatoria»
summary: Marta Álvarez Gago, a swimmer from Club Natación La Venatoria, has won a silver medal in the Masters 50 category at the World Championships in Doha. She had previously won the European championship in the 100m breaststroke. Alvarez started swimming at a young age and was already a Spanish champion in her youth categories. She then went on to train at a technical center in Valladolid and at the Spanish Swimming Federation center in Malaga. After a 20-year break from swimming, she returned to the sport with the Masters. Alvarez has broken several national records in the 25m pool, and her success at the World Championships is a historic achievement for the sport in León and for Club Natación La Venatoria in particular. She dedicates her silver medal to her family and her club.

title: Las becas FERO reparten 240.000 euros para impulsar la investigación del cáncer de pulmón y de mama
summary: The FERO Foundation has declared the champions of its prestigious research scholarships and the V FERO-ghd Project's 24th edition. The ceremony was attended by over 700 people, and the scholarships rewarded advancements in enhancing immunotherapy in lung cancer, identifying biomarkers for immune checkpoint inhibitors' resistance, and explaining bone metastases in breast cancer. The Bosch Aymerich Foundation, the Ramón Areces Foundation, and hair products company ghd provided financial support, and a total of €240,000 ($279,000) was distributed, with €80,000 going to each researcher. Jon Zugazagoitia, Francisco Martínez, and Mariona Graupera were the winners.

title: La gran familia de 14 oftalmólogos de Borja Corcóstegui: 4 clínicas que abarcan hasta su sobrino
hco: SOCIEDAD ESPAÑOLA DE SUPERFICIEOCULAR Y CORNEA
summary: The Corcóstegui family has contributed 14 ophthalmologists to the Spanish healthcare system over the last 200 years. They founded the Institute of Ocular Microsurgery, which has four clinics across Spain and is part of the Miranza Group with 23 other clinics. Dr. Borja Corcóstegui is considered one of the most influential ophthalmologists in Spain's history. He brought new technologies in the 1980s that revolutionized eye health. The Corcóstegui family has been successful in the field of ophthalmology since the 19th century, with the importation of advances from Europe being a recurring theme. Borja Corcóstegui is the most renowned member of the family, having received 25 honorary distinctions and being considered one of the most influential doctors in Spanish ophthalmology.

title: Ramón Berra, nuevo director general de GenesisCare en España
hco: SOCIEDAD ESPAÑOLA DE SUPERFICIEOCULAR Y CORNEA
summary: Ramón Berra de Unamuno has been appointed as the new General Director of GenesisCare in Spain, a company that specializes in cancer treatments. Berra aims to grow the international company, which plans to invest €60m in the next few years to modernize its centers and technological equipment. Berra has over 20 years of experience in the healthcare and hospital sector, having worked for companies such as Viamed Salud, USP Hospitales, and Sanyres. GenesisCare has 27 centers in Australia, 10 in the UK, and 17 centers in Spain after acquiring IMOncology and Oncosur Grupo in 2016.

title: Los oftalmólogos plantean que los estudiantes reciban algunas clases al aire libre para frenar "la epidemia de miopía"
hco: SOCIEDAD ESPAÑOLA DE SUPERFICIEOCULAR Y CORNEA
summary: Ophthalmologists suggest that students should have some classes outdoors to curb the "myopia epidemic". The increase in myopia is due to children and adolescents spending more time indoors with electronic devices. The eye adapts to the new needs of seeing better up close and worse far away. The President of the Spanish Society of Retina and Vitreous (SERV) and Head of Ophthalmology at Hospital Vall d'Hebron in Barcelona, Dr. José García Arumí, and the Vice President of the SERV and Director of the Ophthalmology Department at the University Clinic of Navarra in Pamplona and Madrid, Alfredo García Layana, have suggested this. They explained that myopia has a genetic basis that mainly affects Asian and Mediterranean countries, but environmental factors also contribute. Spain has almost 20% of its population affected by myopia, while in central and northern Europe, cases are reduced by half. The high myopia will be the leading cause of blindness in the developed world this century.

title: Los nuevos tratamientos para la DMAE y las técnicas de cirugía infantil, avances en el Congreso de la SERV
hco: SOCIEDAD ESPAÑOLA DE SUPERFICIEOCULAR Y CORNEA
summary: The 26th annual Congress of the Spanish Society of Retina and Vitreo (SERV) highlighted new treatments for dry macular degeneration and pediatric surgical techniques. The event was attended by 1,300 professionals and aimed to promote the study of diseases of the retina, choroid, and vitreous, as well as pharmacological innovations in their treatment. The president of SERV, Dr. José García-Arumí, stated that the congress was a success and showcased new systems for imaging the retina, among other advancements. The challenges facing the field include treating previously untreated pathologies and minimizing the impact of increased treatment on patients. The congress also expressed concern about the "myopia epidemic," which is increasing due to children spending more time indoors with electronic devices. The next annual SERV congress will be held in Madrid in 2024.

title: Los nuevos tratamientos para la DMAE y las técnicas de cirugía infantil, avances destacados del Congreso de la SERV
hco: SOCIEDAD ESPAÑOLA DE SUPERFICIEOCULAR Y CORNEA
summary: The 26th annual congress of the Spanish Society of Retina and Vitreous (SERV) highlighted new treatments for dry macular degeneration and pediatric surgery techniques. The event, attended by over 1,300 professionals, aimed to promote and update studies related to the main diseases of the retina, choroid and vitreous, as well as pharmacological novelties in their treatment. The president of the SERV, Dr. José García-Arumí, emphasized the success of the meeting and the many challenges facing the specialty, including advancing the treatment of degenerative diseases of the retina, adapting resources to the demand for care, and incorporating new technologies and pharmacological innovations. García-Arumí also noted the need to minimize the impact of an increasing number of treatments on patients. The next SERV congress will take place in Madrid on March 8-9.

title: Alcalde de Ciénaga posesionó a la nueva secretaria de Salud del municipio
summary: Luis Alberto Tete Samper, the mayor of Ciénaga, has appointed Alexandra Patricia Cabezas Quiñones as the new Secretary of Health and Social Development. Cabezas is a nursing graduate from the universities of Mariana de Pasto Nariño and Jorge Tadeo Lozano, with 20 years of experience in healthcare in both the public and private sectors. She has previously served as the municipal health secretary in Putumayo, the coordinator for health risk management in the department, a public health surveillance advisor, an auditor in healthcare assurance, and a lecturer at IES INFOTEP. Cabezas' appointment is expected to help the Ciénaga Avanza de la Mano con el Pueblo administration to maintain and improve public health conditions.

title: Se posesionó la nueva secretaria de Salud de Ciénaga
summary: Alexandra Patricia Cabezas Quiñones ha sido nombrada como la nueva Secretaria de Salud y Desarrollo Social en Ciénaga por el alcalde, Luis Alberto Tete Samper. Cabezas es una profesional de enfermería con 20 años de experiencia en los sectores de salud públicos y privados. Anteriormente se desempeñó como Secretaria Municipal de Salud en Putumayo, coordinadora de Gestión de Riesgos en Salud en el departamento y asesora en vigilancia de la salud pública. Cabezas también es auditora en el área de garantía de salud en la Secretaría de Salud de Ciénaga y profesora en el IES Infotep. La administración de Ciénaga ha expresado su compromiso de mantener y mejorar las condiciones de salud de la población bajo su liderazgo.

title: BCW crea una división de comunicación ESG, Área de expertos
summary: BCW, a global public relations and public affairs consultancy, has launched a specialized ESG (Environmental, Social, and Corporate Governance) communication workgroup led by Olga Casco, director of the Media Strategy area in Madrid, and Izaskun Martínez, director of the BCW Barcelona office. The team will be joined by Isabel Roser, a sustainability specialist with over 25 years of experience, as a senior advisor. The new division will add value to all projects developed for the firm's clients. Isabel Roser, co-creator of the Spanish Association of RSE Executives, is excited to join BCW and contribute her background and relationships in sustainability and ESG in Europe, Spain, and Latin America. She believes that communication is more than ever the means for the purpose of companies, which cannot be competitive and leaders without a responsible exercise and proactive leadership for sustainable development.

title: New Spanish language Catholic store in South St. Paul seeks to reach fallen-away Catholic immigrants ...
summary: La Divina Providencia Catholic Store, a new store that sells Catholic gifts in Spanish, has opened in South St. Paul, Minnesota. The store is owned by Beatriz Perez Santana and aims to be a spiritual center for many immigrants. Most of the store's inventory is imported directly from Mexico. Perez Santana hopes that the store will help evangelize and reach new immigrants who often stop practicing their Catholic faith when they come to the United States. She talks to them about the faith, shares her testimony, and invites them to Mass. The store also hosts small groups for women, where they make tea and chat in Spanish. Perez Santana inspires female Hispanic immigrants to start a business despite obstacles they may face. The store has had a positive impact on the lives of many immigrants, and the Hispanic community, who previously did not attend Church, is now attending Mass through this little store.

title: Biosim y el CGE lanzan la primera guía para la formación enfermera en biosimilares | @diariofarma
hco: SOCIEDAD CANARIA DE PEDIATRIADE SANTA CRUZ DE TENERIFE
summary: The General Council of Nursing (CGE) and the Spanish Association of Biosimilar Medicines (Biosim) have launched the first Biosimilar Medicines Guide for Nurses. The guide aims to contribute to the training of nurses in the field of biosimilars, which are increasingly being used in various medical conditions. The guide covers basic concepts, currently approved drugs in Spain, and frequently asked questions about their use. The president of Biosim, Joaquín Rodrigo, believes that the publication of educational materials like this guide will broaden nurses' knowledge and improve communication with patients. Macarena González Cruz, a nurse at the Hospital Universitario Puerta de Hierro - Majadahonda, emphasizes the importance of nurses' knowledge of the administration process of each biosimilar and their ability to address patients' concerns to generate confidence and safety, leading to better therapeutic adherence. The guide is intended for all nurses, regardless of their work environment.

title: Speaking without vocal cords, thanks to a new AI-assisted wearable device
hco: SOCIEDAD CANARIA DE PEDIATRIADE SANTA CRUZ DE TENERIFE
summary: Bioengineers at UCLA have developed a wearable device that can assist individuals with dysfunctional vocal cords to regain their voice function. The device is a thin, stretchy patch that attaches to the skin outside the throat and detects movement in the larynx muscles. It uses machine-learning technology to convert those signals into audible speech with almost 95% accuracy. The device is self-powered and can function as a non-invasive tool for those who have lost their ability to speak due to vocal cord issues. It consists of two parts: a self-powered sensing component and an actuation component. The sensing component detects and converts signals generated by muscle movements into high-fidelity, analyzable electrical signals, which are then translated into speech signals using a machine-learning algorithm. The actuation component converts those speech signals into the desired voice expression. The device is designed to be flexible enough to move with and capture the activity of laryngeal muscles beneath the skin.

title: Soy farmacéutico y no te recomiendo mezclar paracetamol y antibióticos con estos alimentos
hco: SOCIEDAD CANARIA DE PEDIATRIADE SANTA CRUZ DE TENERIFE
summary: A pharmacist and spokesperson for the Official College of Pharmacists of Valladolid, José Manuel Santana, is cautioning against mixing certain medications with certain foods. For instance, the absorption of medication can be affected by certain components in food, such as carbohydrates and pepsin in apples and pears, which can limit the absorption of paracetamol and antibiotics. Santana also advises against taking iron supplements with milk, as the iron binds to calcium and is not absorbed, and avoiding foods containing vitamin K when taking anticoagulants. He also warns that seemingly harmless foods or herbal remedies, such as St. John's Wort, can interact with medication and cause intoxication. Santana stresses the importance of considering diet when taking medication and encourages pharmacists to ask patients about their diet to provide better care. However, the text has exceeded the word limit.

title: El Colegio de Veterinarios premia al toro 'Filósofo'
hco: SOCIEDAD CANARIA DE PEDIATRIADE SANTA CRUZ DE TENERIFE
summary: The College of Veterinarians in Seville has awarded its annual prize for the best bull of the April Fair to an animal called 'Filósofo', which was marked with the Olga Jiménez brand. Emilio de Justo cut off the bull's ears after a solid performance. The bull had been overlooked by the main juries in the city, but was highly valued by both fans and professionals in the bullfighting world. The bull's excellent performance was recognised with a posthumous lap of honour, crowning the long list of excellent bulls that marked the past April Fair. The award is the only one exclusively awarded by veterinarians, who are qualified professionals capable of making an objective assessment of the animal from the point of view of its morphological and functional characteristics.

title: ¿Regaliz? ¿Leche? Cuidado con los fármacos y los alimentos
hco: SOCIEDAD CANARIA DE PEDIATRIADE SANTA CRUZ DE TENERIFE
summary: The General Council of Official Colleges of Pharmacists in Spain has launched a campaign to raise awareness of the potential interactions between food and medication. Some foods and herbal remedies can affect the metabolism of many medicines, increasing the risk of toxicity. For example, liquorice can decrease the effectiveness of anti-hypertensive drugs, while lettuce and spinach can reduce the effectiveness of anticoagulants. The campaign aims to inform patients and professionals of the potential risks and to prevent them with appropriate advice. The council advises patients to consult their pharmacist before taking any medication, and to be aware of the potential interactions between certain foods and medicines. The campaign also highlights that certain foods, such as kiwis, oranges and peppers, can help the absorption and effectiveness of iron.

title: El área de salud Valladolid Oeste incorpora a 88 residentes
hco: FUNDACION PARA LA FORMACION DEL COLOFICIAL DE MEDICOS DE VALLADOLID
summary: The Valladolid Oeste health area has welcomed 88 new residents, with 60 joining the Río Hortega University Hospital and the remaining 28 joining primary care centers. This fills 95.6% of the 92 positions offered in the area. The hospital's management team, including Rosa Ibán Ochoa, formally welcomed the new residents, who will work in primary care services and hospital care. The health area has a level three hospital and 17 health centers that train professionals in excellence to meet the health care needs of citizens and the health system. The area offers specialty training units in psychiatry, ophthalmology, neurology, and pediatrics.

title: El Área de Salud Valladolid Oeste da la bienvenida a 88 nuevos residentes
hco: FUNDACION PARA LA FORMACION DEL COLOFICIAL DE MEDICOS DE VALLADOLID
summary: The Valladolid West Health Area welcomed 88 new residents in an event attended by Maria Belen Canton Alvarez, the manager of the Rio Hortega University Hospital, Elpidio Garcia Ramon, the manager of Primary Care Valladolid West, and Rosa Iban Ochoa, head of Studies and Teaching at ASVAO. The ASVAO is a renowned teaching area that includes a level 3 hospital and 17 health centers. Its main objective is to train excellent professionals who respond to the health care needs of citizens, society, and the health system. The new residents will be supported by the management and their new colleagues during their training years. Out of the 88 professionals, 28 will join Primary Care services, while 60 will join Hospital Care. The ASVAO has multiple specialized teaching units, including Allergology, Clinical Analysis, Pathological Anatomy, Anesthesiology, and Resuscitation, among others.

title: Ana Serrador: “La cardiología intervencionista es un área súmamente delicada, exige mucho sacrificio, preparación y ...
hco: FUNDACION PARA LA FORMACION DEL COLOFICIAL DE MEDICOS DE VALLADOLID
summary: Ana María Serrador Frutos es una destacada cardióloga de Valladolid, España. Se graduó con distinción en Medicina y Cirugía de la UVa y posteriormente obtuvo un Doctorado en Medicina de la Universidad de Huelva. Se especializó en cardiología intervencionista y obtuvo la Acreditación Oficial de la Sección de Hemodinámica y Cardiología Intervencionista en 2004. Actualmente, es la presidenta de la Sociedad Científica de Cardiología de Castilla y León y es miembro orgulloso de la comunidad de Tordesillas. Fue elegida como pregonera de la Semana Santa en Tordesillas para 2023, donde destacó la importancia de involucrar a los jóvenes en la celebración para inculcarles valores y ambiciones. Serrador Frutos cree que para ser un buen cardiólogo intervencionista, se necesita ser rápido en la toma de decisiones, trabajar bajo presión, tomar riesgos y tener un fuerte sentido de la vocación. También destaca la importancia de la educación continua y la investigación para mantenerse actualizado en las últimas técnicas y tecnologías.

title: CloserStill Media takes stake in OpenRoom Events - EN
summary: CloserStill Media has acquired a major stake in OpenRoom Events, a UK-based company that creates healthcare and retail events worldwide. OpenRoom Events offers one-on-one meetings, discussion groups, and content to build business communities and create networking experiences. The company was founded in 2004 by Fiona Horan and Emma Faure, who have over 30 years of experience producing business-to-business events and custom content. CloserStill Media is a leading events company that delivers events across various industry verticals, including veterinary, dental, healthcare, learning and HR, enterprise technologies, and eCommerce. The partnership with OpenRoom will enable CloserStill to access new markets and build on existing ones. OpenRoom will retain its existing operating structure with Horan and Faure leading the business as managing partners working alongside CloserStill Media’s leadership. Mayfield Merger Strategies acted as advisor in the deal. Gareth Bowhill, CEO of CloserStill Media, said that partnering with the OpenRoom team brings a unique set of skills and event formats to CloserStill Media.

title: Matthew A. Butler, MD - Hand and Upper Extremity
summary: Matthew A. Butler, MD is a hand and upper extremity surgeon who is certified by the board and works at HSS Florida. He has treated a wide range of conditions affecting the hand, wrist, elbow, and shoulder in patients of all ages for over a decade. Dr. Butler's approach is patient-centered to help others reach their goals and function at their highest possible level, using arthroscopic and minimally invasive treatments when possible. He prides himself on staying up to date on new and innovative surgical techniques. Dr. Butler completed his undergraduate studies at The University of Notre Dame and earned his medical degree at The University of Florida. He completed his orthopedic surgery residency training at Vanderbilt University followed by a fellowship in hand and microvascular surgery at the renowned Indiana Hand to Shoulder Center.

title: West Virginians speak out on community air monitoring bill
summary: West Virginians voiced their opposition to a bill that aims to limit the use of community-sourced air data by the state. However, the bill has moved forward without changes. If passed, it would prohibit the state Department of Environmental Protection from utilizing data collected by community air monitoring programs to support regulation or enforcement. At a hearing, 16 out of 18 speakers were against the bill, while the two in favor represented industries, including West Virginia Manufacturers Association President Bill Bissett. Suzanne King, a lifelong resident of Kanawha County, spoke against the bill, arguing that all West Virginians should have access to air quality data that reflects their local communities. The bill would also prevent community monitoring data from being used as evidence in court proceedings, including third-party lawsuits. Additionally, the DEP would only be able to consider community air data if the monitor is used in accordance with the manufacturer's standards and federal and state guidelines.

title: Donate to Help the Hurley's deal with terminal illness, organized by Simon Smith
summary: Simon Smith and two others are organizing a fundraiser on behalf of Dannielle Hurley, who has been robbed of her health due to Huntington's disease. Her husband, Stewart, has also been diagnosed with Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease, which has left him with a short time to live. The family needs to get their affairs in order and prepare for the worst. They are targeting $100,000 to complete their home renovation, relocate to a suitable house, and cover their endless medical expenses. The family has been off work and relies on government support. They need help to deal with the duo of unfathomable terminal illnesses. So far, $86,083 AUD has been raised of the goal. The family is grateful for everyone's help and asks for more donations and shares to make the fundraiser go viral.

title: 'I can't imagine doing anything else'
summary: Michael Westcott, a financial adviser at Absolut Wealth Management in South Africa, expresses his love for his job and how he can't imagine doing anything else.

title: Pérez y Salcedo, cuidarse por dentro para cuidar mejor
hco: SOCIEDAD NAVARRA DE MEDICINADE FAMILIA Y ATENCION PRIMARIA
summary: Pérez y Salcedo is a physiotherapy clinic that emphasizes personal care and innovation. The clinic employs 14 people, including ten physiotherapists, and places great importance on internal training to maintain a positive work environment. The COPADE Foundation has recognized Pérez y Salcedo for measuring its social impact and creating an action plan based on 17 sustainable development goals. The company strives to be a part of a just, sustainable, and prosperous society by caring for its employees with innovative initiatives, thereby benefiting society and the environment. The clinic also provides physiotherapy sessions and ergonomic training to personnel in various companies to reduce absenteeism and promote a better work environment. Pérez y Salcedo's dedication to its employees and society has earned it recognition for its efforts.

title: Sonia Martin has been Inducted into the Prestigious Marquis Who's Who Biographical Registry
hco: SOCIEDAD NAVARRA DE MEDICINADE FAMILIA Y ATENCION PRIMARIA
summary: Sonia Martin has been recognized for her expertise as a mental fitness coach for Positive Intelligence and has been inducted into the Marquis Who's Who Biographical Registry. She has a decade of experience in corporate coaching and is highly regarded as a mental fitness coach. In addition, she has worked as a project management consultant and Scrum master consultant for various organizations. Martin is a certified Scrum expert with a Scrum master accreditation, SAFe Agilist Certification 6.0, SAFe 5 Agilist certification, and Agile Coach certification. She plans to establish a non-profit organization called Elevate Mind and Body that will provide services to women in underserved communities. The organization will offer lymphatic enhancement therapy as a treatment in conjunction with mental fitness coaching, which includes guided meditation focused on neuropathways to promote positive thinking. Her ultimate goal is to empower women of color by promoting mental fitness and lymphatic enhancement treatments to accelerate physical and mental healing and provide guidance to navigate various challenges in their lives.

title: El Consell solicita un régimen simplificado para perceptores de la PAC por debajo de 5.000 euros
hco: SOCIEDAD NAVARRA DE MEDICINADE FAMILIA Y ATENCION PRIMARIA
summary: The Secretary of Agriculture in Valencia, Javier Bartolomé, has requested a simplified system for beneficiaries of the PAC who receive less than 5,000 euros per year. This request, supported by all agricultural organizations and the Federation of Agri-food Cooperatives of the Valencian Community, aims to facilitate the processing of applications for small-scale farmers. In Valencia, over 92% of direct aid beneficiaries receive less than 5,000 euros, representing 66% of all beneficiaries in Spain. However, they only receive 14% of the total budget allocated for this type of aid. Bartolomé believes that the establishment of a simplified system would not only benefit part-time farmers but also professional or main title farmers. The simplification would complete the simplification announced by the Ministry and the European Commission for all farms under ten hectares, which will be exempt from reinforced conditionality controls.

title: La conectividad física y la digital protegen a las zonas rurales de la despoblación
hco: SOCIEDAD NAVARRA DE MEDICINADE FAMILIA Y ATENCION PRIMARIA
summary: A recent study has analyzed the significance of physical and digital connectivity in attracting or retaining population in Spanish municipalities with populations ranging from 100 to 10,000 inhabitants. The gradual depopulation of a significant portion of Spain's territory has generated great interest and concern from various perspectives, including the adaptation of public services provision, the decline of the value of public capital and cultural assets, and the socio-cultural aspect of the loss of cultural heritage and environmental impact in rural areas. Institutions have developed and implemented measures to attempt to reverse this trend, including policies aimed at increasing the appeal of at-risk areas and alleviating the effects of population decline. The study affirms the importance of digital connectivity, as well as physical connectivity, in retaining the population in small and medium-sized Spanish municipalities. Fernando Merino de Lucas, a professor of Applied Economics at the University of Murcia, was one of the study's authors.

title: Cruz Roja Tehuacán destina más de 3 millones de pesos a servicios de emergencia
hco: SOCIEDAD NAVARRA DE MEDICINADE FAMILIA Y ATENCION PRIMARIA
summary: Cruz Roja Tehuacán, lidered by Leonardo Fernando Merino Pulido, has spent more than 3 million pesos on emergency and stabilization services, which are free of cost to patients. In 2022, the delegation covered a total of 4,523 services, including 3,634 emergency services, 435 scheduled transfers, and 43 rescues. The main costs incurred were gasoline, electricity, payroll, ambulance repairs, and operational expenses. These expenses added up to the total amount spent. The delegation covers 80% of emergency services in Tehuacán and surrounding areas, including those bordering the states of Oaxaca and Veracruz. The delegation does not receive any government or private funding and relies solely on donations and additional activities such as raffles to cover their expenses.

title: New materials for climate neutrality
summary: The Cluster of Excellence Materials for Energy Conversion & Storage has the goal of creating new technologies that are efficient for energy conversion and storage, which will help to achieve a society that is climate-neutral. The researchers leading the cluster are from the Vienna University of Technology, IST Austria, the University of Innsbruck, and the University of Vienna, with chemist Leticia González included. The team will develop nanocatalysts for electrocatalysis and photocatalysis, which will convert water and CO2 into hydrogen, synthetic fuels, and fine chemicals. Additionally, they will develop solutions for storing renewable energies in the form of chemical compounds. The researchers will combine their knowledge from various fields, including surface chemistry, surface physics, materials science, and computer simulation. This project is part of the excellence initiative excellent=austria, and the University of Vienna is involved in all five Clusters of Excellence.

title: UiB sends two biotechnology PhD students for industry internships through Digital Life Norway
summary: UiB has sent two PhD students, Parveen Gartan and Belén García Pascual, for a three-month internship program at the Centre for Digital Life Norway. The program aims to strengthen links between higher education institutions and non-academic organizations across biotechnology sectors. It provides students with training relevant to the professional world and working life. The program has been steadily expanding its network of host organizations internationally. This year, interns will head to Denmark, Sweden, and Slovenia, in addition to locations around Norway. The industry internship program presents a remarkable chance for aspiring researchers to venture into career avenues beyond academia. DLN facilitates valuable industry experience for talented young researchers, providing them with unique work experience and insights into the future job market. The program has so far given 24 PhD students the opportunity to explore biotechnology outside the academic setting.

title: Pablo López on Twins leadership: 'Willing to help, but willing to accept help'
summary: Twins pitcher Pablo López has expressed his desire to lead the team, taking after his former teammate Sonny Gray, who he regards as the toughest competitor he has ever seen. López has stated that he is willing to hold his teammates accountable and take accountability himself. Twins manager Rocco Baldelli has already designated López as the Opening Day starter for the second year in a row and has praised his strong desire to improve. López aims to pitch 200 innings for the team this season, after pitching a career-high of 194 innings last year. He also intends to refine a new pitch he developed last season, a sweeper with sharp horizontal break. López is hopeful that he can help the Twins win the playoffs this year.

title: La exposición a mezclas de metales podría aumentar significativamente el riesgo de cáncer de mama
summary: Researchers from the CIBERESP have identified significant links between exposure to certain heavy metals and the development of breast cancer in women. The study, which was carried out as part of the European Prospective Investigation into Cancer and Nutrition project, analysed the joint influence of these metallic elements on the risk of breast cancer. The researchers found significantly higher levels of copper in women diagnosed with breast cancer, while levels of zinc were higher in women without the disease. The most innovative contribution of the study was the analytical approach used to study the synergistic effect of exposure to mixtures of these compounds. The research team found that a specific profile with high levels of copper, manganese, antimony, and vanadium, along with low levels of zinc and tungsten, could quadruple the risk of developing breast cancer. The study highlights the importance of understanding how these elements can relate to cancer and the need for further research to fully understand the complex chemical interactions in the environment and their impact on human health.

title: La actividad física intensa, periódica y programada incrementa las posibilidades de sobrevivir al cáncer y disminuir los ...
summary: Intense, regular, and programmed physical activity increases the chances of surviving cancer and reduces the risks of metastasis. Soraya Casla, a doctor in Physical Activity and Sport Sciences, and Miguel Martín Jiménez, a professor of Medicine at the Complutense University of Madrid, coordinated a clinical trial with over 200 breast cancer patients for four years, demonstrating that patients who engage in intense physical exercise regularly increase their survival rates by 30% to 40%. The exercise also reduces the possibility of recurrence or second tumors and substantially decreases the risks of developing heart disease or diabetes. The routines of exercise should be personalized according to the physical conditions and antecedents of each patient. The medical position of Casla and Jiménez is supported by other studies, including a November 2021 publication in the Cancer Research journal titled "An Exercise-Induced Metabolic Shield in Distant Organs Blocks Cancer Progression and Metastatic Dissemination."

title: El Ayuntamiento entrega los II Premios al Mérito Deportivo a 45 deportistas locales con participación en competiciones ...
summary: The Estepona City Council has awarded the II Sports Merit Awards to 45 local athletes who successfully participated in official competitions in 2022. The city recognizes these athletes with a total of €20,500 in prize money, distributed among three categories based on their achievements. The mayor of Estepona, José María García Urbano, stated that the city's priority is to continue promoting initiatives that bring sports closer to citizens and improve their health while instilling values such as teamwork, effort, and companionship. Among the winners was Miguel Martín Jiménez, who won second place in the Andalusian Duathlon Cross M45-49 Triathlon Championship.

title: “La nueva inyección para ciertos tipos de cáncer de mama humaniza el tratamiento”
summary: José Ángel García Sáenz, responsible for the breast cancer unit at Madrid's San Carlos Hospital, has been involved in the presentation of Phesgo, a new treatment for HER2-positive breast cancer. The treatment reduces the time of treatment from an hour and a half to five minutes with a simple injection. The treatment is available in Spain and has been approved by the Ministry of Health. The new treatment has reduced the time spent in the hospital and has normalized the disease, making patients feel less sick. The quality of life of patients has improved, and the treatment has reduced the stigma of chemotherapy.

title: "Estamos cerca de la cronificación del cáncer de mama metastásico”
summary: José Ángel García Sáenz, an oncologist at Hospital Clínico San Carlos in Madrid, discusses the situation of metastatic breast cancer and the characteristics of the triple-negative or HR+ subtype, as well as the need for accelerated approval of drugs that are changing the natural state of the disease to reach patients as soon as possible. He also highlights the importance of identifying new antigens and receptors to continue controlling the disease in patients who have exhausted hormone therapy. The approval of new therapeutic indications for metastatic breast cancer by the FDA and EMA is also discussed, including drugs that target the protein Trop-2 and HER2-low, and the need for these drugs to become available to patients in Spain. García Sáenz believes that we are close to the chronicization of metastatic breast cancer.

title: El reto de mejorar la eficiencia en cáncer de mama y controlar el riesgo de recaída
summary: José Ángel García Sáenz, the head of the Breast Cancer Unit at the Hospital Clínico de Madrid, discussed the importance of improving precision medicine in breast cancer to increase efficiency and identify patients who can be cured at the recent American Society of Clinical Oncology (ASCO) congress. The conference showcased the latest research and innovation in cancer treatment, with a focus on improving efficiency and reducing the risk of relapse. Advances in early-stage breast cancer treatment included the use of CDK inhibitors and anti-HER2 therapy, while the use of ADCs or antibody-drug conjugates was highlighted for metastatic breast cancer. The goal is to eradicate micrometastases or minimal residual disease to prevent relapse. The conference also highlighted the importance of identifying patients at the highest risk of relapse to improve treatment outcomes.

title: De la inteligencia artificial a los anticuerpos conjugados: la nueva era que se abre en el cáncer
summary: The future of cancer treatment and diagnosis is being revolutionized by new technologies such as molecular medicine, artificial intelligence, and conjugated antibodies. These technologies are necessary to combat the increasing incidence of cancer, particularly in younger patients. The use of artificial intelligence in diagnosing cancer will increase the number of cured patients, but doctors will still be necessary for other functions. Anticorps conjugates are molecules that distinguish cancer cells and release a cytotoxic compound without affecting healthy cells. These conjugates are becoming increasingly effective in treating cancer, especially breast cancer. While genomics will contribute to cancer treatment, it will only be useful in patients predisposed to cancer. Lifestyle changes will also play a crucial role in preventing cancer, and early diagnosis is essential. The use of technology to develop a virtual twin of pediatric patients is already a reality, but researchers need more data to improve treatments. José Ángel García Sáenz, an oncologist and researcher, is excited about the improved precision of cancer treatments.

title: Biología molecular + tratamientos = abordaje futuro del cáncer de mama
summary: Advancements in molecular biology have enabled the development of more precise treatments for breast cancer, improving prognosis. Oncologist José Ángel García Sáenz emphasizes the importance of individualized treatment based on the biology of the disease, which can be determined through techniques such as mass sequencing to identify potential therapeutic targets. The three main types of breast cancer are luminal, HER2, and triple negative, each with its specificities. New treatments include hormone therapies to delay resistance, anti-HER2 therapies, and immunotherapy. Monitoring the disease through techniques such as liquid biopsy can identify new mutations and resistance, allowing for more sensitive disease progression observation. García Sáenz stresses the importance of research, individualization, and humanization in breast cancer treatment.

title: Roche reduce el tratamiento del cancer de mama a minutos
summary: Roche has received authorization from the Spanish Ministry of Health to finance the first treatment for breast cancer that combines two monoclonal antibodies in a single subcutaneous injection. The treatment, which integrates pertuzumab and trastuzumab, provides the same effectiveness in a matter of minutes compared to the previous intravenous method that required several hours. This new method is preferred by both healthcare professionals and patients and reduces the impact of treatment on the patient's daily routine. The director of medical affairs at Roche Farma España, Dr. Beatriz Pérez Sanz, believes that this authorization is a significant advance in the fight against breast cancer. Dr. José Ángel García Sáenz, a medical oncologist at the Hospital Clínico San Carlos in Madrid, also supports this view, highlighting that patients can reduce their time in the day hospital, avoiding being there for full days to receive their treatments.

title: Sociedad de Oncología invita a conferencia Cáncer de Mama
summary: The Dominican Society of Oncology is inviting people to attend the conference "Abemaciclib Making History in Early Breast Cancer", which will be led by Dr. José Ángel García Sáenz, a medical oncologist and head of the Breast Cancer Unit in the Department of Medical Oncology at the San Carlos Clinical Hospital in Madrid. He is also an assistant professor at the Complutense University of Madrid. The conference will be moderated by clinical oncologist Dr. Leydi Paredes and will take place on March 29th at 7:00 pm at the JW Marriot Santo Domingo hotel.

title: El medicamento contra el cáncer de mama que reduce el tratamiento de hora y media a cinco minutos
summary: The Spanish Ministry of Health has approved Phesgo, the first breast cancer treatment that combines two monoclonal antibodies in a single injection and reduces patient time in hospitals dramatically. The drug is administered subcutaneously and is intended for the treatment of early and metastatic HER2-positive breast cancer, affecting approximately 20% of cancer patients. Until now, it was administered intravenously and required hours. The new formula, which combines two already established drugs, is associated with a reduction in healthcare costs and an improvement in the quality of life of patients. The drug is available in Spanish hospitals since May 2023. The approval of Phesgo follows the results of the phase III FeDeriCa trial, which found that the treatment was not less effective than intravenous infusion.

title: El 'milagro' del embarazo tras el cáncer de mama: "Piensas: 'O me muero o adiós al sueño de mi vida'"
summary: Less than 10% of breast cancer survivors are able to conceive a child due to the potential risk of relapse. However, a study involving Spanish participants has shown that pregnancy after breast cancer does not increase the risk of relapse, thanks to hormonal therapy. The study, called POSITIVE, found that pausing hormonal therapy for up to two years, followed by resuming it, did not increase the risk of cancer relapse in the short term. The study's coordinator, José Ángel García Sáenz, said that the results of the study gave hope to young women diagnosed with breast cancer who wished to conceive a child. The study included 72 Spanish women, and a total of 365 babies were born to participants from 20 countries.

title: La especialización tan elevada de los profesionales permite un abordaje innovador de numerosos tumores
summary: The Hospital Ruber Internacional in Spain has renewed its Service of Medical Oncology by incorporating a new team of highly specialized professionals. The team aims to offer personalized and cutting-edge oncological treatments to patients with a variety of cancers, including breast, prostate, lung, skin, bladder, kidney, and liver cancers. The new team is led by Dr. José Ángel García Sáenz and offers quality care through numerous specialties, such as the Breast Tumor Unit. The hospital is a leader in oncology in Spain due to its innovative treatments, clinical trials, and research, and is a reference center in Europe.

title: Disponible la suma de pertuzumab y trastuzumab en cáncer de mama HER2+
summary: Roche has announced that the Spanish Ministry of Health has approved the financing of Phesgo, a combination of Perjeta (pertuzumab) and Herceptin (trastuzumab) for patients with early and metastatic HER2+ breast cancer. This treatment is administered subcutaneously, which is an improvement over previous therapies that were administered intravenously, reducing patient discomfort and the time spent receiving treatment. This improvement in administration directly impacts the quality of life of patients. José Ángel García Sáenz, an oncologist at the Hospital Clínico San Carlos in Madrid, highlighted that the main advantage of this combination for patients is that "the treatment is humanized, as before the administration required hours while now it is done in just a few minutes."

title: El Hospital Ruber Internacional “fortalece” su Servicio de Oncología con un equipo de profesionales ...
summary: The Hospital Ruber Internacional has improved its Oncology Service by introducing a team of highly specialized professionals who provide advanced and customized treatments for various types of cancer, including breast, prostate, lung, colorectal, skin, bladder, kidney, and liver tumors.
