This team is at the forefront of recent medical advances in the field of oncology, ensuring quality care through specialized units such as the Breast Tumor Unit, led by Dr. José Ángel García Sáenz, which offers the best available treatment to achieve the highest rates of cure and survival. The team is well-versed in the latest treatment options and provides compassionate care to patients throughout their illness. The renewed Oncology Service at the Hospital Ruber Internacional also includes other key areas such as the Thoracic/Lung Tumor Unit and the Digestive Tumor Unit.

title: Luis Carvajal-Carmona appointed associate vice chancellor for the Office of Academic Diversity
summary: Luis Carvajal-Carmona has been appointed as the associate vice chancellor for the Office of Academic Diversity, effective from March 1, 2023, by the UC Davis Office for Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI). Carvajal-Carmona is a professor in the Department of Biochemistry and Molecular Medicine and is the associate director for the Inclusivity, Diversity, Equity, and Accessibility office. He is also the founding director of the Latinos United for Cancer Health Advancement initiative and of the Center for Advancing Cancer Health Equity at the UC Davis Comprehensive Cancer Center. The associate vice chancellor for the Office of Academic Diversity plays a key role in the DEI office to promote all dimensions of diversity among students and faculty and to support equitable ecosystems for student opportunity through the DEI's Hispanic-Serving Institution (HSI) initiative.

title: Natalia Galan Lopez | School of Sport, Exercise and Health Sciences
summary: Natalia Galan Lopez is a Doctoral Researcher at Loughborough University's School of Sport, Exercise and Health Sciences. She completed her BSc in Nutrition and Health at the University of Roehampton in 2019 and her MSc in Sport and Exercise Nutrition at Loughborough University in 2020, where she graduated with Distinction and a research project prize. Her MSc research project was survey-based and focused on heat adaptation and nutrition knowledge and practices of athletes and practitioners. Her PhD is a collaboration with the United States Olympic & Paralympic Committee (USOPC) and aims to provide evidence-informed recommendations to improve the sleep of athletes and optimize the health and performance of para-athletes and female athletes. Natalia is particularly interested in female athlete health and performance and has participated in collaborative international research projects in elite sport.

title: 40 UNDER 40: Natalia Lopez
summary: Natalia Lopez, an immigration law attorney, was recognized in Brownwood News' 40 Under 40 list. Lopez completed her education at Brownwood High School and Howard Payne University before attending Texas Wesleyan School of Law. During her time interning at non-profit organizations, she discovered her passion for immigration law. After working at a top immigration firm in Fort Worth for five years, she started her own firm and opened an office in Brownwood. Lopez is licensed by the Texas State Bar and is a member of the American Immigration Lawyers Association. She is also a member of the Howard Payne University Alumni Association and has established scholarships for students. The most rewarding aspect of her career is reuniting families.

title: Correction to: Mapping trust relationships in organ donation and transplantation: a conceptual model - BMC Medical ...
summary: This text is a correction to an article on mapping trust relationships in organ donation and transplantation. The changes made were to the acknowledgement section and funding section of the original article. María Victoria Martínez-López is one of the authors of the original article. The correction was published on March 5, 2024.

title: Please support St Clare Hospice nurse who is set to take on London Marathon
summary: St Clare Hospice nurse Victoria Martinez is participating in the London Marathon to raise funds for the hospice where she is employed. Martinez is a member of the nursing staff at St Clare Hospice in Hastingwood and is taking part in the marathon to ensure that the hospice can continue to provide support to families and patients. She has been following a 16-week training program and runs three to four times per week. The marathon is scheduled for June 1, 2024. If you would like to sponsor Martinez, you can do so by following the links in the article.

title: Mercado de vehículos eléctricos en Costa Rica pasó de 200 a 7.000
summary: Silvia Rojas, the executive director of the Costa Rican Association of Electric Mobility (ASOMOVE), stated in an interview that the market for electric vehicles in Costa Rica has significantly increased since the implementation of the Law of Incentives and Exemptions for Electric Transport in 2018. At that time, there were around 200 electric vehicles in the country, and now there are nearly 7,000. Rojas also highlighted the benefits of electric vehicles in terms of the environment, health, and economics. She added that there are now many agencies offering electric vehicles in Costa Rica, and the country has over 70 models to choose from, with prices starting at $19,000.

title: Inauguramos en Olavarría el policonsultorio UDOCBA Miguel Ángel Díaz – Te damos la bienvenida a IOMA
summary: IOMA, the most important health insurance company in Buenos Aires, has opened a new health center in Olavarría that provides various medical specialties with 100% coverage for its members. The center is the first polyclinic of UDOCBA Miguel Ángel Díaz, named after the union leader who fought against illegal charges for health services. Homero Giles, the president of IOMA, stressed the importance of providing access to health care and ensuring the right to health for over two million members. The new center is one of the more than 230 health centers that IOMA has throughout the province. The inauguration was attended by officials from IOMA, UDOCBA, and local residents. The Secretary General of UDOCBA, Alejandro Salcedo, expressed his gratitude for the support of the Minister of Health and the President of IOMA, which allowed for the opening of the new center.

title: State Senate Confirms Noemí Otilia Osuna Gallardo as California Energy Commissioner
summary: Noemí Otilia Osuna Gallardo ha sido confirmada por el Senado del Estado de California como Comisionada de Energía de California, nombrada por el gobernador Gavin Newsom. Gallardo es la primera latina nombrada como comisionada de la CEC y se desempeñará como comisionada líder de equidad y justicia ambiental. Supervisará el desarrollo e implementación de la Visión del Valle del Litio, que es una oportunidad para crear una economía sostenible del litio que mejore los resultados para los residentes de la región del Mar Salton. Gallardo fue la gerente principal de políticas públicas en Sunrun antes de unirse a la CEC como su asesora pública en 2019. También tiene experiencia legal y política previa como consultora en Gallardo Law and Policy Consulting y como investigadora principal en el Public Law Research Institute en la Facultad de Derecho de la Universidad de California en San Francisco (UC Law SF, anteriormente conocida como UC Hastings).

title: Helios launches AI supply chain analyst Cersi, raises $1.85m
summary: Helios, a start-up based in Virginia, has introduced Cersi, an AI-powered supply chain analyst, and raised $1.85m in a pre-seed round led by Supply Change Capital with the participation of January Ventures. Cersi combines supplier data of clients with "climate, economic, currency and political risk signals" to provide real-time actionable insights through a simple interface. The start-up, which is advised by food industry experts such as former Coca-Cola chief procurement officer Bill Hovis, will use the funds to expand its team and add more features to its platform. Helios is an analytics platform that employs AI to alleviate climate, economic, and political risks in the agricultural supply chain. The company's co-founders are Eden Canlilar (CTO), a former Google AI/ML engineer, and Francisco Martin-Rayo (CEO), a former principal at Boston Consulting Group. Helios aims to target big CPG (consumer packaged goods) companies, white-label goods manufacturers, and large agricultural commodity traders.

title: 9.000 trabajadores de 484 empresas vascas han recibido formación digital
summary: The digital skills program of the Basque Government has trained 9,000 workers from 484 companies in the region with a budget of €2.5m. Leyre Madariaga, Director of Digital Transformation and Entrepreneurship at the Basque Government, emphasized the significance of digital competencies in the Basque digital transformation strategy at a recent event. The program, which started two years ago, utilizes exclusive technology to implement the European model of digital skills training. Madariaga also revealed the forthcoming introduction of an extensive website on digital competencies that will combine existing resources in one location.

title: Vall d'Hebron has participated in the creation of a guide for the surgical treatment of gastroesophageal reflux in obese ...
summary: Vall d'Hebron University Hospital professionals have participated in the development of a guide for the surgical treatment of gastroesophageal reflux created by the Society of American Gastrointestinal and Endoscopic Surgeons (SAGES). The guideline has the participation and approval of six international scientific societies, making it a document with worldwide scope. The paper was signed by 26 experts, with Dr. Ramon Villalonga being the only Spanish representative. The final text has made it possible to create a visual treatment algorithm that serves as a guide for both the patient and healthcare personnel. The guide includes preoperative tests, non-invasive techniques, and the treatment of patients with obesity. The research team classified patients into two categories and proposed various interventions, including laparoscopic fundoplication, MSA, endoscopic fundoplication, TIF 2.0, and Stretta. The scientific team recommends using these techniques only with people who have mild symptoms and fear an intervention. The guide aims to help in the treatment of this disease, which affects between 8.8% and 25.9% of the European population.

title: Dos estudios de Vall d'Hebron reciben becas para estudiar
summary: Two studies conducted by the Hospital Universitario de Vall d'Hebron and the Vall d'Hebron Institute of Research (VHIR) have recently received grants from the Spanish Society of Obesity Surgery (SECO) and the Spanish Association of Surgeons (AEC). The studies aim to investigate the benefits of physical exercise for individuals undergoing bariatric surgery. One study will examine the effectiveness of gamification in a physical exercise program to prevent muscle loss after bariatric surgery, while the other will explore the advantages of implementing a physical prehabilitation program in bariatric surgery. Both studies will be led by Dr. Ramon Vilallonga, head of the Endocrine, Metabolic, and Bariatric Surgery Unit at the Hospital Universitario Vall d'Hebron and principal investigator of the General Surgery group at VHIR. The SECO and AEC grants are intended to encourage research among their members.

title: La Sociedad Española de Cirugía de la Obesidad y Enfermedades Metabólicas acredita la pericia de Vall d'Hebron en ...
summary: The Hospital Universitario Vall d'Hebron has been accredited by the Spanish Society of Obesity Surgery and Metabolic Diseases (SECO) for their work in the Comprehensive Obesity Treatment Unit. This accreditation recognizes their good clinical practices in treating obesity, as well as their technical and human resources. Vall d'Hebron performs 150 to 200 bariatric surgeries annually on patients with morbid obesity and associated health problems, whose body mass index is greater than 35 kg/m2. Dr. Ramon Vilallonga, Head of the Bariatric and Endocrine Surgery Section of the Comprehensive Obesity Treatment Unit, is a member of SECO and an expert in robotic surgery at the national and international level. The accreditation standardizes good clinical practices in treating patients with obesity, as well as the technical and human resources of each center in bariatric and metabolic surgery and their experience.

title: Cambiamos el enfoque del abordaje de la obesidad: de contar quilos a buscar las causas del sobrepeso a través de la ...
summary: The Unit of Comprehensive Treatment of Pediatric Obesity at Vall d'Hebron has been recognized as a center of excellence by the European Association for the Study of Obesity. This model provides treatment for obesity at all stages of life, with a personalized approach that recognizes that there may be underlying biological, genetic, or mental health disorders behind insatiable appetite. The treatment is provided by multidisciplinary teams of experts in endocrinology, nutrition, psychology, psychiatry, bariatric surgery, pediatrics, and nursing, with a holistic approach to adiposity, body composition, and metabolic health management. The unit is involved in research to offer innovative treatments, including new drugs for obesity, and collaborates on the BIO-STREAMS project to promote healthy habits among children and families. The bariatric surgery team at Vall d'Hebron is also conducting research to address obesity and related diseases.

title: Job Research Foundation Announces 2023 Grant Recipients
hco: GRUPO ANDALUZ DE INFECTOLOGIAE INMUNOPATOLOGIA PEDIATRICA
summary: The Job Research Foundation has announced the recipients of its 2023 grant, which funds scientific research for Job Syndrome, a rare multisystem immunodeficiency disorder. The foundation aims to find a cure for the disease and improve treatments for patients suffering from it. Since 2019, the foundation has funded 14 scientific research projects from scientists in Australia, Germany, Spain, the US, and the UK. The $200,000 research grants are distributed over a two-year period. The recipients of the fifth round of grant funding are from Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai, New York, and Garvan Institute of Medical Research, Darlinghurst, Australia. Olaf Neth, MD, PhD, was a principal investigator and head of department/pediatric infectious diseases and immunodeficiency unit at Hospital Infantil Virgen del Rocio, Sevilla, Spain, and was a previous recipient of the grant.

title: Gyrls in the H.O.O.D. looks to end “period poverty”
summary: Girls in the H.O.O.D. Foundation has opened a new center in Chicago's South Side to end "period poverty," a situation where a person who is menstruating cannot afford or doesn't have access to menstrual hygiene products. The center will provide support to teen girls, including hygiene products, pads, tampons, underwear, and social services through existing programs. It will also provide pregnancy tests, emergency contraception, reproductive and sexual health education, and job training workshops. The center is open from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. Monday through Saturday. Founder Chez Smith wants the center to be a place where girls can go in and ask questions or just hang out. She also wants to counter negative stereotypes about young girls growing up and living on the South Side. Venisha Bonds is the center's operations manager, and she greets every girl that walks into the center with a hug to break down barriers and make them feel comfortable.

title: Antonio Rodríguez sustituirá a Durich como director general de Consum por su jubilación
summary: Antonio Rodríguez Lázaro will replace Juan Luis Durich Esteras as the new director general of the Consum cooperative in February 2024, following Durich's retirement. Antonio Rodríguez, who is currently the director of store management, has been with Consum since 1992 and has held various positions, including director of logistics and director of customer relations. Under Durich's leadership, Consum has grown to become the sixth-largest food distribution company in Spain, with a turnover of €3.8 billion in 2022 and over 19,000 employees. Durich was named Director of the Year in 2008 and has positioned Consum as the largest cooperative by business volume in its area of influence and the first in terms of consumer members nationwide.

title: Preparación y respuesta a pandemias causadas por patógenos respiratorios: Comunicación de riesgos
summary: The importance of applying lessons learned from the COVID-19 pandemic in the Americas was emphasized by the Pan American Health Organization (PAHO) in its vision for the next five years. Communication of risks and community participation were identified as crucial skills to be strengthened for managing future health emergencies under the International Health Regulations framework. The PAHO's Infectious Hazard Management Unit and Emergency Communications Team conducted a series of three webinars on the significance of risk communication and community participation. The first webinar focused on communication for pandemic preparedness, the second on internal communication and coordination, and the third on public communication for promoting prevention behaviors. Sara Ferraz, a consultant on the Influenza Team at the Emergency Department of Health at PAHO, presented practical elements of risk communication.

title: EOP opens door to research | Binghamton News
summary: Alberto Torres, a junior psychology major at Binghamton University, shared his research on sexual violence at conferences in Boston and Belgium. Torres's parents came to the U.S. from Mexico and did not have the opportunity to attend college. He began his studies at the University of Albany but transferred to Binghamton during his sophomore year. With the assistance of peer mentors, he found his place in psychology and gained undergraduate research experience. Torres attended a mixer for EOP students hosted by the Undergraduate Research Center during his second semester at Binghamton, where he met Matthew Johnson, a professor and the director of clinical training in the Psychology Department. Johnson then introduced Torres to graduate student Quinn Hendershot and, eventually, invited him to join the Marriage Lab, run by Johnson in collaboration with Associate Professor of Psychology Richard Mattson. The lab studies intimate relationships, with a primary focus on sexual violence assessment and prevention.

The effectiveness of the current Covid vaccine against the Omicron variant is widely demonstrated, especially in preventing severe pneumonia and hospital mortality from Covid. The radio pharmacy service follows strict safety measures for professionals and patients, including the use of protective gear and limited exposure to radioactive products. The service also includes a gamma camera that generates images of anatomical structures illuminated by radio pharmaceuticals, facilitating diagnosis. The process of preparing radio pharmaceuticals generates radioactive waste, which is deposited in a special room until it is no longer radioactive. title: Juaneda Hospitales incorpora el primer equipo Brainlab de neuronavegación con TAC robotizado intraoperatorio de ...
hco: SOCIEDAD VALENCIANA DEMEDICINA PREVENTIVA Y SALUD PUBLICA
summary: Juaneda Hospitales has incorporated the first complete Brainlab equipment in the Balearic Islands, consisting of a "Curve" neuronavigator and a "Loop-X" intraoperative robotized CT, both of the latest generation. The neuronavigator enables minimally invasive and more precise surgeries in highly complex surgical specialties such as those performed in the trunk and head in Neurosurgery, Traumatology, Maxillofacial Surgery, and Otorhinolaryngology. This technology represents a radical change in the safety of the most complex interventions, as it allows for prior surgical planning and verification of the final result, guided by an AI system and augmented reality elements. The Brainlab system allows surgical planning by showing intervention models and all possible surgical outcomes in advance, to avoid unforeseen events. The system is used intraoperatively, and both devices are used together during surgery. The TAC generates images that are immediately transferred to the navigator, which helps the surgeon to identify the structures being intervened in real-time. The Brainlab processes what it sees through images and makes proposals based on AI. The surgeon, who knows the patient, makes all the decisions. The system increases safety, allows for minimally invasive interventions, and shortens patient recovery. The equipment was launched by Dr. Alexis Palpan, a neurosurgeon at Juaneda Hospitales.

title: El proyecto 'Desatar al anciano y al enfermo de Alzheimer' cumple 20 años
summary: The Confederación Española de Organizaciones de Mayores (CEOMA) celebrates the 20th anniversary of the "Desatar al anciano y al enfermo de Alzheimer" project, which aims to provide elderly and Alzheimer's patients with a life free of any kind of restriction. The program has demonstrated that it is possible to care for the elderly in residences without restraints, and has received numerous awards for its innovative approach. The program's technical director, Dr. Antonio Burgueño Torijano, has been instrumental in bringing together hundreds of centers that have become "suspension-free centers" as part of the project. The project will celebrate its anniversary with an event called "Ganando un futuro mejor, con hechos, para las personas mayores" on November 22, 2024, with the collaboration of Savia Residencias, Emera España, Sanitas, and IMSERSO.

Gorrotxategi wants every child to have a pediatrician and emphasizes the importance of social care for mental health in children and adolescents. title: Aepap nombra a Pedro Gorrotxategi como nuevo presidente de la asociación

He has also been president of the Basque Association of Primary Care Pediatrics and president of the Health Sciences section of Eusko Ikaskuntza, the Society of Basque Studies. Gorrotxategi has pledged to dedicate his efforts to the dignification of the profession and the healthcare of children and adolescents. title: El Dr. Pedro Gorrotxategi, nuevo presidente de la Asociación Española de Pediatría de Atención Primaria (AEPap)

He has been coordinating the labor-professional working group of AEPap since 2016 and was also the vice president of AEPap since 2020. Gorrotxategi has pledged to dedicate his efforts towards the dignification of the profession and the healthcare services provided to children and adolescents. He completes the new board of AEPap along with five other doctors.

title: “Es posible la investigación en Atención Primaria”
summary: Pedro Gorrotxategi, a pediatrician in Pasai San Pedro, conducted a study on the use of screens in children under six years old. The study included 15 health centers in Gipuzkoa and found that 66% of children under two years old use mobile devices for half an hour every day, despite pediatricians completely discouraging their use. The study also found that screens are used during meals and before bedtime. The research will be presented in March at the Congress of Primary Care Pediatrics. Gorrotxategi emphasizes the importance of conducting research in primary care as it allows for the analysis of day-to-day habits and is an attractive option for new residents. He also notes that screens can delay speech development and reduce human interaction, which can affect certain aspects of a child's development.

title: Los graves perjuicios del uso abusivo de pantallas en los niños más pequeños
summary: A study conducted by the Programa de Salud Infantil de Osakidetza has revealed that 66% of children under the age of 2 in Gipuzkoa use screens, despite the World Health Organization's recommendation against it. The study also discovered that children between the ages of 2 and 6 should only use screens for a maximum of one hour per day, but the average usage is 90 minutes. Pedro Gorrotxategi, a pediatrician at Osakidetza in Pasai San Pedro, explained that this early consumption "delays language development in younger children, increases body mass index in slightly older children, and reduces sleep hours." Gorrotxategi recommended parents to communicate more with their children, avoid screens during meal times and bedtime, and encourage more direct oral communication between parents and children.

title: Gorrotxategi: “Queremos que los MIR vean la Pediatría en Atención Primaria como algo atractivo”

Gorrotxategi wants to increase the representation of primary care pediatricians in universities and in the national commission of the specialty. He also wants to make primary care more attractive to residents, who are currently underrepresented in the commission. title: «Si quieres tener pediatras suficientes debes ofrecer mejores condiciones de trabajo»

title: Los pediatras denuncian que faltan al menos 400 profesionales en España y que más de 500.000 niños siguen sin médico
summary: Pediatricians at the 20th Congress of the Spanish Association of Primary Care Pediatrics (AEPap) have reported a shortage of between 400 and 2,000 pediatricians in Spain, with over half a million children still without a doctor to attend to them. The doctors also highlighted that strikes in 2023 had not reduced the pressure on their consultations. Pedro Gorrotxategi, vice president of AEPap, said that the strikes had not solved the problems of Spanish pediatrics, with professionals still seeing between 30 and 55 children per day. Over 50% of primary care pediatricians in the Balearic Islands, Catalonia, Madrid, Ceuta and Melilla have patient lists of over 1,000 children. AEPap’s president, Concepción Sánchez Pina, said that more than a third of primary care pediatricians in Spain have lists of more than 1,000 patients.

title: Sin mejoras en la situación de la Pediatría de Atención Primaria

Pedro Gorrotxategi, the Vice President and candidate for the presidency of the Spanish Association of Primary Care Pediatrics (AEPap), has analyzed the situation and found that the agreements made with the Autonomous Communities are only partially fulfilled. Only Aragon has made improvements in the remuneration of the teaching activity. The excess quota is not the only problem; the limitation of the number of children on daily agendas has not been successful, and the number of patients seen remains the same. The AEPap is holding its 20th National Congress on Pediatric Update in Madrid, where more than 700 professionals will discuss issues such as nutrition, infections, and the effect of climate change on children's health.

title: El 70% de los niños menores de dos años de Gipuzkoa usa pantallas

title: Trends in child and adolescent mental health in Catalonia in the context of the COVID-19 pandemic during the 2020 ...

The study found that at the beginning of the school year, 9.8% of the patients were probable cases of psychopathology compared to 6.2% at the end of the year. The perception of the level of preoccupation of the children for their health and that of their family was related to presenting psychopathology, especially at the beginning of the year, with the perception of a good family atmosphere being always related to lower risk. The authors of the study suggested that these findings should be taken into account when weighing the risks and benefits of high-dose chemotherapy and autologous HSCT for lymphoma patients. In a commentary accompanying the study, Anna Sureda, MD, PhD, and Eva Domingo-Domenech, MD, both of the University of Barcelona, emphasized the importance of carefully considering other treatment options, particularly with the emergence of new potentially curative treatments for lymphoma, such as chimeric antigen receptor (CAR) T-cell therapy.

title: A new paediatric cancer unit at CNIO is researching to bring personalised therapies to children as well

summary: The National Cancer Research Centre (CNIO) has established a new paediatric cancer unit, the IdiPAZ-CNIO Mixed Unit for Paediatric Haematology and Oncology Clinical Research, to bring personalised therapies to children with cancer. The unit will investigate alternative therapies for rare tumours, immunotherapies, new mechanisms to attack brain tumours, and the creation of organoids and labs-on-a-chip to test drugs. Childhood cancers are cured with treatment in eight out of ten cases, but it is also the leading cause of death in children and teenagers in developed countries. Traditional, aggressive, and highly toxic cancer treatments are still generally used in children and teenagers due to a lack of understanding about paediatric cancer. The new unit will be led by paediatric oncologist Antonio Pérez-Martínez, who believes that collaboration with CNIO is essential to develop targeted and personalised strategies.

Two patients, Maria and Mateo, and Dr. Antonio Pérez Martínez, director of the project and the Pediatric Hemato-Oncology Service at La Paz Hospital, made the honorary kick-off before the Atlético de Madrid-FC Barcelona match. The Foundation has also supported 'La Sonrisa de María', a project led by an 11-year-old girl with Sarcoma of Ewing, which raises funds for the Hospital Niño Jesús.

title: Una nueva unidad de cáncer pediátrico en el CNIO investiga terapias personalizadas para niños
hco: GETTHI - GRUPO ESPAÑOL ONCOLTRANSVERSAL Y TUM HUERFANOS E INOx
summary: The Centro Nacional de Investigaciones Oncológicas (CNIO) has launched a new unit, directed by pediatric oncologist Antonio Pérez-Martínez, to investigate personalized therapies for children with cancer. The new unit will focus on researching new drugs for patients who do not respond to current treatments, personalized treatments that use the immune system to attack tumor cells, and monitoring treatment responses through liquid biopsies. The research will also involve using organoids or 3D cell cultures and lab-on-a-chip devices for laboratory analysis. The unit will investigate specific tumors, including hematological tumors, high-grade brain tumors, neuroblastomas, and sarcomas, with a focus on detecting and treating these cancers earlier and more effectively. Children's tumors are different from those in adults, and current treatments are often aggressive and toxic, making personalized treatments necessary.

title: El CNIO crea una unidad de cáncer pediátrico para incorporar terapias dirigidas y personalizadas
hco: GETTHI - GRUPO ESPAÑOL ONCOLTRANSVERSAL Y TUM HUERFANOS E INOx
summary: The National Center for Oncological Research (CNIO) has created a new unit in collaboration with the University Hospital La Paz Research Institute (IdiPAZ) called the Mixed Unit of Clinical Research in Pediatric Oncohematology. The unit aims to bring personalized therapies to pediatric cancer patients, incorporating strategies developed for adults. The unit will focus on developing new immunotherapies, new mechanisms of attack for brain tumors, and creating organoids and labs-on-a-chip to test drugs. The unit will also investigate how to monitor treatment response using liquid biopsy. The unit will use the CNIO's ability to analyze large amounts of genomic data to search for new drugs for patients who do not respond to current treatments. The unit will also study personalized treatments that use the immune system to attack tumor cells. The unit will investigate how to infiltrate drugs into high-grade brain tumors and neutralize neuroblastoma by targeting how its cells metabolize iron. The unit will also continue to research cellular therapies with antibodies to prevent metastasis in sarcomas. The unit's director is pediatric oncologist Antonio Pérez-Martínez.

Pérez-Martínez stresses the need for more targeted and personalised treatments for children, who are currently treated with aggressive and highly toxic therapies. The unit will explore new immunotherapies, new mechanisms for attacking brain tumours, and the creation of organoids and labs-on-a-chip for drug testing. Childhood cancer is a rare disease, but is the leading cause of death among children and adolescents in developed countries, and its therapies have not progressed at the same rate as adult cancer treatments.

title: Treatment with bendamustine prior to CAR T-cell therapy in patients with refractory large B-cell lymphoma associates ...
hco: GETTHI - GRUPO ESPAÑOL ONCOLTRANSVERSAL Y TUM HUERFANOS E INOx
summary: A study conducted by the Experimental Hematology Group of Vall d'Hebron Institute of Oncology and the Advanced Therapies Program of Vall d'Hebron University Hospital's Hematology Service discovered that patients suffering from refractory large B-cell lymphoma (LBCL) who received chimeric antigen receptor (CAR) T-cell therapy and bendamustine treatment before apheresis had a reduced progression-free survival and overall response rate. Bendamustine, a form of chemotherapy, is known to have harmful effects on patient lymphocytes. This study, published in the Journal of Clinical Oncology, is the first to report on the negative impact of recent exposure (within 9 months) to bendamustine as an independent factor leading to poorer outcomes of CAR-T cell therapy in LBCL patients. The study involved 439 patients who received CAR T-cell therapy as a third or later line of treatment at 7 European sites. Pere Barba, the Director of the Advanced Therapies Program of HUVH's Hematology Service, Clinical Investigator of the same VHIO Group, and corresponding author of this article, suggests that bendamustine should be avoided when possible in patients with refractory large B-cell lymphoma who are potential candidates for CAR T-cell therapy.

The development of new therapies for children with cancer is essential to improve patient outcomes and reduce short- and long-term side effects. The authors argue that there is interest in platform clinical trials, in which different drug combinations can be studied at the same time and the differences compared to monotherapy with standard treatment can be analyzed.

title: Entrevista a la Dra. Rosario Azcutia sobre osteoartritis

summary: María Rosario Azcutia Gómez, who is the director of Continuity Assistance at the Hospital Universitario 12 de Octubre, highlights the significance of the primary level in correctly diagnosing and referring patients who require particular rehabilitation, intervention, or surgery for osteoarthritis. She further emphasizes the importance of communication between professionals of both levels to prevent unnecessary referrals or resolve any queries. The primary level plays a crucial role in managing osteoarthritis, from identifying patients who need hospital referral to providing education and managing symptoms with physiotherapists, nurses, and primary care physicians. Due to the chronic nature and high prevalence of the disease, it is the primary cause of permanent sick leave and the most common reason for patients on the waiting list for external consultations. Azcutia recommends optimizing diagnosis and treatment at the primary level and avoiding premature re-referrals and surgeries to reduce costs for the healthcare system.

He also emphasized that the new government is committed to serving the region's citizens and will prioritize responsibility, commitment, loyalty, and absolute dedication. title: Murcia destinará 30 millones de euros para reducir las listas de espera en 2024
summary: The Health Department of the Region of Murcia has announced an increase in the budget for the year 2024, allocating an additional 35% resulting in an investment of €30.4 million to improve health centers and hospitals. The main objective of this increase is to reduce waiting times in the regional health system. The Health Minister, Juan José Pedreño, highlighted that the health budget will reach €2.503 billion, 7.14% more than in 2023, equivalent to an increase of €163 million. Of the €30.4 million budgeted for 2024, €28 million will be allocated to reducing waiting lists for surgeries, consultations, and specialized tests, while the remaining €2.4 million will be used to keep primary health care centers open in the afternoons. Additionally, €22.5 million will be allocated to the vaccination program in 2024, which represents an increase of €4.7 million compared to 2023. This increase will allow the expansion of the regional vaccination schedule, including the vaccine against rotavirus and expanding coverage against herpes zoster for people between 65 and 80 years old.

title: Pedreño admite que no hay médicos de familia para cubrir «ni siquiera» la mitad de las plazas creadas el año pasado
summary: Juan José Pedreño, the Health Minister of the Murcia region in Spain, has acknowledged that there are insufficient family doctors to occupy even half of the 111 new positions created last year. title: El objetivo de Juan José Pedreño: rebajar las listas de espera que dejó el coronavirus
summary: Juan José Pedreño, the Health Minister of the Murcia regional government, has denied that his department is hiding waiting lists for specialist appointments or surgeries. Pedreño also announced that various plans have been launched to tackle the issue, including one this year with a budget of €22 million. The Minister emphasized the importance of health as a priority for the government, with efforts focused on promoting health, preventing diseases, and strengthening primary care services. He also mentioned that the government will continue to develop its mental health strategy, which includes hiring over 200 professionals and building new centers to address these issues.

The region has one of the lowest mortality rates in the country, thanks to the strength of the system and the work of professionals. The council is taking steps to reduce bureaucratic workload, improve access to training and research, encourage multidisciplinary care, and reorganize care circuits to increase efficiency. The council has approved a historic budget for healthcare, with nearly 40% of it being used to improve the health of citizens. The council is also finalizing the new Primary Care strategy for 2023-2027, which includes a specific budget for primary care and the creation of new positions to reduce the workload of professionals.

title: Comienza la saturación en urgencias hospitalarias y de atención primaria por la gripe | ORM
summary: The emergency rooms and primary care centers are overwhelmed due to a surge in respiratory infections, including flu, bronchitis, bronchiolitis, and COVID-19. title: López Miras anuncia la composición del nuevo Gobierno regional
summary: The President of the Regional Government of Murcia, Fernando López Miras, has announced the composition of his new executive team, which he describes as "balanced, focused on solving citizens' problems and open to dialogue." The team includes Juan María Vázquez Rojas as the Minister of Environment, Universities, Research, and the Mar Menor. Other members include Luis Alberto Marín González as Minister of Economy, Finance, and Business, Carmen María Conesa Nieto as Minister of Tourism, Culture, Youth, and Sports, and José Manuel Pancorbo de la Torre as Minister of Development and Infrastructure. López Miras emphasized that the structure of the new government respects the design of the previous government, with a few changes to the distribution of responsibilities. He also stated that the new team has ambition to make the Region of Murcia a better place and will work to overcome any obstacles.

title: Juan María Vázquez, consejero de Medio Ambiente, Mar Menor, Universidades e Investigación: veterinario con currículum en Madrid
summary: Juan María Vázquez Rojas, a veterinarian with a curriculum in Madrid, has been appointed as the new Minister of Environment, Mar Menor, Universities, and Research in the Murcia government. He faces the difficult task of rebuilding the administrative structure of the Environment department, which had lost prominence in recent years. Vázquez has extensive experience in research and has been a member of various scientific bodies. He has also been a national deputy for two terms, Secretary General of Universities and Science and Innovation during the Mariano Rajoy government, and Director General of Scientific and Technical Research in the Ministry of Economy and Competitiveness. Vázquez will have to address several challenges, including the protection and recovery of the Mar Menor and the multi-year funding plan for public universities in the region.

title: Juan María Vázquez Rojas: «Seguiremos defendiendo el 'Plan de Vertido Cero' del Mar Menor»
summary: Juan María Vázquez Rojas ha sido nombrado como el nuevo consejero de Medio Ambiente, Mar Menor, Universidades e Investigación en la región de Murcia en España. Será responsable de la recuperación del Mar Menor y las relaciones con el Ministerio para la Transición Ecológica, así como del financiamiento de las universidades públicas y las negociaciones con los rectores. Vázquez es veterinario y profesor de Medicina y Cirugía Animal en la Universidad de Murcia. Planea trabajar en los próximos meses para avanzar en la defensa del 'Plan de Cero Vertidos' para el Mar Menor y abordar el plan de financiamiento plurianual de las universidades públicas.

title: El veterinario Juan María Vázquez, nuevo consejero de Medio Ambiente y Universidades de Murcia
summary: Juan María Vázquez Rojas, un veterinario y académico, ha sido nombrado como el nuevo consejero de Medio Ambiente, Mar Menor, Universidades e Investigación para la Región de Murcia. Esto es parte de una reorganización gubernamental que tiene como objetivo aprovechar al máximo el presupuesto récord de la región para 2023 y avanzar en sus políticas. La creación de dos nuevos departamentos, incluido el encabezado por Vázquez, señala un cambio en las competencias y un enfoque en la protección y recuperación del medio ambiente. Vázquez tiene una amplia experiencia profesional, habiendo sido profesor de medicina y cirugía animal en la Universidad de Murcia, así como ocupando varios cargos en instituciones gubernamentales y académicas.

title: Juan María Vázquez supervisa la sostenibilidad medioambiental de un supermercado de Mercadona
summary: Juan María Vázquez, the Minister of Environment, Mar Menor, Universities, and Research, visited the Mercadona supermarket in La Noria and praised its sustainability efforts, including a 20% reduction in energy consumption, solar panels, electric vehicle charging points, and an automated LED lighting system. He also noted the company's focus on reducing plastic usage and proper waste management, with a goal to reduce plastic usage by 25%, make all packaging recyclable, and eliminate all waste generated. Mercadona has 63 stores in the Murcia region, 50 of which are considered efficient, and employs 3,000 people. The company has also donated 382 tonnes of food to 15 entities in the region and reduced CO2 emissions by 2,900 tonnes.

title: Juan María Vázquez empieza en Medio Ambiente con la pérdida del 25% de la plantilla de técnicos
summary:
Juan María Vázquez Rojas ha asumido el cargo de Consejero de Medio Ambiente, Mar Menor, Universidades e Investigación en la Región de Murcia, pero se enfrenta al desafío de perder el 25% de su personal técnico en los próximos meses, según los sindicatos UGT y CC OO.

Translated text: Juan María Vázquez Rojas has taken on the role of Counselor for Environment, Mar Menor, Universities and Research in the Region of Murcia, but faces the challenge of losing 25% of his technical staff in the coming months, according to UGT and CC OO unions.

title: La Región trabajará en la evaluación del cribado de hepatitis B en el embarazo | ORM
summary: The Region of Murcia will work with three other communities in evaluating the screening of hepatitis B during pregnancy. This study will not only evaluate the screening of hepatitis B during pregnancy but also ensure that the protocol is properly followed in the case of a newborn of a mother with this disease. José Jesús Guillén Pérez, the Director General of Public Health, emphasizes the importance of vaccinating newborns in the first hours of life and administering specific immunoglobulin to prevent transmission of the infection from the mother to the child. The Ministry of Health will begin a national evaluation of this screening and has selected Murcia, Madrid, Valencia, and Catalonia to participate. The World Health Organization urges countries to deepen their assessment of early detection programs for hepatitis B during pregnancy.

title: Salud recuerda que la prevención y el control son importantes para evitar la presencia de chinches de cama
summary: The Department of Health in Murcia, Spain, has emphasized the need for prevention and control measures to prevent bed bugs from infesting homes and communities. The Director General of Public Health and Addictions, José Jesús Guillén, spoke at a technical conference on bed bugs, stating that although they do not pose a health threat, their presence can lead to sleep disorders, stress, and damage to reputations. Early detection and prompt action are essential in preventing their spread, which can be achieved by keeping homes clean and tidy, regularly washing bedding and curtains in hot water, and using steam to eliminate bed bugs and their eggs. If there is a large infestation, professional pest control services should be sought. The conference also covered other vectors of infectious diseases and featured speakers from experienced pest control companies and medical professionals.

title: "Una barrera en la vacunación de HZ es la baja percepción del riesgo por parte de la población"
summary: "José Jesús Guillén Pérez, General Director of Public Health of Murcia, stated in an exclusive interview with Gaceta Médica that one of the barriers to vaccination against herpes zoster (HZ) is the low perception of risk by the population. He also mentioned that the government of Murcia is working to improve vaccine coverage and the connection between the health care system and public health to achieve better health outcomes. Guillén Pérez emphasized the need to promote health and disease prevention, including good vaccine coverage and screening programs. He also discussed the challenges of vaccinating against the flu, especially in the adult population, and the importance of having a unified national vaccination calendar. Additionally, he highlighted the importance of addressing antimicrobial resistance and the efforts being made in Murcia to increase surveillance and control of multiresistant microorganisms."

title: Isabel Ayala Vigueras, de la medicina rural al liderazgo del SMS
summary: Isabel Ayala Vigueras has been appointed as the new director of the Servicio Murciano de Salud (SMS) in Spain, replacing Asensio López Santiago. She previously worked as the head of Asistencia Sanitaria and has been praised for her excellent treatment of patients. She started her career in rural medicine and has since gained extensive experience in the healthcare sector. Vigueras will lead a team of all-female professionals, and her appointment has been seen as a positive step towards gender equality in the healthcare industry.

title: 5 Mujeres 'Empoderadas' al frente del SMS - El Canal del Funcionario
summary: Five women have been appointed to lead the main positions in the Servicio Murciano de Salud (SMS), the first company in the Autonomous Community of Murcia. Isabel Ayala will be the Director General, Josefa Marín Hernández will be in charge of the General Directorate of Primary Care, Irene Marín Marín will lead the General Directorate of Hospital Care, María José Lozano Semitiel will be responsible for Mental Health, and María del Carmen Riobó Serván will continue to lead Human Resources. This is a significant step towards empowering women in the public health system in the region. The success of their management in this complex and challenging sector will be determined over time, as they face challenges such as achieving quality public health care. The appointment of these five women is a positive development in a region where women have been underrepresented in leadership positions.

title: El SMS crea dos nuevas direcciones generales de Primaria y Salud Mental
summary: The SMS (Servicio Murciano de Salud) has established two new general directorates for Primary Care and Mental Health. Josefa Marín Hernández will be responsible for the new General Directorate of Primary Care, while María José Lozano Semitiel will head the General Directorate of Mental Health. The Council of Government has also sanctioned the appointment of other new high-ranking officials within the new structure of the regional administration. The SMS has also authorized the procurement of contrast media for diagnostic purposes for centers under the SMS, with a budget of 2.9 million euros for a year. Moreover, the Council of Government has permitted the hiring of the food service for the Román Alberca psychiatric hospital, situated in the Murcian district of El Palmar, with a budget of 326,902 euros for a year.

title: 5 Mujeres 'Empoderadas' al frente del SMS - El Canal del Funcionario
summary: María José Lozano Semitiel es una de las cinco mujeres que ocuparán los puestos más altos en el Servicio Murciano de Salud, la primera empresa en la región de Murcia. Isabel Ayala será la Directora General, Josefa Marín Hernández será la Directora General de Atención Primaria, Irene Marín Marín será la Directora General de Atención Hospitalaria y María del Carmen Riobó Serván seguirá liderando Recursos Humanos. El SMS es ahora un referente para el empoderamiento de las mujeres en el sistema de salud público de la región de Murcia. Los desafíos que enfrentarán estas mujeres incluirán lograr una atención médica pública de calidad y lidiar con los sindicatos sectoriales. A pesar de esto, es un desarrollo positivo que las mujeres ocupen estos puestos en una región donde las mujeres han ocupado muy pocos puestos de liderazgo.

title: El SMS crea dos nuevas direcciones generales de Primaria y Salud Mental
summary: The Council of Government of Murcia has given the green light to the restructuring of the direct management organs of the Murcian Health Service. They have appointed new directors for the areas of Primary Care and Mental Health, with Josefa Marín Hernández heading the new Directorate General of Primary Care and María José Lozano Semitiel heading the Directorate General of Mental Health. Other new senior officials have also been appointed within the new structure of the regional administration. The Council has also authorized the hiring of the food service for the Roman Alberca psychiatric hospital, with a budget of 326,902 euros and a one-year execution period. The service includes the provision of food for patients, the meal service for the guard team, and cafeteria service for hospital staff and the public.

title: Pacientes con ansiedad o depresión serán atendidos por profesionales de salud mental en sesiones grupales en AP
summary: The Region of Murcia in Spain has launched a new program called 'Programa de Prevención y Promoción de la Salud Mental desde Atención Primaria' that offers group sessions with mental health professionals for patients with anxiety and depression. The initiative is part of the Regional Mental Health Strategy and is based on scientific evidence. The program is designed to provide initial care to people affected by mild anxiety and depression through groups of 10-12 people, consisting of seven sessions of an hour and a half each. If the person improves after this process, they will be discharged, while in case of no improvement, they will be referred to a mental health center for proper treatment. The program is a collaboration between primary care and mental health. María José Lozano Semitiel, the head of the Mental Health Management in the region, said that the program is based on scientific evidence and is the result of the collaboration of primary care and mental health.

title: 5 Mujeres 'Empoderadas' al frente del SMS - El Canal del Funcionario
summary: María del Carmen Riobó Serván is one of five women who will hold top positions in the Servicio Murciano de Salud (SMS), making it a flagship for women's empowerment in the public health system in the Region of Murcia. Isabel Ayala will be the Director Manager of the SMS, Josefa Marín Hernández will be the Director General of Primary Care, Irene Marín Marín will be the Director of Hospital Care, and María José Lozano Semitiel will be the Director of Mental Health. The SMS has not had a female Gerenta since María Tormo almost 17 years ago. The new team will face the challenge of achieving a quality public health system, with the key to sustainability lying in Primary Care. The new team will have to deal with sectorial unions, which will try to mark their territory and sometimes the timing.

title: El SMS crea dos nuevas direcciones generales de Primaria y Salud Mental
summary: The SMS (Servicio Murciano de Salud) in Spain has restructured its management organs, with a focus on Mental Health and Primary Care. The new General Directorate of Primary Care will be led by Josefa Marín Hernández, while the one for Mental Health will be headed by María José Lozano Semitiel. Irene Marín Marín will take over the General Directorate of Hospital Care, while María del Carmen Riobó Serván will continue as the head of Human Resources. The SMS has approved the hiring of contrast media for diagnostic use in its centers, with a budget of €2.9 million. The contract includes the supply of contrast media for diagnostic use, which is essential for numerous diagnostic processes in adults and children. The use of contrast media is intended to improve the visualization of different structures or fluids within the body.

title: V Premios a la Excelencia Académica
summary: The V Academic Excellence Awards were held at the Faculty of Nursing and Physiotherapy at the University of Cadiz. The awards were organized by the Ateneo-University of Cadiz Chair and were presided over by the rector of the University of Cadiz, Casimiro Mantell. The awards were given in the areas of Humanities, Social and Legal Sciences, Science, Health Sciences, and Engineering. Antonio Caballero Pérez was awarded in the area of Science and received an honorable mention in the same area. The session also included a lecture by Professor Dr. Ángel Estella titled 'The heat in the medical profession, humanization at the end of life'.

title: El SMS crea dos nuevas direcciones generales de Primaria y Salud Mental
summary: The Council of Government in Murcia has given the green light to the reorganization of the Murcian Health Service's direct organs and has named new officials. The restructuring prioritizes Primary Health and Mental Health, with new directors appointed for each. Josefa Marín Hernández will be in charge of Primary Care, while María José Lozano Semitiel will be responsible for Mental Health. Irene Marín Marín will be the Director General of Hospital Care, and Maria del Carmen Riobó Serván will continue as Director General of Human Resources. The Council also approved other appointments, including Antonio Caballero Pérez as Director General of Universities. Additionally, the Council has approved the hiring of a company to supply diagnostic contrast media to the SMS with a budget of €2,912,399.

title: El Hospital Universitario Infanta Leonor inicia la sexta edición del 'Camino de esperanza' para pacientes con cáncer de ...
hco: FUNDA INVESTI E INNOVA. BIOMÉDICA HUNIV INFANTA LEONER
summary: The University Hospital Infanta Leonor has started the sixth edition of the 'Camino de Esperanza' for breast cancer patients. The initiative is organized every two years by the hospital as a therapeutic experience to normalize the lives of these patients. This year, a group of 18 women accompanied by professionals will walk around 100 kilometers of the 'Camino Inglés' in five stages, covering an average of 20 kilometers per day until they reach Santiago de Compostela. The director of the hospital, María del Carmen Pantoja Zarza, and members of the hospital's committee and professionals have accompanied the patients in the start of this unique experience of overcoming, effort, and coexistence. The initiative has been well valued by the participants since its first edition in 2012. The patients will be accompanied by professionals related to this pathology, including nurses, an oncologist, a physiotherapist, and a clinical psychologist who will organize mindfulness sessions at the end of each stage.

title: Los niños ingresados en el Hospital Universitario Infanta Leonor reciben la vista de los jugadores del Rayo Vallecano
hco: FUNDA INVESTI E INNOVA. BIOMÉDICA HUNIV INFANTA LEONER
summary: The children who were admitted to the University Hospital Infanta Leonor in Madrid were visited by players from the Rayo Vallecano football club, who brought them gifts during the Christmas season. This initiative was made possible by the ADRV Platform. The hospital also organized a Christmas decoration contest, which was participated in by patients and professionals. The hospital's aim was to create a warm and pleasant environment for the patients and their families during the festive season. In addition, the hospital distributed gifts to elderly patients as part of the campaign 'Ningún Mayor Sin Regalos' by the association 'MIMA mis mayores', and Christmas greetings from the initiative 'Una Navidad en tus Manos' by the company Senniors. The Reyes Magos of Oriente also visited the pediatric hospitalization ward to spread happiness and joy. María del Carmen Pantoja Zarza, the hospital's director, received the players and the Reyes Magos of Oriente, along with other representatives of the hospital.

title: El Hospital Universitario Infanta Leonor acoge una jornada para avanzar en el conocimiento del Virus del Papiloma ...
hco: FUNDA INVESTI E INNOVA. BIOMÉDICA HUNIV INFANTA LEONER
summary: The University Hospital Infanta Leonor organized a conference on the Human Papilloma Virus (HPV) in collaboration with the HPV-Madrid Association and the Association of Midwives of Madrid. The conference aimed to provide a concise, practical and technically sound understanding of HPV infection to over 120 healthcare professionals. The conference was inaugurated by the director of the hospital, Dr. Carmen Pantoja Zarza, the president of the HPV-Madrid Association, Dr. Juan José Hernández Aguado, and the president of the Association of Midwives of Madrid, Cristina González Hernández. The conference covered primary and secondary prevention of HPV infection, and four workshops on communication of results, sample collection, clinical cases, and diagnostic procedures. The conference aimed to provide knowledge and skills to healthcare professionals, especially midwives, who play a crucial role in primary prevention, screening, and follow-up of patients with HPV infection.

title: El responsable de Gestión del Conocimiento del Hospital Fundación Alcorcón, nombrado vicedecano de Hospitales ...
hco: FUNDA INVESTI E INNOVA. BIOMÉDICA HUNIV INFANTA LEONER
summary: Carlos Guijarro, the Head of Knowledge Management at the Hospital Fundación Alcorcón, has been appointed as the Vice Dean of Hospitals at the Faculty of Health Sciences at the Rey Juan Carlos University. The newly created Vice Dean position aims to strengthen the collaboration between the Health Sciences Faculty and teaching hospitals in the training of healthcare professionals. Guijarro has extensive experience in teaching and research and was part of the winning team led by Carlos Goicoechea in the recent elections for the Dean of Health Sciences at the URJC. This appointment marks the first time that a professor from a teaching hospital has joined the government team of the Faculty of Health Sciences in the 25-year history of the URJC. The Hospital Fundación Alcorcón currently has five out of eight full-time professors at the Health Sciences Faculty of the URJC affiliated with hospitals.

title: “Con un adecuado control, metamizol seguirá siendo un fármaco muy útil para tratar algunos tipos de dolor”
hco: FUNDA INVESTI E INNOVA. BIOMÉDICA HUNIV INFANTA LEONER
summary: Carlos Goicoechea, a pharmacology professor and vice president of the Spanish Society of Pain, has said that metamizole will continue to be a useful drug for treating certain types of pain with proper control. This statement comes after the Spanish National Court's prosecutor's office opened an investigation into the possible responsibility for adverse events associated with Nolotil, a popular pain medication containing metamizole. Goicoechea emphasized that healthcare professionals know how, when, and to whom the drug should be prescribed and are aware of its pharmacological characteristics. He also noted that the most common side effect of metamizole is hypotension, which is not particularly serious except in high-risk populations. Other potential side effects include asthma and leukopenia, which occur in 1 out of 1,000 patients treated. However, agranulocytosis, a known side effect of Nolotil, is rare and occurs in patients with specific genetic predispositions.

title: La ley para el uso del cannabis con fines medicinales, a debate en "Días D Andalucía"
hco: FUNDA INVESTI E INNOVA. BIOMÉDICA HUNIV INFANTA LEONER
summary: The Spanish Ministry of Health is in the process of developing a Real Decree to approve the regulation of cannabis for medicinal use in Spain. The regulation aims to ensure the quality of products and patient safety, providing legal access to therapeutic compounds based on standardized cannabis preparations that have shown evidence of relieving pain and suffering in patients. Ekaitz Aguirregoitia, a member of the board of the Spanish Observatory of Medicinal Cannabis, and Carlos Goicoechea, vice president of the Spanish Pain Society, have praised the government's progress in regulating cannabis for medicinal purposes. They hope that the decree will be approved within a year. Goicoechea explained that cannabis is not the first option for pain relief, but rather a third or fourth choice for patients who have not responded to traditional treatments.

title: Insensibilidad al dolor, la ausencia de una alerta que resulta mortal
hco: FUNDA INVESTI E INNOVA. BIOMÉDICA HUNIV INFANTA LEONER
summary: Insensitivity to physical pain is a rare congenital disease that poses a significant threat to those who suffer from it. The lack of pain is also a serious problem in itself, as it is a natural alert of danger. Patients with this condition may have damaged pathways of reception and transmission of painful information, so the brain does not receive the alert. Carlos Goicoechea, a pharmacology doctor, dean of the Faculty of Health Sciences at URJC, and vice president of the Spanish Pain Society (SED), explains that the condition has genetic causes in most cases, resulting from mutations in the SCN8A or NTRK1 gene. There is no cure for congenital insensitivity to pain, and the only treatment available is symptomatic. Patients need to learn how to take care of themselves and attend to certain alerts to know when they have suffered an injury.

title: El Hospital Universitario de Fuenlabrada dedica una jornada a los alumnos de Medicina de la Universidad Rey Juan ...
hco: FUNDA INVESTI E INNOVA. BIOMÉDICA HUNIV INFANTA LEONER
summary: The University Hospital of Fuenlabrada in Madrid, Spain organized a farewell ceremony for 33 medical students from the Rey Juan Carlos University who finished their university training at the hospital. The hospital and the university worked together to provide constant support and teaching to the students. The ceremony was attended by Antonio Zapatero Gaviria, the head of Internal Medicine at the hospital and a professor at the university, as well as Carlos Goicoechea García, the dean of the Faculty of Health Sciences at the university. After speeches by representatives from both institutions, the students expressed gratitude to their colleagues and families, and presented a video showcasing their university experience. The ceremony ended with the reading of the Hippocratic Oath by all attendees.

title: Se gradúa la sexta promoción de Medicina de la Universidad Rey Juan Carlos formada en el Hospital de Móstoles
hco: FUNDA INVESTI E INNOVA. BIOMÉDICA HUNIV INFANTA LEONER
summary: This year, the sixth promotion of Medicine students from the Rey Juan Carlos University (URJC) has graduated from the University Hospital of Móstoles, with 32 new doctors completing their studies. The graduates expressed their gratitude for the public hospital and the University as a clinical center, despite the challenges posed by the pandemic and the pressure of the six-year course. At the graduation ceremony, the Director of the Hospital and the Dean of the Health Sciences Faculty of the URJC encouraged the students to continue their studies and never lose their enthusiasm. Doctor Carlos Goicoechea García, a professor at the URJC, also contributed to the ceremony. The students' achievements were celebrated with personalized diploma presentations, and the event was attended by families, doctors, and hospital staff.

title: Lucía de Juan, nueva vicerrectora de Investigación y Transferencia de la Universidad Complutense de Madrid
hco: FUNDA INVESTI E INNOVA. BIOMÉDICA HUNIV INFANTA LEONER
summary: Lucía de Juan Ferré, who was previously the director of the Veterinary Health Surveillance Center and a professor of Animal Health, has been appointed as the new Vice-Rector for Research and Transfer at the Complutense University of Madrid. The university has also announced the renewal of several other positions, including the Secretary General and the General Manager. Lucía de Juan's research has focused on tuberculosis control, molecular characterization of the Mycobacterium avium complex, and the diagnosis of tuberculosis and other mycobacteriosis. She has authored numerous scientific publications and supervised several doctoral theses.

title: Los expertos subrayan la importancia de proteger y restaurar los ecosistemas para prevenir futuras pandemias ...
hco: FUNDA INVESTI E INNOVA. BIOMÉDICA HUNIV INFANTA LEONER
summary: The I National Congress Building Together a Modern Public Health, organized by the One Health Platform, highlights the importance of protecting and restoring ecosystems to prevent future pandemics. The event aims to advance towards a modern public health, based on the One Health approach, which is fundamental to face the complex health challenges caused by the interconnection between human, animal, and environmental health. The conference, held in the Faculty of Information Sciences of the Complutense University of Madrid, was inaugurated by Lucía de Juan Ferré, who emphasized the relevance of education to develop a One Health vision in future generations. The conference also featured Roser Domènech, who highlighted the need for an integrated approach to public health and the importance of protecting and restoring ecosystems to prevent future pandemics.

title: Expertos coinciden en la "urgente necesidad" de un enfoque One Health para afrontar los desafíos sanitarios
hco: FUNDA INVESTI E INNOVA. BIOMÉDICA HUNIV INFANTA LEONER
summary: The first National Congress of the One Health Platform is being held in Madrid, with the aim of improving understanding of the One Health approach and its necessary implementation in public health policies. The One Health approach recognizes the interconnection between human, animal and environmental health. Experts at the congress stressed the importance of protecting and restoring ecosystems to prevent future pandemics, and highlighted the urgent need for an integrated approach to public health. The Director of One Health at the Directorate-General for Health and Food Safety (DG Santé) emphasized that 60% of all human infectious diseases and 75% of emerging diseases are zoonotic, and that environmental pollution is the cause of 10% of premature human deaths. Lucía de Juan Ferré, Vice-Rector for Research and Transfer at the Complutense University of Madrid, was among the speakers at the congress.

title: El enfoque One Health se institucionaliza en España con su primer congreso nacional
hco: FUNDA INVESTI E INNOVA. BIOMÉDICA HUNIV INFANTA LEONER
summary: The first national One Health Congress in Spain has been held at the Complutense University of Madrid, with around 230 attendees including national and international speakers, policymakers, industry representatives, and patients. The Congress was organised by the One Health Platform and aimed to promote the One Health approach to address complex global health challenges such as antimicrobial resistance and the effects of climate change. The event also focused on the need to improve communication and increase public awareness of the approach. The Complutense University of Madrid is a member of the One Health alliance, which includes 11 European universities and defines six work areas, including One Health. The Congress was sponsored by GSK, MSD, the General Council of Official Medical Colleges, and the General Council of Veterinary Colleges in Spain, among others.

title: I Congreso Nacional One Health: "Es necesario proteger los ecosistemas para prevenir pandemias"
hco: FUNDA INVESTI E INNOVA. BIOMÉDICA HUNIV INFANTA LEONER
summary: The Plataforma One Health organized the I Congreso Nacional: 'Building Together a Modern Public Health' to contribute towards formulating One Health policies. The event was inaugurated by Lucía de Juan Ferré, who emphasized the importance of training future generations to develop their professional work with a One Health vision. The conference aimed to improve understanding of the One Health approach and the interconnection between human, animal, and environmental health. The urgent need for an integrated public health approach was highlighted, given that 60% of infectious diseases have a zoonotic origin. The conference also stressed the importance of protecting and restoring ecosystems to prevent future pandemics. Raquel Yotti, Commissioner of the PERTE for Vanguard Health of the Ministry of Science, Innovation, and Universities, highlighted the need to invest in innovation to implement One Health measures.

title: Investigadores demuestran que no existe retro-contagio del SARS-COV-2 entre mascotas y humanos
hco: FUNDA INVESTI E INNOVA. BIOMÉDICA HUNIV INFANTA LEONER
summary: Researchers from the 'Anticipa-UCM' project have demonstrated that there is no retro-contagion of the SARS-COV-2 - the variant that caused Covid-19 - between pets and humans. Genomic analysis of the samples collected during the pandemic will allow the map of Covid variants in the different waves to be developed. The research was led by Professor Lucía de Juan Ferré, from the Sanitary Surveillance Research Group at the Visavet Center of the Complutense University of Madrid (UCM). Investigations carried out in the 'COV20/01385' and 'Anticipa-UCM' projects showed that pets become infected from sick people, both through respiratory and digestive routes. Once infected, they eliminate low viral loads, with no transmission observed between them and they do not pose a risk to humans either. The disease in infected animals, both experimentally and naturally, presents with a mild clinical picture, with respiratory symptoms very similar to those described in humans, with a low risk of animals spreading SARS-CoV-2 to humans.

title: Un estudio confirma que los humanos contagian la covid-19 a los animales, pero no al revés
hco: FUNDA INVESTI E INNOVA. BIOMÉDICA HUNIV INFANTA LEONER
summary: A study conducted by researchers at the Universidad Complutense de Madrid has confirmed that COVID-19 can be transmitted from humans to pets, but not the other way around. The study involved over 2,500 animals and more than 5,000 samples from pets that had lived with both healthy and infected individuals. The research found that pets become infected from sick people, both through respiratory and digestive routes. Once infected, the animals eliminate low viral loads and do not transmit the virus to other animals or pose a risk to humans. The study also found that infected animals developed mild clinical symptoms similar to those in humans. The project Anticipa-UCM, led by Lucía de Juan Ferré, also reported on the COVID-LOT program, which was created in December 2020 to monitor the infectivity of the SARS-CoV-2 virus in the university community. The program has processed around 200,000 saliva samples from students, detecting 2,000 positive cases, many of which were asymptomatic.

title: Descartada la transmisión del coronavirus de mascotas a humanos
hco: FUNDA INVESTI E INNOVA. BIOMÉDICA HUNIV INFANTA LEONER
summary: A study conducted by researchers from the Universidad Complutense has concluded that humans can transmit COVID-19 to their pets, but not the other way around. This debunks the theory that animals have contributed to the spread of the virus during the pandemic. The researchers discovered that pets become infected with the virus through respiratory and digestive routes. However, once infected, they eliminate low loads of the virus and do not transmit it to other animals or pose a risk to humans. On the other hand, humans can transmit the virus to their pets through close contact. The study, which analysed over 2,500 animals and more than 5,000 samples, was led by Professor Lucía de Juan Ferré of the Complutense’s VISAVET Health Surveillance Research Group. The research also found that the disease in infected animals was mild, with respiratory symptoms similar to those in humans.

title: "Desde la colaboración sincera se puede avanzar en los retos sanitarios que nos esperan"
summary: Santiago de Quiroga, the president editor of Wecare-u, emphasized the importance of collaboration between politicians and healthcare professionals to achieve a better healthcare system for everyone during the 22nd edition of the Fundamed Awards. He highlighted the need for political parties to prioritize funding decisions and find common ground beyond ideological differences. De Quiroga also stressed the importance of knowledge and capacity to manage the healthcare system and suggested that collaboration and open communication can help in addressing the challenges that lie ahead. He also mentioned the upcoming European report on COVID-19 and suggested that it should facilitate learning and better preparation for future pandemics.

title: "El sistema sanitario español tiene una vocación clara por cumplir con los estándares más exigentes"
summary: Santiago de Quiroga, the president editor of Gaceta Médica, emphasized at the BiC Awards ceremony that the Spanish healthcare system aims to meet the highest standards. The BiC Awards, granted by Gaceta Médica and the Chair of Innovation and Health Management of the Rey Juan Carlos University, have recognized the quality of the best centers and services throughout Spain. De Quiroga highlighted the extraordinary work of healthcare professionals, who always strive to have the best human and technical teams, improve results, and develop the best care plans and protocols based on the latest evidence. He also stressed the importance of investing in healthcare and allocating the necessary resources to properly meet patient demand.

title: César Hernández recibe el diploma Fundamed a la Figura Pública Sanitaria
summary: César Hernández, the Director of the Common Portfolio and Pharmacy of the Spanish Ministry of Health, has received the Fundamed Diploma and Certificate for the Advanced Therapies Plan of the National Health System (SNS) of the Ministry of Health. Santiago de Quiroga, the President of Fundamed, presented the award in a closed-door meeting attended by representatives of scientific societies and entities, members of the awards jury, and part of the advisory and editorial committee of the magazine "Economía de la Salud." The award recognizes the work that was initiated in 2018 with the implementation of CAR therapies in Spain and has continued to advance in 2022 and 2023. Hernández emphasized that the award is a recognition of the work of a whole team and marks the expectations to continue improving and advancing in the SNS.

title: Pastor recibe el diploma del premio Fundamed al compromiso público sanitario
summary: Ana Pastor, the Spanish politician and former Minister of Health, has been awarded the Fundamed 2023 award for her dedication to public healthcare. The award was presented by Santiago de Quiroga, the president of Fundamed, in recognition of Pastor's extensive experience in healthcare policy and legislation. During her time as Minister of Health, Pastor played a crucial role in the approval of various laws and healthcare strategies, including the first National Cancer Plan and the National Plan for Prevention and Control of Smoking. She remains involved in healthcare as a member of the Spanish Congress' health committee. Pastor stresses the importance of strengthening the healthcare system through innovation, preventative policies, and consensus with healthcare professionals, patients, and regional administrations.

title: Arturo Fernández-Cruz: «Estamos en el camino de convertir en realidad el sueño de burlar a la muerte»
summary: Arturo Fernández-Cruz, a Madrid-based academic, will discuss the advances in regenerative medicine at the Semana de los Mayores in Murcia. The dream of finding the elixir of youth has moved from mythology to science thanks to regenerative medicine, which was opened up by Nobel laureate Shinya Yamanaka, who showed that it is possible to reprogram adult cells. According to Fernández-Cruz, we are on the path to making the dream of cheating death a reality.

title: AstraZeneca, GSK y Janssen copan el podio de los premios Fundamed Wecare-U
summary: AstraZeneca, GSK, and Janssen have won the top three awards at the 22nd edition of the Fundamed & Wecare-u Awards. AstraZeneca won "Company of the Year," GSK won "Best Company in R&D," and Janssen's Spravato won "Medicine of the Year." The awards recognized excellence in the healthcare sector and aimed to promote collaboration among all stakeholders. The event was inaugurated by Santiago de Quiroga, president editor of Wecare-u, and vice president of Fundamed, who emphasized the need for greater harmonization within the National Health System. Arturo Fernández-Cruz, president of the Scientific Committee of Fundamed, gave a hopeful speech and paid tribute to two iconic figures in the sector who passed away in 2023. The Secretary of State for Health, Silvia Calzón, closed the event, congratulating the winners and emphasizing the commitment to improving the healthcare system.

title: ESMO aboga por un cambio regulatorio y organizativo que proteja a los pacientes de cáncer en situaciones de ...
summary: The European Society for Medical Oncology (ESMO) is advocating for regulatory and organizational changes to protect cancer patients in emergency situations. A report by IQVIA showed that there were 62,000 fewer cancer diagnoses during the COVID-19 pandemic than in 2019. ESMO is calling for a regulatory framework to protect cancer patients during pandemics and other emergencies. José M. Martín-Moreno, a professor of Preventive Medicine and Public Health, is calling for the integration of secondary and tertiary care to prevent interference in cancer treatment during pandemics.
