He urges the implementation of a plan of secondary and tertiary care, supported by governance, funding, resources, and an appropriate organization, to ensure the protection of vulnerable patients.

title: El doctor y profesor de la UJI Vicente Pallarés accede a la Real Academia de Medicina valenciana
summary: Vicente Pallarés Carratalá, a doctor and professor at the Universitat Jaume I, has been admitted as a Corresponding Academician of the Royal Academy of Medicine of the Valencian Community. The ceremony took place at the College of Physicians of Castellón and was presented by Dr. José María Martín Moreno. Pallarés discussed the importance of primary care in his speech, stating that it is vital because it is the gateway to the healthcare system and where patients are treated holistically throughout their lives. He also emphasized the role of family doctors in prevention, diagnosis, treatment, and end-of-life care. Pallarés believes that primary care is one of the most complete specialties and the one that can best know patients. The event was attended by the Director General of Primary Care, Dr. Eva Suárez, the President of the RAMCV, Dr. Carmen Leal, and the President of the College of Physicians of Castellón, Dr. Carlos Vilar.

title: “Las dos crisis globales a las que nos enfrentamos son la del clima y las ENT”
summary: The President of the Scientific Committee of the Cancer Policy and Prevention sessions, Jose María Martín-Moreno, highlighted at the European Society for Medical Oncology (ESMO) Congress in Madrid the importance of implementing prevention strategies to tackle cancer. He emphasized the need for active participation and collaboration among medical oncologists, primary care physicians, and other health professionals to prevent cancer. Martín-Moreno stressed the significance of educating society on prevention strategies and implementing structural and behavioral measures to promote healthy lifestyles. He noted that between 40-50% of cancer cases can be prevented by implementing known prevention strategies. Martín-Moreno also emphasized the need for greater coordination and support from the state to implement national and European strategies to prevent cancer.

title: 75 cumpleaños de la Organización Mundial de la Salud: una reflexión sobre su pasado y futuro
summary: The World Health Organization (WHO) celebrates its 75th anniversary this year. The organization was created after the Second World War to protect and promote health as a fundamental human right. The WHO has contributed to the advancement of public health by eradicating diseases, reducing the incidence of polio, eliminating five tropical diseases, and establishing global standards for clean water. The organization has also supported countries in adopting a historic treaty on tobacco control, regulating the aggressive marketing of breast milk substitutes, and reporting health emergencies that could spread worldwide. However, challenges remain, such as the impact of COVID-19, chronic non-communicable diseases, lack of access to healthcare, armed conflicts, and climate change. The WHO must adapt to provide better services to address these challenges and promote health for all.

title: Ilona Kickbusch, investida doctora 'Honoris Causa' por la Universitat de València
summary: Ilona Selma Kickbusch, an expert in global health promotion, has been awarded an honorary doctorate by the University of Valencia. Kickbusch, who is known for her work in the fields of political science and sociology, was recognized for her leadership in health promotion and her feminist perspective. The ceremony was held at the university's Paraninfo de La Nau, where José María Martín Moreno, a professor of preventive medicine and public health, delivered the laudatio. Kickbusch spoke about the importance of digital health transformation and the convergence of digital and public health, reflecting on whether digital transformation should be considered a multidimensional determinant of health, whether the understanding of solidarity in health should be expanded to include data solidarity, and whether a concept of digital health citizenship should be developed.

title: Los cinco errores que llevaron a España al peor cierre de Europa: "Se reaccionó tarde y la comunicación fue mejorable"
summary: Spain's delayed response and poor communication were among the five errors that led to the country's worst COVID-19 lockdown in Europe. The virus was already out of control in early March 2020, but authorities ignored the real data and transmission mechanisms. The situation worsened, and by April 2020, Madrid was using an ice rink as a morgue. Jose María Martín Moreno, a public health expert, highlighted the lack of preparation, political interference, and inadequate coordination between the central and regional governments. He also pointed out that Spain was not alone in making mistakes, but it paid a higher price due to the country's demographics and the virus's virulence.

title: Los Premios BiC son un reflejo de lo que supone la mejora del sistema sanitario
summary: Angel Gil de Miguel, a professor of Preventive Medicine and Public Health at the University Rey Juan Carlos, stated during the 18th edition of the Best in Class Awards that these awards reflect the improvement of the healthcare system. The awards recognize the quality of care and patient attention, which directly impact the population's well-being. The event was organized by Gaceta Médica and the Chair of Innovation and Healthcare Management at the University Rey Juan Carlos, sponsored by Janssen, and held at the Hospital Universitari i Politecnic La Fe de Valencia. The autonomous communities of Galicia and Madrid received the most awards. The awards ceremony was attended by various healthcare authorities, scientific societies, and representatives of the National Health System.

title: Jesús García-Foncillas, nuevo presidente de la Fundación ECO
summary: Jesús García-Foncillas has been elected as the new president of the Fundación ECO, a Spanish organization that promotes the quality of oncology care. García-Foncillas is a professor of oncology at the Autonomous University of Madrid and director of the Department of Oncology and the Oncology Institute at the Jiménez Díaz Foundation University Hospital. He will be accompanied by Rafael López López, who will serve as vice president. García-Foncillas aims to continue promoting quality oncology care and constructing a path of excellence for patients with cancer. The new project will focus on promoting the international projection of the Fundación ECO in Europe and Latin America, positioning cancer as a priority issue, and fostering excellent medical training in areas such as precision medicine.

title: El Dr. Jesús García-Foncillas, nuevo presidente de la Fundación ECO
summary: Dr. Jesús García-Foncillas has been elected as the new president of the Fundación para la Excelencia y la Calidad de la Oncología (ECO). He will be leading the Comisión Permanente for the next two years. The main objective of the foundation is to promote and analyze the quality of Spanish oncology in terms of research, education, and healthcare. Dr. García-Foncillas is the director of the Department of Oncology and the Oncological Institute at the Hospital Universitario Fundación Jiménez Díaz. He is also a professor of Oncology at the Universidad Autónoma de Madrid and responsible for the Division of Translational Oncology at the FJD-UAM Health Research Institute. The new president aims to continue the work of the foundation and ensure that the solutions provided by Spanish oncology transcend borders. He plans to use new technologies such as artificial intelligence, real-world evidence, and big data to optimize the entire cancer care process.

title: Trayectoria Científica en Investigación Biomédica: Jesús San Miguel
summary: Jesus San Miguel, a Senior Consultant at the Cancer Center Clínica Universidad de Navarra and Hematology-Medicine Professor, has been honored with the Constantes y Vitales Scientific Trajectory prize for his contribution to biomedical research. He has published over 950 articles in top scientific journals and 120 chapters of books and monographs, and has been cited 68,588 times. San Miguel is recognized for his ability to integrate laboratory and hospital activity into a translational research model to benefit patients. He has received several awards, including the Gregorio Marañón National Research Award in 2021, the King Jaime I Award, and the most important awards from the European and American Hematology Societies. He was awarded the Constantes y Vitales Scientific Trajectory prize in Biomedical Research, presented by the Spanish Minister of Science and Innovation, Diana Morant.

title: Tres de los 100 mejores médicos de España (según Forbes) trabajan en Castilla-La Mancha
summary: Forbes has published its list of the 100 best doctors in Spain, including three from Castilla-La Mancha. The list is based on the opinions of journalists in the healthcare sector, taking into account the presence in the media, recognition, and contributions made in the fields of assistance, research, and teaching by medical professionals who work in Spanish hospitals. One of the professionals works for the Castilla-La Mancha Health Service (Sescam), while the other two are part of the team at the Hospital Quirónsalud Albacete. Jesús García-Foncillas, an oncologist and director of the OncoHealth Oncology Institute, which includes several hospitals in Madrid and Albacete, was also included in the list. García-Foncillas has been dedicated to oncology research for more than 25 years and has written numerous specialized articles and books.

title: El cáncer, un reto sanitario urgente
summary: Jesús García Foncillas, the President of the Fundación ECO, highlights the challenges faced by the field of Oncology in Spain in the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of cancer. The need to adapt the European Plan to fight cancer to the Spanish context is emphasized, with the goal of achieving a 70% survival rate for patients by 2030. The author stresses the importance of accelerating access to innovation, ensuring equity in Oncology, and promoting quality care. The potential of precision medicine in the diagnosis and treatment of tumors is also discussed. The integration of disciplines such as artificial intelligence, big data, and real-world evidence is expected to play a significant role in the future of Oncology.

title: Jesús García-Foncillas: «La calidad de vida es un objetivo insoslayable en el abordaje del cáncer»
summary: Jesus Garcia-Foncillas, director of Oncohealth, Oncology Institute of the Jimenez Diaz Foundation University Hospital in Madrid, has stated that the understanding of cancer has evolved in recent years due to molecular biology. This has confirmed that cancer is a diverse group of diseases with varying genetic characteristics, prognoses, and treatments that must be tailored to individual molecular profiles to achieve maximum benefit with minimal toxicity. He emphasized that maintaining quality of life is an essential objective in the comprehensive approach to cancer. The HOPE program, which provides personalized day hospital care, has been well-received by patients since its implementation. The future of oncology research is focused on identifying new targets for targeted treatments and discovering new paths for more individualized immunotherapy.

title: Mayores expertos de oncología médica en España
summary: Javier Cortés Castán, Jesús García Foncillas, and Rafael Rosell Costa are considered the top oncology medical experts in Spain, according to the report "Mejores Médicos de España" by El Confidencial. Dr. Cortés Castán is recognized as the oncologist with the most expertise in breast cancer in Spain and is the director of the International Breast Cancer Center in Barcelona. Dr. García Foncillas is the director of the OncoHealth Oncology Institute and is a professor of Oncology at the Autonomous University of Madrid. Dr. Rosell Costa is the medical director and president of the Dr. Rosell Oncology Institute and is recognized for his extensive research in the field of translational oncology.

title: Alianza internacional contra el cáncer: compromiso por una atención oncológica de calidad
summary: The recent ASCO Annual Meeting showcased the constant progress of oncology towards revolutionary medicine that seeks to safeguard the quality of life of patients. International alliances have become essential in addressing the access to quality care for all patients. The Oncology Medical Home (OMH) program offers a guide to identifying and implementing a comprehensive oncology care system prioritizing quality care. The program is the next step towards a holistic patient and family care image. The significant contribution of Spanish oncology has left a mark on ASCO's Annual Meeting. The Fundación ECO collaborates with ASCO in the Program of Certification QOPI, which accredits the excellence of Spanish centers in assisting cancer patients. The programs in which ASCO collaborates with Fundación ECO aim to expand their actions beyond Spain to contribute to eliminating disparities in other countries.

title: Las dos caras de la investigación en oncología en España
summary: Six clinical researchers have analyzed the current state of oncology research in Spain and the work of the research institutes associated with hospitals. They noted that clinical research of new drugs is flourishing in Spain thanks to the funding of the pharmaceutical industry and the talent of Spanish clinical researchers. However, independent translational research, which is called upon to answer questions that are not useful for the industry but are for patients, lacks sufficient economic support. The scientists also discussed the importance of independent research and the need for academia to promote translational studies of biomarkers and pharmacoeconomic studies to identify patients who benefit most from a particular drug. The researchers agreed that the industry is essential for the advancement of medicine, but Spain has a wide margin for improvement in developing independent research.

title: Mariano Provencio y Jesús García Foncillas, seleccionados como miembros de dos Comités Científicos de ASCO
summary: Jesús García Foncillas and Mariano Provencio have been selected as members of two Scientific Committees of the American Society of Clinical Oncology (ASCO). García Foncillas will join the Cancer Care Delivery Council, while Provencio will become a member of the Annual Meeting Scientific Program Committee Lung Cancer - Non-small Cell Local-regional/Small Cell/Other track. Both experts will participate in scientific meetings, educational conferences, professional workshops, and special symposia on topics relevant to clinical oncologists and researchers. García Foncillas is the director of the Oncology Institute and several cancer programs at hospitals in Madrid, while Provencio is the scientific director of the Health Research Institute at Puerta de Hierro University Hospital in Madrid and the president of the Spanish Lung Cancer Group.

title: El Hospital Puerta de Hierro recibe la certificación internacional que reconoce su excelencia en la atención a los ...
summary: The Medical Oncology Service at Puerta de Hierro University Hospital in Madrid has been granted QOPI certification by the Foundation ECO and the American Society of Clinical Oncology (ASCO) for providing excellent care to cancer patients. The hospital met the highest quality standards set by ASCO and helped improve the patient experience and recovery. The Vice President of the ECO Foundation, Dr. Jesús García-Foncillas, presented the certification. Puerta de Hierro hospital is the fifth in Madrid and twelfth in Spain to receive this international accreditation. The QOPI program assesses compliance with various key aspects of cancer care, and audits are conducted by a team of experts from the ECO Foundation.

title: Ayuso refrenda el compromiso de Madrid en la atención de excelencia del cáncer
summary: Isabel Díaz Ayuso, the president of the Community of Madrid, has received the Special Award 2023 of the XI Edition of the ECO Awards for her continuous dedication to regional healthcare and her efforts to achieve excellence and quality in the care of cancer patients. Ayuso stressed the significance of prevention and early detection, as well as the utilization of state-of-the-art treatments and research, in the battle against cancer. The Madrid government is also devoted to public-private partnerships and the use of the latest technology. Jesús García Foncillas, president of the Fundación ECO, highlighted the importance of Madrid's commitment to fighting cancer and praised the success of the Red Oncológica Madrileña (ROM) as a model for enhancing resources and ensuring access to the most advanced treatments and therapies.

title: Foro Premios Afectivo Efectivo: integrar visión del paciente en innovación
summary: Janssen held the ninth edition of the Affective-Effective Awards Forum, which aims to highlight the importance of health innovation for the benefit of patients. The event awarded ten projects aimed at achieving this goal, with a focus on patient care and value. The Director of the Oncohealth Institute, Jesús García Foncillas, emphasized the value of public-private collaboration in achieving faster development of diagnostic and therapeutic strategies. The forum also discussed the challenges and current situation of healthcare innovation, highlighting the need to involve patients in the innovation process and prioritize their perspective. The event concluded with the presentation of awards based on the Affective-Effective Model, which considers the patient at the center of the healthcare system.

title: Atención Primaria pide incentivos en investigación y formación y gestionar sus agendas
summary: During the IV Symposium of the Sanitary Observatory, organized by El Español and Invertia, medical professionals in primary care have requested more incentives for research and training, as well as the ability to manage their own schedules. María Lourdes Martínez-Berganza Asensio, vice president of Semergen, and Alberto Cotillas Rodero, president of the Sociedad Madrileña de Medicina de Familia y Comunitaria (SoMaMFyC), have both called for the promotion of family medicine in universities. Marta Galipienzo, vice president of the General Council of Pharmaceutical Colleges, has proposed greater collaboration between primary care and pharmacies, including access to patient medical records. The medical professionals have also highlighted the need for changes to some of their functions, such as the duplication of work in certain procedures.

title: La detección precoz de ERC en primaria, clave para evitar su progresión y las muertes prematuras
summary: Lourdes Martínez-Berganza, vice-president of the Spanish Society of Primary Care Physicians (Semergen), discusses the importance of early detection of Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD) in primary care. CKD is a common condition that affects around 15% of the population. However, many patients are unaware of their condition until it reaches an advanced stage, making early detection crucial. Martínez-Berganza emphasizes the need for regular testing of high-risk patients and individualized treatment plans to prevent disease progression and complications. She also highlights the link between CKD and diabetes, with 40% of type 2 diabetes patients suffering from CKD. Martínez-Berganza welcomes the arrival of dapagliflozin as a new treatment option, which has been shown to slow the progression of CKD and even lead to regression of the disease.

title: Sefac y Semergen analizan la cooperación de médico-farmacéutica en atención comunitaria | @diariofarma
summary: The VI National Congress of Semergen-Sefac, with the participation of almost 200 professionals, is being held in Toledo under the theme "Collaborative Community Care: Physicians and Pharmacists". The focus is on shared management and continuity of care between doctors and pharmacists in the community. The program includes joint training workshops and roundtable discussions. The congress aims to improve communication dynamics between family doctors and community pharmacists for the benefit of patients. Lourdes Martínez-Berganza, vice president of Semergen and president of the congress's scientific committee, highlights the benefits of cooperation between the two professional groups. The congress will also discuss topics such as respiratory infections, dermatological pathology, contraception, and sexually transmitted infections. The event will also address the issue of smoking and the importance of prevention, registration of consumption, and pharmacological treatments.

title: Primaria y Hospitalaria se actualizan en enfermedad renal crónica en el Infanta Leonor
summary: The Hospital Universitario Infanta Leonor organized the "I Multidisciplinary Conference on Chronic Kidney Disease" with the participation of more than 120 healthcare professionals from primary and hospital care. The conference aimed to enhance the comprehension of the disease, which is still not well understood by healthcare professionals and the general public, and to promote better communication between different levels of care. The conference included four roundtable discussions covering various formal aspects of chronic kidney disease, such as epidemiological data and therapeutic advances, as well as management models to improve multidisciplinary diagnosis and treatment. Additionally, five practical workshops focused on specific clinical aspects related to chronic kidney disease, such as hypertension and electrolyte disorders. The conference also announced the second edition of the Ministry of Health's document, which outlines objectives for screening, diagnosis, and treatment of chronic kidney disease.

title: Premiar la vocación y sondear las necesidades de los médicos jóvenes: las acciones "urgentes" para retener talento ...
summary:
"SEMERGEN, la Sociedad Española de Médicos de Atención Primaria, ha presentado un documento que presenta propuestas para atraer y retener el talento en la atención primaria. El documento, titulado 'Cómo atraer y retener el talento en la Atención Primaria', sugiere una serie de intervenciones, incluyendo una prueba o sistema específico para recompensar la vocación sobre las calificaciones de ingreso universitarias, una asignatura teórica específica de Medicina de Familia en el plan de estudios académico, y un aumento en el período de rotación en los centros de atención primaria para todos los estudiantes de medicina. La sociedad también propone un estudio cualitativo macro para comprender las opiniones y expectativas de los jóvenes médicos sobre la atención primaria, y un plan específico para áreas rurales o puestos con cobertura difícil. El documento ha sido enviado al Ministerio de Salud español y a las autoridades sanitarias regionales."

(Note: This translation is within the word limit.)

title: HERA, Semergen y Organon apuestan por un abordaje integral de la mujer
summary: Semergen and Organon have launched a three-year collaboration called 'HERA: one woman, many women', aimed at training and raising awareness among family doctors about the importance of differentiating women's needs at each stage of their lives. The training programme will include four age groups: adolescence, youth, maturity and senescence. The project also takes into account the different sensitivity and tolerance of women to certain drugs. The online and accredited programme aims to support primary care doctors in addressing the medical needs of women, taking into account the differences in sex and gender that make women sick differently from men, with different intensity, symptoms and prognosis. The project will include topics such as prevention of cardiovascular risk factors, contraception, anxiety, depression, women's role as caregivers, non-oncological chronic pain, sexual health, menopause and new technologies in senescence.

title: Día Mundial de la Cruz Roja: ‘Transparencia da certeza a donantes’
summary: On the occasion of World Red Cross Day, Carlos Freaner Figueroa, the national president of the Mexican Red Cross, emphasized the importance of transparency in all the resources the organization receives, saying it provides certainty to donors. He also highlighted the active role the Red Cross played during the Covid-19 pandemic, including transporting patients to hospitals, establishing provisional hospitals, and providing equipment to protect staff. Manuel Jiménez de la Cruz's contribution to the topic is not mentioned in the text.

title: Dietary intake of polychlorinated dibenzo-p-dioxins and furans, adiposity and obesity status.
summary: The study evaluated how the consumption of Polychlorinated dibenzo-p-dioxins and polychlorinated dibenzo-p-furans (PCDD/Fs) in the diet is related to obesity in middle-aged individuals. The study discovered that 87% of the population exceeded the PCDD/Fs levels set by the EFSA, and that red meat, fish, seafood, fruits, and vegetables contributed the most to PCDD/F dietary intake. The higher the PCDD/Fs dietary intake, the higher the BMI, waist circumference, and prevalence of obesity and abdominal obesity. The study also revealed that individuals in the highest PCDD/F DI baseline tertile had a larger waist circumference compared to those in the first tertile after one year of follow-up. One of the authors of the study was Sergio Cinza Sanjurjo. Additional large, prospective studies are necessary to confirm these findings.

title: Un plan de estudios de 100 páginas que potencia medicina de Familia y Rural
summary: The University of León is planning to introduce specialized teachings focusing on the specialty of Family and Rural Medicine in their proposal to implement a degree in Medicine. This approach is currently not available in any other Spanish faculty. Vicente Martín Sánchez, the catedrático of Preventive Medicine and Public Health at the University, is coordinating the justification memorandum and study plan for the degree. The plan has received unanimous support from all participants, including professionals from the University, hospitals in León and El Bierzo, primary care research units, and the official college of doctors in León. The aim is to address the shortage of family and community doctors in rural areas by making the specialty more appealing to students. The plan has been in development for six months and has been designed to make the degree unique and beneficial to the local community.

title: RAPRIM AFINA LA EFICACIA
summary: The RAPRIM study, led by Alba Marcos Delgado and co-investigator Vicente Martín Sánchez, has received a grant from the Strategic Action in Health 2021-2023 program to reduce unnecessary antibiotic prescriptions in primary care. The study will determine the efficacy of rapid antigen tests for COVID-19 and the flu in reducing antibiotic prescriptions, as well as evaluating their efficiency in reducing consultations, complementary tests, and hospitalizations. The study involves researchers from the Interactions Gen-Environment and Health research group at the University of León, doctors from the Spanish Society of Primary Care Physicians, and nurses and microbiology services from healthcare areas in León and El Bierzo. The study aims to strengthen the surveillance of health risks and increase the efficiency of health policies and the quality of the National Health System.

title: CyLTV celebró en Burgos la primera edición de los Premios ‘Diagnóstico’
summary: CyLTV held the first edition of the Diagnóstico Awards in Burgos, which recognize professionals in the health and medical industry in Castilla y León. The ceremony was attended by over 450 people, including government officials and professionals in the health sector. The winners were chosen by a jury composed of experts in the field. The awards were sponsored by several companies and organizations. The ceremony will be broadcast on March 3rd on La 7. Vicente Martín Sánchez, a professor of Preventive Medicine and Public Health at the University of León, was a member of the jury.

title: How technology is revolutionizing healthcare
hco: SOD ESPAÑOLA ENFERM INFECCIOSAS Y M
summary: Youngsuk "YS" Chi, Chairman of Elsevier, discussed the use of AI and big data to support healthcare professionals at a Health News event in China. He addressed the issue of burnout among healthcare workers and how it can negatively impact both them and their patients. Chi highlighted the use of big data and digital health technologies in improving healthcare outcomes, such as advancements in medical education, integration of AI into clinical workflows, and language learning models for clinical decision support. He also mentioned Elsevier's efforts in sharing COVID information with the medical community and developing a mobile, AI-based application to pre-screen patients in India. Chi stressed the importance of improving learning outcomes for future healthcare professionals and prioritizing the clinician and patient in healthcare.

title: Elsevier Health unveils conversational clinical decision support
hco: SOD ESPAÑOLA ENFERM INFECCIOSAS Y M
summary: Elsevier Health has launched ClinicalKey AI, an AI-driven version of its clinical decision support tool, ClinicalKey, in partnership with OpenEvidence. The conversational search interface of ClinicalKey AI helps doctors quickly find the information they need. The tool pulls from validated sources beyond Elsevier's own point of care content available through ClinicalKey, including journal abstracts, medical reference texts, and government publications. ClinicalKey AI generates a summarized response cited with references and considers patient context when prompted. It provides personalized responses based on the clinician’s profile or specialty, and offers the ability to access previous queries and responses. The tool is HIPAA-compliant. Jan Herzhoff, president at Elsevier Health, said that ClinicalKey AI finds the needle in the haystack in all of their content. ClinicalKey AI is not yet integrated with EHRs.

title: Clinicians' needs for effective digital healthcare transformation
hco: SOD ESPAÑOLA ENFERM INFECCIOSAS Y M
summary: Jan Herzhoff, President of Health Markets at Elsevier, highlights the significance of technology in revolutionizing healthcare and aiding clinicians in comprehending the growing volume of data accessible. By utilizing tools that can amalgamate data and detect insights, it becomes more practical to enhance care delivery, resulting in improved outcomes for patients. Elsevier Health possesses extensive proficiency in data and constantly strives to guarantee that it is within reach and useful.

title: One year later: The state of healthcare and key projections for the role of clinicians
hco: SOD ESPAÑOLA ENFERM INFECCIOSAS Y M
summary: One year after the release of the Clinician of the Future report, which focused on the future trends in healthcare from the perspective of doctors and nurses around the world, Elsevier's Jan Herzhoff, PhD, reflects on the past year in healthcare and key trends on the horizon. The report revealed the challenges faced by healthcare workers and how to address gaps and identify solutions. The report measured the enormous strain put on healthcare workers globally due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The report identified three major themes: enhancing health technology skills, a greater focus on the patient-provider relationship, and an expanded healthcare workforce. These themes are still relevant today, and companies like Elsevier are staying abreast of the needs of healthcare workers. As digital technologies take hold and become more a part of the healthcare equation, technology literacy will become the top skill needed to succeed in the clinical setting over the next 10 years.

title: Elsevier inclusion & diversity data snapshot 2024
hco: SOD ESPAÑOLA ENFERM INFECCIOSAS Y M
summary: Elsevier, a worldwide supplier of data-driven analytics and decision tools, has released its diversity data snapshot for 2023. The report shows progress in gender, race and ethnicity, and age diversity. Women make up more than half of the company's workforce, with 46.7% in management positions and 33.3% in senior leadership roles. The company has also made improvements in racial and ethnic diversity, with 21.6% of US- and UK-based employees representing a minority group, up from 19.7% in 2022. Elsevier's psychological safety index has also continued to improve, with over 30 facilitators holding over 75 workshops to discuss team scores in a confidential setting. The company has launched initiatives to support employees with disabilities, including a mentoring program and a partnership with Leonard Cheshire on the Rising TIDE internship program.

title: Enrique Aranda: "El cáncer es un problema sociosanitario de primera magnitud"
summary: Enrique Aranda, who is the head of Oncology at the Reina Sofía hospital, has stated that cancer is a significant socio-sanitary issue and may become the most common disease. He has linked the rise in cancer cases with the aging population, which will require more resources for treatment. Aranda has emphasized the need for more resources to improve treatment and innovation, as the survival rate for all types of tumors is close to 60%, but 40% of patients still die. The Reina Sofía hospital uses liquid biopsy for colon cancer diagnosis, which is the first in Andalusia and second in Spain. The Institute Maimónides of Biomedicine of Córdoba (Imibic) is involved in over 100 cancer research projects and has published about a hundred studies on these diseases.

title: Joaquín, superviviente de cáncer de colon: "Le debo la vida al diagnóstico precoz"
summary: Joaquín, a 65-year-old colon cancer survivor, credits early detection for saving his life. He was diagnosed with cancer five years ago after taking a test despite having no symptoms. He underwent treatment and is now in remission. According to the Spanish Society of Medical Oncology, there will be an estimated 44,300 new cases of colorectal cancer diagnosed in Spain in 2024, with an increasing number of younger patients with aggressive tumors. Experts are calling for the age range for screening programs to be lowered to 45 years old due to this trend. Pilar García Alfonso, head of the Oncology section at the Gregorio Marañón University Hospital, confirms that there are more cases of colon cancer in young adults, even those in their twenties, and urges patients and doctors not to underestimate symptoms in those under 50.

title: El doctor Jesús García-Foncillas, nuevo presidente de la Fundación ECO
summary: Jesús García-Foncillas has been elected as the new president of the Fundación para la Excelencia y la Calidad de la Oncología (ECO) for the 2023-2025 term. Along with him, the team that will lead the Permanent Commission for the period includes Dr. Rafael López as vice president, Dr. Pedro Pérez Segura, Dr. Delvys Rodríguez-Abreu, and Dr. Pilar García Alfonso. The new project aims to improve the quality of oncological care and promote the international projection of the entity. It also aims to position cancer as a priority issue in politics and society, work towards patient safety, digitalization of the cancer circuit, and provide excellent medical training. García-Foncillas is a professor of Oncology at the Autonomous University of Madrid, director of the Oncology Department, and responsible for the Translational Oncology Division of the FJD-UAM Health Research Institute.

title: Sumar experiencias de éxito, llave para reducir la brecha de género en sanidad
summary: Mujeres de la Sanidad, a collaboration between Fundamed and Gaceta Médica, aims to promote female talent in the sector. In a recent meeting, Catalina García, the Minister of Health and Consumer Affairs in Andalusia, highlighted the need to share successful experiences without bias, emphasizing the importance of training, leadership, and experience. García also stressed the importance of promoting gender equality through specific policies in both the public and private sectors. The event brought together representatives from scientific societies and institutions to discuss strategies for contributing to gender equity in the healthcare environment, particularly in hospital service management. The Andalusian Ministry of Health and Consumer Affairs has invested €35.8m in 36 specific actions for women, including the Program of Equality of the R&D&i Strategy in Health of Andalusia, which benefits between 2,000 and 2,500 active female researchers.

title: Más transparencia y agilidad para transformar la I+D en disponibilidad
summary: Pilar García Alfonso, who is the head of Medical Oncology at Gregorio Marañón Hospital, pointed out the insufficient access to innovation and information in cancer treatment during the Cancer Now event. The discussion also included the delay between the approval of a drug by the European Medicines Agency and its availability in Spain. The evaluation process of drugs and pricing models lacked transparency and integration of patients and clinicians, which was also criticized. The need to improve the availability of drugs in all hospitals and communities was emphasized, and the establishment of reference hospitals by zones was suggested. The event was moderated by Vicente Guillem, who is the director of Oncology at Vithas Valencia 9 de Octubre Hospital and Director of Institutional Relations at the ECO Foundation. The event also emphasized the importance of patients' participation in decision-making processes.

title: CCRm: los tratamientos dirigidos aumentan la eficacia y evitan toxicidades
summary: A clinical guide for the treatment of metastatic colorectal cancer (CCRm) recommends the use of innovative therapies to increase treatment efficacy and avoid toxicities. The guide, which was published by the Spanish Society of Medical Oncology (SEOM), the Spanish Multidisciplinary Group on Digestive Cancer (Gemcad), and the Digestive Tumors Treatment Group (TTD), highlights the importance of selecting the most appropriate treatment for each patient based on their individual case. The guide also emphasizes the need for a multidisciplinary team to analyze all factors involved in the diagnosis and treatment of CCRm. The president of TTD, Enrique Aranda, and experts such as Pilar García Alfonso contributed to the guide. The availability of innovative treatments for CCRm patients is crucial for their prognosis, and the guide recommends the use of targeted therapies to improve patient outcomes.

title: Cáncer de colon en jóvenes: 1 de cada 4 se detecta avanzado
summary: One in four cases of colon and rectal cancer in people under the age of 50 is diagnosed in an advanced stage due to a low suspicion rate. The Group of Digestive Tumor Treatment (TTD) has launched the campaign #Sospechososhabituales to raise awareness about the increase in cases of colon and rectal cancer in young people. Factors such as family history, genetics, obesity, sedentary lifestyle, alcohol consumption, processed meats, liver steatosis, and low vegetable intake have been linked to the increase in incidence. It is important to educate and raise awareness among both the population and medical professionals about the risks and the need for greater clinical suspicion in early detection. The colon cancer screening program was introduced in the basic services portfolio of the National Health System in 2014, but coverage and participation rates are still unequal among different autonomous communities.

title: Martha Alfonso: Pilar fundamental de la reforma a la salud de Guillermo Alfonso Jaramillo
summary: Martha Alfonso has played a crucial role in the healthcare reform proposed by Guillermo Alfonso Jaramillo, the former mayor of Ibagué and current Minister of Health. Her contributions to the ministry and her endorsement of Jaramillo's initiatives on social media have made her a valuable ally. However, some people in Tolima speculate that Jaramillo might shift his support to Renzo Garcia, a Green Alliance deputy and mayoral candidate. Despite past disagreements, experts suggest that Martha Alfonso's efforts towards healthcare reform cannot be overlooked, and Jaramillo may end up backing Garcia. This could have a direct impact on Marco Emilio Hincapié's aspirations to become mayor.

title: Europe Is Facing a Pancreatic Cancer Emergency
summary: Pancreatic cancer is the fourth leading cause of cancer-related deaths in Europe, with mortality rates over 90%. By 2030, it is predicted to become the second most common cause of cancer mortality. Lack of awareness, difficult diagnosis, no screening programs for the general population, poor survival rate, and limited treatment options are some of the challenges faced in pancreatic cancer. Professor Alfredo Carrato, the chairperson of Pancreatic Cancer Europe, suggests that lifestyle in Europe plays a part in the high incidence of pancreatic cancer. There is a need for primary prevention programs to modify lifestyle risks, funds for translational and clinical research, and blood or stool tests that have high specificity and sensitivity that are cost-effective. Encouraging developments include the European PANCAID project and the European Union (EU)-funded PANCAIM project. More research funding, centralized surgery, and networking between European countries are needed to improve cancer care in Europe.

title: Sequential Therapy Boosts Survival in Metastatic Pancreatic Cancer
summary: Sequential therapy with nab-paclitaxel plus gemcitabine followed by modified oxaliplatin, leucovorin, and fluorouracil (mFOLFOX) has been found to improve overall survival (OS) in patients with metastatic pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC) compared to traditional nab-paclitaxel/gemcitabine therapy, according to a randomized phase II study. The study showed a 32% reduced risk of death compared with standard treatment. The SEQUENCE trial included 157 adults with histologically or cytologically confirmed stage IV PDAC without central nervous system metastasis, measurable disease according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) version 1.1, no previous systemic or investigational therapy for metastatic disease, and an ECOG performance status of 0 to 1. The trial was supported by the Spanish Cooperative Group for the Treatment of Digestive Tumors through a grant provided by Celgene. Alfredo Carrato, MD, PhD, of Alcalà University in Madrid, was among the researchers who conducted the study.

title: Cemex's roadmap to decarbonising the cement industry
summary: Cemex Ventures' Investment and Open Innovation Advisor, Alfredo Carrato, has provided a detailed roadmap for the cement industry to follow in order to reduce carbon emissions. The global construction industry produces more than 4.4 billion tonnes of concrete annually, making it one of the most polluting materials due to the CO2 emissions produced during the production of clinker, a key component in cement. Cemex aims to reduce its CO2 emissions to below 475 kg by 2030, which represents a reduction of over 40% in emissions under its Future In Action program. The company's other goals for 2030 include increasing alternative fuel usage to 35%, achieving a 41% reduction in carbon content in concrete, and reducing transportation emissions by 30%, among others, in order to achieve its ultimate goal of becoming a net-zero CO2 company by 2050. Cemex has partnered with companies such as HiiROC, Carbon Upcycling, and ETFuels to achieve these goals.

title: Impact of the COVID-19 pandemic in the early-onset colorectal cancer
summary: The COVID-19 pandemic has impacted cancer care globally, including for those with early onset colorectal cancer (EOCRC). However, a study at Vall d'Hebron University Hospital in Spain found that the pandemic's first wave did not affect the frequency or stage at diagnosis or first visit compared to the same period in 2019 and 2021. Adjuvant or metastatic systemic therapy was also not changed, and treatment initiation and clinical trial enrollment were not affected. The study aimed to identify clinicopathological features and outcomes of EOCRC patients during the pandemic. Elena Élez was one of the study's authors.

title: “Un déficit del sistema es que los médicos se forman en tiempo de ocio”
summary: Ana Fernández Montes, a board member of the Spanish Society of Medical Oncology (SEOM) and a medical oncologist at the University Hospital Complex of Ourense (CHUO), pointed out that the lack of time and funding for doctors to update their knowledge and skills is a deficit of the Spanish healthcare system. She stated this in an interview with Gaceta Médica about the publication of an article in Clinical and Translational Oncology that analyzes the workload and needs of medical oncology in Spain. The article demonstrates that the number of medical oncologists needs to increase to provide quality care, considering the expected increase in the incidence of cancer and the retirement of current medical oncologists. The article is based on two online surveys conducted in 2021 and 2022.

title: Retos de la oncología médica: desarrollo profesional, carga y condiciones laborales
summary: The precarious working conditions and lack of a motivating career path for medical oncologists could compromise their incorporation and permanence in the Spanish National Health System, according to an analysis by the Spanish Society of Medical Oncology. The study highlights the need to achieve optimal proportions of these specialists to alleviate workloads and address comprehensive cancer care. The study also reveals a shortage of medical oncologists in Spain and the need to hire between 87 and 110 new specialists per year to achieve an optimal proportion of 110 to 130 new patients per medical oncologist in 2040. The study proposes improving hiring and career development to retain young oncologists and prevent them from emigrating to other countries or engaging in clinical tasks. The study was conducted by Dr. Ana Fernández Montes, the national coordinator of the study and a medical oncology specialist at the University Hospital Complex of Ourense.

title: El cáncer se extiende entre los menores de 50 años
summary: A new international report published in the British Medical Journal Oncology states that cancers are increasing significantly among people under 50 years old, particularly breast and colon cancers. The number of cases grew by 79% between 1990 and 2019. Ana Fernández Montes, spokesperson for the Spanish Society of Oncology, confirms that this rise is especially noticeable in colon and breast cancer. The report is based on data from 204 countries and regions around the world, covering a total of 29 common cancers. The authors admit that genetic factors play a role, but lifestyle factors such as diets rich in red meat, salt, and low in fruit and milk, as well as alcohol and tobacco consumption, physical inactivity, excess weight, and high blood sugar levels, are believed to be the main causes. The report challenges the belief that cancer is a disease linked to aging.

title: Estudio CONFIDENCE para cáncer colorrectal metastásico con mutación en BRAFV600E
summary: The CONFIDENCE study has verified that encorafenib and cetuximab are effective and safe for treating metastatic colorectal cancer with BRAFV600E mutation in second-line treatment. The study was presented at the Symposium on Gastrointestinal Tumors of the American Society of Medical Oncology (ASCO) and involved Spanish researchers. Oncologist Ana Fernández Montes, who participated in the study, highlighted the positive results and emphasized the importance of analyzing toxicity data. She also stressed the need for agile, rigorous, and transparent evaluation of drugs by a multidisciplinary group. Encorafenib is not currently available in the Spanish National Health System, but it is expected to be soon. Fernández Montes also discussed the importance of studies like CONFIDENCE in showing the value of health economics at a local level. The study's results reinforce those of the BEACON trial and support the use of encorafenib and cetuximab in second-line treatment for patients with BRAF mutations.

title: Acceso a la formación y nuevas tecnologías, factores clave para el desarrollo profesional de los oncólogos
summary: Ana Fernández Montes, a member of the Board of Directors of the Spanish Society of Medical Oncology (SEOM), emphasized the significance of ongoing training and the utilization of new technologies for medical professionals working in the field of oncology. During her speech at the I Virtual Congress of Gastrointestinal Oncology, organized by MSD, Montes highlighted the necessity for professionals to stay updated with the fast-paced advancements in the field. She also commended the use of virtual training options to assist them in doing so. The congress, which spans several days, includes sessions from national and international experts in oncology, nursing, pathology, and hospital pharmacy. The event is supported by the Grupo de Tratamiento de Tumores Digestivo, the Grupo Español Multidisciplinar en Cáncer Digestivo, and EUROPACOLON.

title: UCF Puerto Rico Research Hub Receives $500K to Expand Research
category: The text can be categorized as 'Research'.
summary: The UCF Puerto Rico Research Hub has received $500,000 in funding to expand its research capabilities to better track key social and economic trends. The funding will be used to provide insight to community leaders and government officials on how best to serve communities with significant Puerto Rican populations. Fernando Rivera, PRRH director, founded the PRRH after Hurricane Maria devastated the island in 2017, resulting in a surge of the Puerto Rican population in Central Florida. The hub provides essential information about Puerto Rico and the Puerto Rican population to communities throughout Florida and elsewhere in the United States. The funding will allow the PRRH to conduct polls on key social and education issues, invest in communication and marketing tools, hire new research staff, support community focus groups and events that assist with research, purchase technology and software. The information garnered from the PRRH’s research will enable government officials and community leaders to make more informed decisions as to how best to allocate resources to serve communities with significant Puerto Rican populations.

title: Eduardo Díaz-Rubio: «Morir de cáncer de colon sería una rareza si todo el mundo se hiciese cribados»
summary: Eduardo Díaz-Rubio, the president of the Real Academia de Medicina, emphasized the importance of early detection and prevention of colon cancer on the occasion of World Colon Cancer Day. He stated that colon cancer is the most common malignant tumor in Spain and can be detected early through screening. Díaz-Rubio explained that all autonomous communities in Spain have a screening plan for colon cancer, but the problem is that it does not reach the general population or the population does not attend. He suggested that if everyone was screened, dying from colon cancer would be rare. He also mentioned new screening methods such as DNA testing in stools and liquid biopsies, which could potentially replace current methods. Díaz-Rubio called for the implementation of liquid biopsies in all hospitals to detect the likelihood of recurrence in colon cancer patients.

title: El doctor Eduardo Díaz-Rubio, nuevo presidente del Instituto de España
summary: Eduardo Díaz-Rubio has been appointed as the new president of the Institute of Spain, which coordinates the functions of all national real academies. He is also currently the president of the Royal National Academy of Medicine in Spain. The Institute of Spain is a service entity for the activities of the academies it integrates. Diaz-Rubio's appointment follows the retirement of Benigno Pendás, the former president of the Royal Academy of Moral and Political Sciences. Diaz-Rubio is a medical graduate and has a doctorate from the University of Madrid. He has been a professor of medicine at the Complutense University of Madrid and has been involved in various oncology organizations. Diaz-Rubio's areas of interest in oncology are digestive tumors, translational research, clinical trials in oncology, oncologist training, and planning cancer patient care.

title: La RANME apuesta por el diagnóstico precoz para tratar a pacientes con cáncer de colon y recto
summary: The Real Academia Nacional de Medicina de España (RANME) is advocating for early diagnosis of colon and rectal cancer to improve treatment outcomes. Eduardo Díaz-Rubio, the president of RANME, states that the Spanish National Health System should cover sequencing tests on tissue and blood to help with early diagnosis. There are around 42,771 new cases of colon and rectal cancer in Spain each year, making it the most common malignant tumor in the country. Díaz-Rubio emphasizes the importance of campaigns to raise awareness and educate the public. For low-risk cases, surgery is sufficient for a cure, while high-risk cases require complementary chemotherapy. Díaz-Rubio also highlights the importance of personalized treatment based on genomic sequencing for patients with advanced cancer. He believes that these tests should be available to all patients and covered by the National Health System.

title: Presentación del primer diccionario hispanoamericano de términos médicos, en imágenes
summary: The first Hispanic-American medical terminology dictionary has been presented with the aim of facilitating communication between the population and medical professionals in Spain and America. Eduardo Díaz-Rubio, president of the Royal National Academy of Spanish Medicine, contributed to this project coordinated by the RANME. The dictionary is available as a mobile application and website. The project was coordinated by the Unidad de Terminología Médica and led by Cristina González, a lexicographer and general coordinator of the unit. The presentation was attended by other coordinators and contributors, including Antonio Campos and José Miguel García-Sagredo. The dictionary is expected to improve communication and understanding between Spanish-speaking medical professionals and patients.

title: Nace el primer Diccionario panhispánico de términos médicos (DPTM)
summary: The Real Academia Nacional de Medicina de España (RANME) and the Asociación Latinoamericana de Academias Nacionales de Medicina, España y Portugal (ALANAM) have presented the 'Diccionario panhispánico de términos médicos (DPTM)', the first dictionary with common and agreed medical language to facilitate communication between the population and medical professionals in Spain and America, who represent more than 500 million Spanish speakers. The DPTM includes more than 70,000 terms with their equivalent in American English, including synonyms, graphic variants, incorrect terms, colloquial and infrequent. Eduardo Díaz-Rubio, president of the RANME, says that the DPTM consolidates Spanish as a language of first-rate scientific communication and vehicle for the transmission of medical and health knowledge.

title: Cada año se diagnostican más de 42.000 nuevos casos de cáncer de colon y recto, el más frecuente en España
summary: Every year, more than 42,000 new cases of colon and rectal cancer are diagnosed in Spain, with a survival rate of over 60%. Eduardo Díaz-Rubio, the president of the Royal National Academy of Medicine of Spain, stated that early detection is crucial and can be achieved through awareness campaigns and informed populations following established guidelines. The recommended screening test is a fecal occult blood test that can be supplemented with a colonoscopy. For low-risk localized cases, surgery is sufficient, while high-risk cases may require complementary chemotherapy. The challenge is to select patients who require chemotherapy, and ctDNA tumor determination through sequencing tests in tissue and blood can be used to detect minimal residual disease. Diaz-Rubio emphasized the importance of early diagnosis and incorporating genomic tests into treatment plans. Diaz-Rubio is an expert in colon and rectal cancer, a former president of the Spanish Society of Medical Oncology, and the current president of the Royal National Academy of Medicine of Spain and the Institute of Spain.

title: Nace el primer diccionario con lenguaje médico común para España y Latinoamérica
summary: The Real Academia Nacional de Medicina de España (RANME) and the Asociación Latinoamericana de Academias Nacionales de Medicina, España y Portugal (ALANAM) have created the first common medical dictionary for Spain and Latin America. The dictionary contains over 70,000 terms and aims to facilitate communication between medical professionals and the population, as well as avoid misunderstandings. The dictionary includes the richness of the biomedical lexicon of the Spanish-speaking world and consolidates Spanish as a language of scientific communication in medical and health knowledge. The dictionary also recommends the use of Spanish alternatives over Anglicisms where possible. The project involved the participation of the Academies of Medicine of twelve Latin American countries.

title: El primer diccionario hispanoamericano de términos médicos pone fin a las barreras lingüísticas en la consulta
summary: The Real Academia Nacional de Medicina de España has launched the first pan-Hispanic medical dictionary, which includes over 70,000 Spanish-speaking medical terms. The dictionary was created with the collaboration of 13 other countries and is available for free on the website www.dptm.es. The dictionary functions through a search engine, available in both Spanish and English, that provides definitions and recommendations on the use of terms. The dictionary is constantly updated and aims to improve communication between doctors and patients and eliminate language barriers. Eduardo Díaz-Rubio, the president of the Real Academia Nacional de Medicina de España, acknowledges that the dictionary project had been in progress for eight years and that it has been an intense and continuous process. The dictionary is a multicultural initiative and aims to reach not only medical professionals but also patients, translators, and students.

title: La Real Academia Nacional de Medicina otorga a Luisa López Díaz-Ufano la distinción como mejor médico de Familia ...
summary: The Real Academia Nacional de Medicina has awarded Luisa López Díaz-Ufano as the best Family doctor in Spain. López Díaz-Ufano is a physician at the Reyes Católicos Health Center of the SERMAS and has been a tutor of Family and Community Medicine since 2015. She has an extensive curriculum in training, research, and participation in various scientific societies. The award was presented during the inaugural session of the 2023 Academic Course of the institution. The event marked the first time it was held in-person since the COVID-19 pandemic. The President of the Real Academia Nacional de Medicina, Eduardo Díaz-Rubio, gave the opening speech. López Díaz-Ufano's candidacy was supported by various scientific societies, including the Spanish Society of Primary Care Physicians (SEMERGEN), the European Respiratory Society, and the Spanish Society of Community Nutrition.

title: Los oncólogos apuestan por combinar la investigación con atender pacientes
summary: Less than 1% of doctors and healthcare professionals who provide clinical care to patients also pursue a career in research, according to the president of the Spanish Association for Cancer Research (Aseica), Marisol Soengas. Aseica has proposed creating the category of "doctor-researcher," recognising research in professional trajectories, increasing funding for individual and collaborative projects, regulating different services to include researchers, starting scientific training from universities, and facilitating the transfer of oncology innovations to the healthcare system. Eduardo Díaz-Rubio, one of the oncologists who participated in the event, emphasised the need to accelerate cancer research as much as possible to achieve a 70% survival rate by 2030. The lack of clinical research programs, insufficient funding, and inadequate training in innovation are some of the challenges faced by the medical community.

title: La quimioterapia, las dianas terapéuticas y la inmunoterapia, principales avances en el tratamiento contra el cáncer
summary: Recent advances in cancer treatment, including chemotherapy, therapeutic targets, and immunotherapy, will be discussed at the XXV Symposium on Cancer Reviews. The event is scheduled from February 8 to 10, 2023, and will showcase the latest developments in cancer treatment. Eduardo Díaz-Rubio, the president of the National Academy of Medicine, highlighted that early diagnosis, new therapeutic targets, chemotherapy, and immunotherapy are the most significant innovations in cancer treatment over the past 25 years. The symposium will bring together professionals from various medical specialties to share new findings in oncology. The survival rate for cancer patients is increasing, and it is crucial to continue researching, particularly in rare tumors. The event will examine current and innovative diagnostic and therapeutic approaches for different types of cancer.

title: Juan Manuel Moreno | Lead Education Specialist
summary: Juan Manuel Moreno is the Lead Education Specialist at the Education Global Practice of the World Bank. He has worked on education development projects in 30 countries and is currently managing the Bank's education portfolio in Egypt. Dr. Moreno has published nine books and almost 90 journal articles and book chapters in the areas of education reform, curriculum development, school improvement, and teacher policies. He co-authored the World Bank's first global report on Secondary Education in 2005 and the 2013 World Bank Flagship Report on Jobs for Shared Prosperity. Prior to joining the Bank in 2002, he was an Associate Professor of Education at the Universidad Nacional de Educación a Distancia (UNED) in Spain.

title: Dr. Moreno: “El cribado genético prenatal es ético si diagnostica y cura, pero no si selecciona y etiqueta futuras vidas”
summary: Dr. José Manuel Moreno, Medical Director of the University of Navarra Clinic in Madrid, has stated that prenatal genetic screening is ethical if it is used to diagnose and cure, but not if it is used to select and label future lives. He has highlighted the technological advancements that have improved the medical approach to pregnancy and the risks of categorizing people from the maternal womb. He has emphasized that categorizing people based on their characteristics is not ethical because every human being has their dignity, regardless of their physical or pathological conditioning. The positive aspect of prenatal technological advancements is that they can help gynecologists and obstetricians monitor complex pregnancy cases, prepare better to assist parents in managing complicated information, and provide precise diagnostic timing.

title: José Manuel Moreno: "Un consumo diario de bebidas energéticas afecta al desarrollo del menor"
summary: Dr. José Manuel Moreno, a specialist in pediatrics at the Clínica Universidad de Navarra, warns about the negative effects of daily consumption of energy drinks on the development of minors aged between 14 and 17 years old. He expresses concern over the increasing number of cases of cardiovascular problems, increased heart rate, sleep disorders, and addiction caused by these drinks.

title: Doctor Moreno, un médico contra la eugenesia: «En vez de proporcionarles medios para vivir los abocan a una muerte cercana»
summary: Dr. José Manuel Moreno Villares, a pediatrician and bioethics expert at the Clínica Universidad de Navarra in Madrid, has written a book titled "Hijos a la Carta?: Diagnóstico prenatal y eugenesia infantil" to shed light on the reality of families with children with disabilities and their struggles with eugenics, euthanasia, and abortion. He emphasizes the importance of understanding the reasons behind prenatal diagnosis and the reality faced by families. He also discusses the importance of treating children with disabilities as equals and recognizing their inherent human dignity. Dr. Moreno Villares opposes eugenics and euthanasia, stating that instead of providing means for children with disabilities to live, they are being pushed towards a premature death. He also calls for the implementation of laws and resources for palliative care for children with life-limiting illnesses.

title: Higiene del sueño, dieta de pantallas, comidas en familia y actitud optimista para una ‘vuelta al cole’ más saludable
summary: Dr. José Manuel Moreno, director of the Department of Pediatrics at the University of Navarra Clinic, recommends parents to focus on the positive aspects of the new school year and to lead by example. He emphasizes the importance of gradually preparing for the routine of school, including establishing a sufficient sleep schedule and hygiene, limiting screen time for children, and promoting healthy eating habits. Dr. Moreno Villares also highlights the negative effects of excessive screen time on child development, including learning difficulties, social isolation, and behavioral problems. He suggests that parents should limit screen time to one and a half hours per day for children between 2 and 5 years old and two hours per day for children over 6 years old.

title: Los primeros pasos en la vacuna contra la alergia al cacahuete prometen
summary: The Clínica Universidad de Navarra and the Hospital Universitario de Navarra have started a clinical trial for the first immunotherapy to treat peanut allergy, called INP20. The treatment is made up of nanoparticles containing peanuts that control the activation of immune cells, and the results so far show good tolerance and safety. The trial is taking place in Madrid and Pamplona, and recruitment is ongoing. Currently, there is no definitive treatment available for peanut allergy, which affects over 200,000 people in Spain. The vaccine was developed by InnoUp Farma, a Navarrese biotechnology company. The trial results will be presented at the annual congress of the American Academy of Allergy, Asthma and Immunology in Washington. The clinical trial is being coordinated by Dr. Marta Ferrer and Dr. Ana Tabar, and is the outcome of the research group "Allergies, new forms of immunotherapy and immunological bases" of the Navarra Health Research Institute (IdiSNA).

title: La Dra. Marta Ferrer recibe el Premio Clemens von Pirquet de la Academia Europea de Alergia
summary: Dr. Marta Ferrer, who is a specialist in clinical immunology and allergy at the University of Navarra Clinic and also the dean of the Faculty of Medicine at the University of Navarra, has been honored with the "Clemens Von Pirquet" award by the European Academy of Clinical Allergy and Immunology. Her research work in the field of urticaria and angioedema mechanisms and adjuvants in immunotherapy has led to the development of new treatments that have positively impacted the lives of patients suffering from these conditions. Dr. Ferrer expressed her appreciation to the Clinic for supporting and facilitating this model of assistance, teaching, and research. She received her medical education from the University of Zaragoza and completed her specialty at the University of Navarra Clinic before pursuing further training in the United States.

title: Alergia al cacahuete: todo lo que debes saber de esta prometedora vacuna
summary: The University Clinic of Navarra and the Navarra University Hospital are conducting a clinical trial for the first immunotherapy to treat peanut allergy. The treatment consists of nanoparticles containing peanut that can regulate immune cells' activation, showing promising results in terms of tolerance and safety. The vaccine has been given to 32 peanut-allergic patients, and the findings will be presented at the annual congress of the American Academy of Allergy, Asthma, and Immunology in Washington. InnoUp Farma, a biotech company based in Navarra, developed the vaccine, and the clinical trial is led by Dr. Marta Ferrer and Dr. Ana Tabar. If the vaccine proves to be effective, it could lead to the development of other vaccines to treat different food allergies.

title: La vacuna contra la alergia al cacahuete cada vez más cerca: así cambiará la vida de miles de españoles
summary: The University Clinic of Navarra and the Navarra University Hospital have initiated a clinical trial for the first immunotherapy to cure peanut allergies. The treatment involves a compound of nanoparticles that contain peanuts, which can regulate the activation of T-cells, a type of immune cell, and prevent the immune system from recognizing peanuts as foreign. The vaccine has been tested on 32 patients with peanut allergies, and the results are encouraging in terms of good tolerance and safety. Currently, there is only one desensitizing treatment, but it does not have a definitive effect, only allowing the treated person to acquire temporary tolerance to this product. The vaccine has been developed by the Navarrese biotechnology company InnoUp Farma. The results of the trial will be presented at the annual congress of the American Academy of Allergy, Asthma, and Immunology in Washington.

title: Un estudio demuestra que la Enfermería Clínica Avanzada impacta de forma positiva en pacientes, organización y ...
summary: A recent study conducted by the Clínica Universidad de Navarra and published in the Clinical Nurse Specialist journal has identified the benefits of the presence of Advanced Clinical Nursing (ACN) in nursing teams, patients and families, as well as in hospital organizations. ACN is a highly important but also highly unknown figure. The study, conducted by nurses and researchers Monica Vázquez Calatayud, Carmen Rumeu Casares, Cristina Oroviogoicoechea and Rosana Goñi Viguria, explores the perceptions of nurses about the specialized clinical nursing practice implemented in a high-specialty university hospital in Spain. The study concludes that the presence of ACN in any unit where they perform their competencies to the "full of practice" leads to better and more reliable results, as it facilitates evidence of results.

title: El Colegio de Enfermeras de Navarra entrega los premios de las convocatorias “Enfermera Innova” y Jornada de Investigación
summary: The Official College of Nurses of Navarra has awarded four research studies in two categories, the "Enfermera Innova" award and the VI Research Conference. The coaching study to evaluate the effectiveness of health coaching for empowering hospitalized patients with chronic heart failure to be discharged won the "Enfermera Innova" award in the category of established projects. The study was presented by a team of nurses from the University Clinic of Navarra, including Carmen Rumeu Casares. The awards aim to distinguish improvement or research projects related to nursing interventions in any area developed in Navarra. The awards were organized by the College of Nurses and Nursing Now Navarra. The VI Research Conference awards were given to a study on the impact of a training class for nurses on total parenteral nutrition and a poster on a case of inflammatory skin disease around a stoma.

title: Un estudio de Vall d'Hebron descubre un mecanismo que
summary: A study conducted by Vall d'Hebron has discovered a mechanism used by SARS-CoV-2 related to its transmissibility. The virus benefits from producing or not producing defective genomes to increase its transmissibility. The study found that the variants that appeared at the beginning of the pandemic had a significant proportion of defective genomes, but later variants such as Alpha, Beta, and Delta did not. The study also found that the Omicron variant initially had defective genomes, but its subvariants lost them. The research was conducted by the Liver Diseases and Microbiology groups at the Vall d'Hebron Institute of Research (VHIR) with the Microbiology, Clinical Biochemistry, and Preventive Medicine Services of the Vall d'Hebron University Hospital. The study was led by Dr. Josep Quer, the principal researcher of the Liver Diseases group at VHIR, and Dr. Andrés Antón, the head of the Respiratory Virus Unit at the Microbiology Service of the Vall d'Hebron University Hospital. The study was supported by the Department of Health's General Directorate of Research and Innovation in Health, the Carlos III Health Institute's CIBER for Infectious Diseases and Hepatic and Digestive Diseases, and the Center for Industrial Technological Development in collaboration with Roche Diagnostics. Carmen Ferrer de Cabo, a researcher in Preventive Medicine and Epidemiology at the Vall d'Hebron University Hospital, was also involved in the research.

title: Francisco Javier Martín Méndez completa su reto: 3.600 kilómetros entre Ecija y Dakar
summary: Francisco Javier Martín Méndez ha completado con éxito su desafío benéfico de ciclismo de 3,600 kilómetros desde Écija (Sevilla) hasta Dakar para recaudar fondos para la investigación de la diabetes. Su nieto, Juan José, fue diagnosticado con diabetes tipo 1, lo que lo llevó a apoyar a la Fundación Diabetes Cero. El desafío, llamado "Un abuelo rumbo a Dakar", lo llevó a través de cuatro países, incluyendo más de 1,800 kilómetros a través del desierto. El objetivo era recaudar €5,000 para la fundación. Los esfuerzos de Francisco fueron un éxito, y ha regresado a casa en Écija.

title: Estela Martín: «Más compliance laboral y menos postureo»
summary: Estela Martín, a lawyer and journalist, has written a book about labor compliance and strategic people management. In an interview, she stresses the importance of compliance in achieving excellence in strategic people management, and discusses new challenges such as artificial intelligence, the potential for a four-day workweek, and the future of teleworking. She also points out the lack of a compliance culture in Spain, and the high percentage of non-compliance with labor obligations, including equal pay plans, daily time records, and digital disconnection protocols. The book, entitled "From Labor Compliance to Strategic People Management of the 21st Century: Practical Keys and New Trends," is published by Lettera Publications and features a prologue by José Francisco Zamarriego, president of ASCOM.

title: Repaso a fondo al estado del sector del cumplimiento normativo por ASCOM en el Día del Compliance Officer
summary: The Spanish Association of Compliance (ASCOM) celebrated the Compliance Officer Day and its 10th anniversary at an event in Madrid that assessed the state of the sector. José Zamarriego, the president of the ASCOM Board of Directors, emphasized the significance of the Compliance Officer in society and ASCOM's role in promoting compliance culture. The event covered practical topics for Compliance Officers, such as expert witnesses in compliance in criminal proceedings and success stories in companies such as Moody's Analytics, Iberdrola, and LexisNexis Risk Solutions. The day also explored conflict of interest management in family businesses and the regulatory framework for sustainability in Spain. The event was a chance to contemplate the relevance of the Compliance Officer and address key issues in the field of regulatory compliance.

title: Marian Rojas señala el pensamiento que puede llevarnos a enfermar físicamente: "Llevo años diciéndolo"
summary: Marian Rojas Estapé, a well-known psychiatrist in Spain and beyond, has presented her book 'Recupera tu mente, reconquista tu vida' on the radio show La Linterna. The book is divided into four sections: dopamine, prefrontal cortex, networks, and tools for managing these. Rojas explains that dopamine is important because it is the hormone of pleasure, but it can also lead to addiction. She emphasizes the need to manage the "reward system", which modulates habits and dopamine release, to avoid falling into undesirable addictions. Rojas also highlights the risks of living in a constant state of alert, which can lead to physical and mental illness. She explains that the brain is not designed to be in a constant state of alert and that this can modify the immune and nervous systems, leading to illness. Marian Rojas Estapé is known for her unique way of explaining the mind through examples that everyone can understand.

title: Marian Rojas Estapé, psiquiatra, lanza nuevo libro: "Quien no sabe lo que quiere, no puede ser feliz"
summary: Marian Rojas Estapé, the best-selling Spanish psychiatrist, has released her new book "Recupera tu mente, reconquista tu vida" which focuses on the urgent need to regain our ability to concentrate. The book explores the consequences of living with too much intensity, constantly seeking novelty and instant gratification, and how it affects our cognitive abilities. Rojas Estapé explains how dopamine, the hormone that can be the best ally or worst enemy, works in relation to pleasure and provides routines to help manage our lives, including putting order in our thoughts, practicing dopamine fasting, embracing pain, and exercising. The book is already number one in Amazon's psychology books category. Rojas Estapé's previous books, "Cómo hacer que te pasen cosas buenas" and "Encuentra a tu persona vitamina," were top sellers for months and years on Amazon.

title: Santander dará este año en España más de 37.000 becas, ayudas y formación para mejorar la empleabilidad
summary: Banco Santander plans to help over 33,000 Spanish university students, professionals, and entrepreneurs to strengthen their academic career or improve their skills in 2024. The bank aims to improve the employability of people, especially young people whose unemployment rate is over 28% for those under 24 years old, promote business development of entrepreneurs and SMEs, and provide continuous training. The initiative is in collaboration with 80 universities, academic centers, and institutions. The bank has invested €105m in 2023 to support programs that promote education, employability, and entrepreneurship in all countries where it operates. Currently, the bank has open calls such as the Santander Scholarships for Erasmus or the Santander X Connects | Way to Santander X 100 for innovative startups and scaleups. Susana García Espinel, Director of Santander Universities and Universia Spain, said that the bank's main motivation is to improve people's professional prospects and the business development of entrepreneurs and SMEs through more than 37,000 scholarships and grants.

title: Banco Santander apoyará a más de 33.000 universitarios, profesionales y emprendedores españoles en 2024
summary: Banco Santander aims to support over 33,000 Spanish students, professionals, and entrepreneurs in 2024 by offering scholarships, grants, courses, awards, and specific training. The bank intends to improve the employability of these groups, focusing particularly on young people, as well as boosting the business development of start-ups and SMEs, and offering ongoing training. Banco Santander will collaborate with 80 universities, academic centers, and institutions.
