The plan will focus on four strategic areas: patients, healthcare professionals, healthcare management and sustainability, and government. Pascual emphasised the need to invest in digital transformation to keep up with societal changes and to provide citizens and healthcare professionals with the necessary tools to participate in healthcare. The plan will also focus on using technology to improve healthcare efficiency and sustainability, and to enhance public health and epidemiological surveillance. Pascual stressed the importance of collaboration with the technology and biosanitary industry to achieve the plan's ambitious goals. The announcement was made during the inaugural session of the "Digital Health. Cooperation with industry through European funds" conference.

title: César Pascual, el 'gurú' sanitario del PP cántabro, en el punto de mira por las adjudicaciones a Ferrovial
summary: César Pascual Fernández, un cirujano y gerente de salud, ha estado en el centro de atención debido a su presunta participación en la adjudicación de contratos a Ferrovial, una empresa multinacional española. Pascual ha sido miembro del Partido Popular (PP) y un servidor público, desempeñando el cargo de director-gerente del Hospital Universitario Marqués de Valdecilla en Santander. También ha ocupado cargos de alto rango en los gobiernos de Madrid y Cantabria. Pascual ha sido un defensor vocal de la gestión empresarial en el sector de la salud y ha defendido el uso de la tecnología para mejorar los servicios de salud. También ha sido acusado de promover la privatización en el sector. Ferrovial ha sido adjudicataria de varios contratos en los últimos años, incluido un contrato de 900 millones de euros para un hospital en Cantabria, lo que ha suscitado preguntas sobre la relación de Pascual con la empresa. Pascual ha anunciado su retiro de la política y la fuerza laboral.

title: María Souto, nueva secretaria general de la Consejería de Salud en Cantabria
summary: María Souto Aller ha sido nombrada como la nueva secretaria general de la Consejería de Salud en Cantabria. Ha sido parte del Gobierno de Cantabria durante más de 20 años y ha ocupado varios cargos de responsabilidad. Souto ha sido la jefa del Servicio de Personal de Justicia de la Dirección General de Cantabria durante los últimos 13 años. El objetivo de la nueva estrategia es establecer una relación más "fluida" con las empresas y los ciudadanos y una administración pública que sirva como "aliado", eliminando obstáculos burocráticos. Los nuevos secretarios generales formarán la Comisión de secretarios generales, que prepara los asuntos que se deliberarán en el Consejo de Gobierno cada semana. Los nuevos secretarios generales han sido elogiados por sus cualidades, experiencia y capacidad de trabajo.

title: Nuevos directores generales en Cantabria: Salud Pública, Planificación y Servicio Cántabro de Salud
summary: María Isabel de Frutos Iglesias has been appointed as the new Director General of Public Health in Cantabria. The government of Cantabria has made several new appointments, including Luis Carretero Alcántara as the Director General of the Cantabrian Health Service, and Miguel Ángel Soria Milla as the Sub-Director General of Health Care Assistance. The government has also appointed Óscar Fernández Torre as the Director General of Planning, Management of Knowledge, and Digital Health, and María Isabel Priede Díaz as the Director General of Pharmacy, Humanization, and Socio-Health Coordination. María Isabel de Frutos Iglesias is a licensed physician and surgeon, and has served as a medical inspector and head of the inspection area of the Social Security Health Inspection Body in the Reinosa area of Cantabria. She has also served as the medical director of the Sierrallana Hospital and the sub-director of Health Care Assistance of the Cantabrian Health Service.

title: Nuevos directores generales en Cantabria: Salud Pública, Planificación y Servicio Cántabro de Salud
summary: The government of Cantabria has announced new appointments for various departments, including health. Luis Carretero Alcántara has been named as the director of Cantabrian Health Service, while Maria Isabel de Frutos Iglesias will serve as the director general of Public Health. Miguel Ángel Soria Milla has been appointed as the subdirector general of Health Care, and María Isabel Priede Díaz will serve as the director general of Pharmacy, Humanization and Sociosanitary Coordination. Additionally, Óscar Fernández Torre has been named as the new director general of Planning, Organization, Knowledge Management and Digital Health.

title: La Universidad de Cantabria alberga el Comité Ejecutivo de CRUE-Docencia
summary: The Executive Committee of CRUE-Docencia met at the University of Cantabria under the presidency of Ángel Pazos Carro. The committee reviewed the work done in the various commissions and working groups, including the recommendation of the Council of Universities on the equivalence declaration procedure between the academic level of doctor and the state of online teaching in different universities. The situation of the national plan of micro-credentials and its application in universities in the next academic year was also analyzed. The CRUE-Docencia Sectorial Commission was created in 2019 to coordinate the teaching lines of Spanish universities and is composed of political representatives with competencies in this area. The committee's mission is to formulate proposals and recommendations to the relevant authorities and bodies.

title: La asociación 'La Columbeta' recibe el Premio a la Igualdad de la Universidad de Cantabria
summary: The association 'La Columbeta' has been honored with the VII Equality Award by the University of Cantabria on the occasion of International Women's Day. The award was presented by the university's rector, Ángel Pazos Carro, and recognizes the association's efforts to promote gender equality and support women in rural areas, where opportunities for women are scarce. The association, which is a non-profit organization, was founded in 2008 to manage social programs and projects that promote rural development in Cantabria. Its projects include 'Iris', which provides employment support and advice for unemployed or socially disadvantaged women, and 'Jumping the Digital Gap', which aims to reduce the digital divide for rural women by promoting digital accessibility and advocating for the right to access ICTs. Raquel Martínez Martínez, representing the association, received the award.

title: Pilar Paneque, directora de ANECA, recibida por el rector de la UC, Ángel Pazos
summary: The rector of the University of Cantabria, Ángel Pazos Carro, met with the director of the National Agency for Quality Assessment and Accreditation (ANECA), Pilar Paneque Salgado, to discuss various issues related to the organization of university education and quality assurance. They talked about the Real Decreto 822/2021 and ANECA's role in institutional accreditation, among other topics. The meeting was attended by the university's vice-rectors and focused on issues related to the recognition of transfer periods. ANECA is responsible for evaluating and certifying the Spanish university system to improve its quality and adapt it to the European Higher Education Area. It was created by the Organic Law of Universities in 2001 and was later established as an Autonomous Body of the General Administration of the State.

title: La Fundación Leonardo Torres Quevedo entrega el Premio a la Colaboración Empresarial a la empresa INGECID
summary: The Leonardo Torres Quevedo Foundation at the University of Cantabria has awarded the XXI Business Collaboration Prize to INGECID, a spin-off company from the university. The prize was presented by the university's rector and president of the foundation, Ángel Pazos Carro. The collaboration prize was created over 20 years ago to recognise companies that have worked closely with the university and foundation in research, transfer and innovation. INGECID has a focus on international work, with 60% of its revenue coming from outside Spain, but more than 70% of its work is carried out in Cantabria. The company has also generated 90% of its revenue from innovation. Pazos Carro emphasised the importance of collaboration with companies and the transfer of knowledge from universities to industry.

title: La UC se une a la conmemoración del Día Internacional para la Eliminación de la Violencia contra las Mujeres con la ...
summary: The University of Cantabria (UC) has participated in the celebration of the International Day for the Elimination of Violence against Women with an event called "Harassment ends here." During the session, the measures included in the Protocol for the Prevention and Action against Any Form of Harassment at UC were presented. The event was led by the rector of UC, Ángel Pazos Carro, and the Director General of Equality and Women of the Government of Cantabria, Tamara González. The UC has launched an awareness campaign about harassment, which includes informative totems in the university's centers and videos that will be shared on social networks. The UC's first Protocol of Action against Harassment was approved in 2016 and was updated in 2022. The event featured a conference by María Concepción Torres Díaz, an expert in anti-discrimination protection, and a lecture by Tomás A. Mantecón Movellán, the Vice-Rector of Culture, Social Projection and Institutional Relations of UC.

title: Pazos y Zuloaga reciben a los 26 deportistas de Especial Relevancia de la Universidad de Cantabria
summary: A total of 26 students from the University of Cantabria, who balance their studies with their dedication to sports, have been recognized by the university community. The rector, Ángel Pazos Carro, and the vice-president of Cantabria, Pablo Zuloaga, congratulated the students for their sporting achievements and acknowledged the effort it takes to balance sports and university studies. The university provides an annual grant program to support and reward the work of these special relevance athletes. The program is open to students who meet certain criteria, such as being high-level athletes or having been called up to any national selection. The university recognizes the effort these students make and tries to facilitate their participation in competitions, both university and non-university, by adapting their classes and exams where possible, providing access to sports facilities, transportation scholarships, and economic aid.

title: Andrés Rafael Ortega Piris toma posesión como nuevo director de la Escuela Técnica Superior de Náutica de la UC
summary: Andrés Rafael Ortega Piris ha sido nombrado como el nuevo director de la Escuela Técnica Superior de Náutica de la UC, reemplazando a Antonio Trueba Cortés. El rector de la Universidad de Cantabria, Ángel Pazos Carro, presidió la ceremonia de inauguración y expresó su apoyo a Ortega Piris. Ortega Piris es capitán de la Marina Mercante, doctor en Marina Civil y profesor en la Universidad de Cantabria. Ha trabajado en el transporte marítimo de productos petrolíferos refinados y es responsable de enseñar Navegación en el Grado en Ingeniería Náutica y Transporte Marítimo y Sistemas de Gestión Integrados aplicados a la Planificación y Control de la Navegación en el Máster en Ingeniería Náutica y Gestión Marítima. Ortega Piris también ha sido subdirector de Planificación Académica en la Escuela Técnica Superior de Náutica de Santander desde 2021 y es el Investigador Principal del Grupo de I+D+i en Planificación y Gestión Oceánica y Costera en la Universidad de Cantabria.

title: Gregorio Lanza toma posesión como director del ICASS
summary: Gregorio Lanza Crespo has been appointed as the new director of the Cantabrian Institute of Social Services (ICASS). He has been praised by the Minister of Social Inclusion, Youth, Families and Equality, Begoña Gómez del Río, who has described him as a valuable asset to the department. Lanza has a degree in Business Administration and Management from Decroly College and has been working in the field of dependency and childhood since 1993. He also has extensive training in educational intervention with children and adolescents, family mediation, foster care, and conflict resolution. Lanza replaces Marcos de la Mora in the position.

title: Gregorio Lanza sustituirá a Marcos de la Mora como director del Instituto Cántabro de Servicios Sociales
summary: Gregorio Lanza Crespo has been appointed as the new director of the Cantabrian Institute of Social Services, replacing Marcos de la Mora. De la Mora had held the position for two and a half months before resigning for personal reasons. Lanza has been working in the dependency and childhood sector since 1993 and has a degree in Business Administration from Decroly College. He has also received training related to child care, family mediation, and conflict resolution.

title: Mª Isabel Priede, nueva D. G. de Farmacia, Humanización y Coordinación Sociosanitaria de Cantabria
summary: María Isabel Priede Díaz has been appointed as the new Director General of Pharmacy, Humanization, and Sociosanitary Coordination in Cantabria. She holds a degree in Medicine and Surgery and is a specialist in Family and Community Medicine. She has expertise in Health Education Methodology and is also a graduate in Management of Primary Care Organizations from the School of High Management and Administration and in Health Management and Organization. Additionally, she has a University Master's Degree in Direction and Management of Health Services. Priede Díaz has been a member of the Board of Directors of the Medical College of Cantabria as a member of doctors in training and is a member of the Spanish Society of General Practitioners and Family Physicians and the Spanish Society of Health Managers.

title: Salud busca mejorar la atención farmacéutica en los centros sociosanitarios mediante depósitos de farmacia en los centros residenciales
summary: The Director General of Pharmacy, Humanization and Sociosanitary Coordination, Maria Isabel Priede, and the President of the Official College of Pharmacists, Rita de la Plaza, visited a pharmacy deposit with personalized drug dosing system in the 'Félix de las Cuevas' residence in Potes, Cantabria. The aim is to improve the pharmacological adherence of users of sociosanitary residences, offer quality pharmaceutical services, and ensure periodic medication review and territorial equity of provision. The implementation of this deposit in this sociosanitary space with less than 100 beds located in Potes opens the door to the extension of this measure to other places in the Autonomous Community with the aim of improving the adherence to drug treatment of people who have difficulties in handling or taking them.

title: Cantabria, Galicia y La Rioja tendrán derecho a voto en la CIPM durante el primer semestre | @diariofarma
summary: Cantabria, Galicia, and La Rioja will have the right to vote in the Comisión Interministerial de Precios de los Medicamentos (CIPM) during the first semester, as per the Ministry of Health. María Isabel Priede Díaz, Silvia María Reboredo García, and Gonzalo Aparicio Rodríguez will represent the autonomous communities. For the second semester, Murcia, Aragón, and Castilla-La Mancha will have the right to vote. The remaining representatives of the autonomous communities will be listeners. The CIPM is responsible for setting prices for medicines in Spain. The Ministry of Health has released a list of changes in the representatives of the organization. Javier Padilla is the president, and César Hernández is the vice-president.

title: Día clave para las startups científicas: el Institut Pasteur cierra su primera ronda de inversión
summary: LAB+, the company builder of Institut Pasteur Montevideo, has successfully completed its first round of capitalization to finance four startups in Uruguay. LAB+ aims to create private companies in the life sciences sector based on knowledge generated in Uruguay. With the funds raised, it will finance Guska, B4RNA, Scaffold Biotech, and LoCBio. These companies are focused on developing products, methods, and therapies to combat human and animal diseases such as cancer. This initiative is innovative in the local scientific ecosystem, as it supports the generation and valorization of knowledge for the benefit of society. Pilar Moreno is one of the co-founders of Guska, one of the startups that will receive funding from LAB+.

title: "Aprendimos que Uruguay tiene un sistema científico que responde", dijeron científicos a cuatro años de la pandemia
summary: Scientists Gonzalo Moratorio and Pilar Moreno from the Instituto Pasteur team spoke with Subrayado about the lessons they learned from Covid-19. They said that Uruguay has a scientific system that responds well to pandemics and emergencies. The Molecular Virology laboratory at the Nuclear Research Center conducted the first tests for the development of the SARS-COV 2 detection kit in Uruguay. The institute received the possibility of testing their methodology with something similar to the virus from collaborators. This opportunity demonstrated the capabilities of science in Uruguay. Moreno said that before the pandemic, very little was known about what scientists did in the country. The scientists added that even though new variants of the virus are emerging, they have not caused too many problems so far.

title: Bridging Nature and Education: SustyVibes and German Embassy Partner to Launch Bioverse NG Project for Nigerian ...
summary: SustyVibes and the German Embassy in Nigeria have partnered to launch the Bioverse NG Project, which aims to empower 200 young Nigerians with an understanding of biodiversity and its role in fostering a sustainable planet. The project includes a six-week virtual learning workshop, regional dialogues, and internship placements for the top three workshop participants. The project will culminate in a national conference that will bring together stakeholders involved in the project, along with government representatives, for a comprehensive dialogue on climate change and biodiversity in Nigeria. The project is a resolute commitment to understanding and appreciating Nigeria’s rich biodiversity for its role in sustaining a thriving environment. The initiative is for young people by young people and has been designed to help build and maintain the agency, optimism, and resilience needed in these times of polycrisis.

title: Professors to Research Entrepreneurship, Minimum Wage Through Haynes Foundation Grants | Pomona College in ...
hco: ASOCIACIÓN DE ASISTENCIA MÉDICAE INVESTIGACIÓN CLÍNICA
summary: Pomona College Economics Professors Fernando Lozano and Emiliano Huet-Vaughn have been awarded the 2023 Haynes Foundation Faculty Fellowship Awards to conduct research on minimum wage increases and entrepreneurship in Southern California's economy. The John Randolph Haynes and Dora Haynes Foundation provides grants to faculty members at four-year colleges in Southern California for social science research. Lozano's project, "Entrepreneurship and the Reinvention of the Los Angeles Economy," will analyze the role of entrepreneurship in the region's economy, while Huet-Vaughn's project, "When and How Much Do SoCal Firms Pass on Costs to Consumers: Learning From Local Minimum Wage Increases," will investigate whether companies charge consumers more to offset the cost of a higher minimum wage. Each professor will be given a $16,000 grant to support their research. Lozano and Huet-Vaughn are pleased to receive the fellowship and believe that their research will provide guidance to policymakers.

title: Mons. Jesús Sanz denuncia que "la ideología de género ha penetrado en la Iglesia" y lamenta la confusión...
hco: ASOCIACIÓN DE ASISTENCIA MÉDICAE INVESTIGACIÓN CLÍNICA
summary: Mons. Jesús Sanz, Archbishop of Oviedo, has expressed his opposition to gender ideology and its influence within the Church. He is concerned about the confusion caused by Fiducia supplicans and the uncertainty surrounding the baptism of transgender individuals. Sanz Montes differentiates between silence and muteness, stating that the latter is a result of cowardice. He believes that the anthropological confusion surrounding the relationship between men and women, the truth of men and women, and the pedagogy of allowing children to grow up healthily without redirecting them towards perverse anthropology has infiltrated the Church. Sanz Montes also criticizes the use of jargon associated with gender ideology, climate change, and the 2030 agenda, stating that not everyone subscribes to these ideas. He concludes that the Church has a 2000-year history of salvation and enough experience to reject confusion and sadness.

title: El presidente del Colegio de Médicos de Castellón Carlos Vilar: «Somos la provincia más olvidada y la infradotación ...
summary: Carlos Vilar Fabra, the President of the College of Physicians of Castellón, has stated that the province is the most neglected in terms of healthcare, and that there is a shortage of medical resources. He believes that the lack of personnel in certain specialties is a long-standing problem and that there needs to be better working conditions and job stability to attract and retain doctors. Vilar Fabra also believes that a new hospital is needed in Castellón, which should be modern and incorporate new technologies, including artificial intelligence. He hopes that the new hospital will alleviate the lack of space and improve patient services. The President of the College of Physicians also supports the use of telemedicine to improve the pressure on healthcare services.

title: Entrevista al presidente del Colegio de Médicos, Carlos Vilar: "Sin mejoras laborales y sin estabilidad no vamos a solucionar la falta de médicos"
summary: Carlos Vilar Fabra, President of the College of Physicians of Castellón, has stated in an interview that the shortage of doctors cannot be resolved without improving working conditions and stability. He stressed that the lack of acceptable working conditions in most specialties is the main issue, rather than the shortage of doctors. He also highlighted that the upcoming retirement of many active doctors will present a significant challenge and called for a generational replacement plan. Vilar Fabra suggested reducing the number of medical students in faculties, improving working conditions, and providing stability to young doctors to prevent them from leaving for other regions or countries. He also discussed the need to prioritize the integration of the Provincial Hospital into the health department of Castellón and to build a new hospital that can meet the province's needs.

title: El doctor Carlos Vilar toma posesión como presidente del Colegio de Médicos de Castellón
summary: Carlos Vilar Fabra ha sido inaugurado como el nuevo Presidente del Colegio Oficial de Médicos de Castellón (COMCAS). Sustituye a Eva Suárez, quien fue la tercera Presidenta en dos años. Vilar planea continuar el trabajo de sus predecesores, incluyendo acercar el colegio a la sociedad, promover la sostenibilidad y modernizar el colegio con tecnologías digitales. Actualmente es Jefe de Neurología en el Hospital General Universitario de Castellón (HGUCS) y en el Hospital Vithas Castellón. Vilar es graduado de la Universidad de Valencia y fue Presidente de la Sociedad Valenciana de Neurología de 2014 a 2016.

title: Carlos Vilar, nuevo presidente del Colegio de Médicos de Castellón
summary: Carlos Vilar Fabra has been elected as the new President of the College of Physicians of Castellón (Comcas) in Spain, replacing Eva Suárez who resigned to become a councilor of health in the Burriana City Council. Vilar Fabra is the head of the Neurology Section at the General University Hospital of Castellón (HGUC). He was the only candidate to present his candidacy within the deadline set by the Electoral Board.

title: El doctor Carlos Vilar es el nuevo presidente del Colegio de Médicos de Castellón
summary: Carlos Vilar Fabra has been elected as the new president of the Official College of Physicians of Castellón, replacing Eva Suárez who resigned after being elected as a councillor in Burriana. Vilar, who was the vice-president of the college, was the only candidate nominated for the position. He will hold the presidency for the next four years and will also continue to serve as the president of the Council of Official Medical Colleges of Valencia. The college aims to continue its work towards sustainable practices, including the use of clean energy and the reduction, recycling, and reusing of materials. The college also plans to modernize its operations and incorporate digital technologies to improve management and training. Vilar is a neurologist at the University General Hospital of Castellón.

title: Carlos Vilar, elegido nuevo presidente del Colegio Oficial de Médicos de Castellón
summary: Carlos Vilar has been elected as the new president of the Official College of Physicians of Castellón, replacing Eva Suárez. Vilar plans to focus on sustainability and the implementation of new digital technologies to modernize the organization, as well as advocating for the role of physicians in society. He will also continue to serve as the president of the Council of Official Medical Colleges of Valencia.

title: La Universidad de Oviedo inicia la instalación de aseos para personas ostomizadas en cinco campus
summary: The University of Oviedo in Spain has installed toilets specifically designed for people with ostomies. This makes it the second European academic institution to do so, following the University of Seville. The first of five toilets has already been installed at the university's Faculty of Law, with the remaining four to be installed before the end of the year. The initiative is a collaboration between the university's Vice-Rectorate of Institutional Relations and Coordination, the Vice-Gerencia of Infrastructures, and the Federation of Associations of Ostomized People (FAPOE), which is made up of 28 patient associations across Spain. Humberto Rodríguez Solla, Vice-Rector of Institutional Relations and Coordination, stated that the installation of these toilets is a "great step" towards improving the quality of life of ostomized people.

title: Mary's Meals, Princess of Asturias Award for Concord - Other News - Area of Communication and Media - The Princess ...
summary: Mary's Meals, a British non-profit organization that provides daily school meals to children in eighteen of the world's poorest countries, has been awarded the 2023 Princess of Asturias Award for Concord. The organization was founded in 2002 by Magnus MacFarlane-Barrow, and currently feeds 2,429,182 children every school day. The meals are cooked and distributed at their school by volunteers from the benefitting community. Each child has their own container to eat from, as this is the way to check that they belong to a school covered by the organization and that they attend class daily. Mary’s Meals is currently present in eighteen countries: Kenya, Liberia, South Sudan, Thailand, Zambia, Zimbabwe, Syria, Yemen, Niger, Ethiopia, Lebanon, Benin, Myanmar, Ecuador, Haiti, India, Madagascar and Malawi. The Princess of Asturias Awards are aimed at rewarding “the scientific, technical, cultural, social and humanitarian work carried out at an international level by individuals, institutions or groups of individuals or institutions”.

title: Jorge Vilda se queda solo en la selección: dimiten 11 integrantes de su cuerpo técnico
summary: Eleven members of the technical staff of the Spanish women's football team, including all women and some male colleagues, have resigned due to the "unacceptable attitudes" of Luis Rubiales, the president of the Spanish Football Federation. The resignation comes after Rubiales was embroiled in controversy for kissing player Jenni Hermoso during the World Cup celebrations. The team had previously issued a joint statement announcing they would not play until changes were made in the federation's leadership. The resignation of the staff of Jorge Vilda, the women's national team coach, follows the team's statement. Montse Tomé, the assistant technical coach, who was offered the role of sports director by Rubiales, also resigned.

title: Ngāti Manuhiri determined to eliminate killer algae – Te Ao Māori News
summary: Ngāti Manuhiri Settlement Trust in New Zealand is determined to eliminate “killer algae” that is spreading rapidly in the sea floor and water. The invasive seaweed, named Caulerpa, has been found in several places including Waiheke, Ahuahu, Bay of Islands, and Aotea. Ngāti Manuhiri has adopted a Caulerpa protocol to “reduce, remove and eliminate” the seaweed. The response plan is being driven by Māori and tikanga Māori, and a team of caulerpa experts from California has been invited to help. The actual removal process involves hard work as divers remove the seaweed from the seabed and water by hand. Eric Muñoz, author of Caulerpa Conquest, highlights the risk of letting Caulerpa go unchecked and says that it could affect tourism. Ngāti Manuhiri says it will take six to eight weeks to get rid of all the Caulerpa in Kawau.

title: Caleb Williams, Dr Pepper Award $100000 in College Tuition
summary: USC quarterback Caleb Williams and Dr Pepper have teamed up to award $100,000 in college tuition to two high school students from The Boys & Girls Clubs of Metro Los Angeles. They organized a recreation of the Dr Pepper Tuition Toss, where students competed to see who could throw the most footballs into an oversized soda can. Williams coached the two students who went head-to-head in the competition. Kamari B. won $50,000 in future tuition money from Dr Pepper by landing eight footballs in 30 seconds. After the check presentation, Williams surprised runner-up Julieta R. with a $50,000 match via Caleb Cares. The partnership has included elements of Williams' foundation, which focuses on eliminating bullying, increasing mental health awareness, and empowering youth.

title: In the news: Javier A. Juarez
summary: Javier A. Juarez has been hired as the new director of the Latino Equity Fund at the Boston Foundation. Juarez previously served as Senior Director of Advancement at the Massachusetts Immigrant and Advocacy Coalition (MIRA) and played an important role in the advocacy strategies that resulted in the Yes on 4 Campaign victory to protect the right of all immigrants to obtain driver’s licenses. He is a first-generation immigrant from Peru and holds a master’s degree from Brown University in American Studies. The Latino Equity Fund aims to address the immediate needs of Latinos and Latino-led organizations and to strengthen the LEF for the longer term. Juarez's experience and passion make him a perfect fit for the role of director of the LEF.

title: El primer chiste de Dani Rovira sobre su enfermedad lo cambió todo
summary: David Rovira, an actor and comedian who was diagnosed with Hodgkin's lymphoma in 2020, shared how humor helped him deal with his illness during an appearance on the show "No sé de qué me hablas." He mentioned that he cracked a joke about his own illness during a podcast, which enabled him to discuss making fun of his condition with his friends. Rovira believes that humor is a way of releasing emotions and can help overcome fear. He also highlighted the significance of learning from challenging times to lead a happier life. The episode, which included Nerea Pérez de las Heras, is accessible on the RTVE Play platform.

title: «Tenemos las herramientas para acabar con el VIH, pero no conseguimos hacerlo por el estigma»
summary: Jorge Garrido, executive director of the Apoyo Positivo association, stated that although there are tools to end HIV and AIDS, it is not achieved due to stigma. This is supported by the main objective of UNAIDS to end the virus by 2030. Stigma prevents people from approaching to get tested or specialized health services, and makes services not adapted so that they can speak without feeling judged. The work to end HIV and AIDS is bearing fruit, and Malaga is no longer the first city in Andalusia with the most new infections, it has dropped to second place. The methodology is based on access to testing, PrEP, infection containment, and reduction, among other things. In addition, the Apoyo Positivo association celebrates its 30 years of existence in which it has evolved to become one of the leading associations in diversity.

title: Jorge Rodríguez Garrido: «El vapeo afecta al corazón de igual manera que el tabaco»
summary: Jorge Rodríguez Garrido, a cardiologist with a clinic in Cee, has warned that vaping affects the heart in the same way as smoking. He also gave advice on how to take care of your health during the Christmas period, suggesting that it is important to maintain a good exercise routine and to avoid excessive alcohol consumption. He recommended that those with coronary heart disease should limit their alcohol intake, watch their calorie and carbohydrate intake, and be careful with sweets. Garrido also advised that people over the age of 35 should have regular heart check-ups, including an echocardiogram and an electrocardiogram. He also noted that the COVID-19 pandemic has affected the treatment of coronary heart disease, as some people have been reluctant to seek medical attention.

title: Vecinos del barrio Pablo Saravia podrán acceder a los servicios del Registro Civil
summary: Residents of the Pablo Saravia neighborhood will have access to Civil Registry services through a mobile identification operation located at Mar Ártico 1091 on Saturday, November 11. Interested parties can avail of the organization's services from 9 am to 4 pm. The Civil Registry will conduct an identification operation in the Ceferino neighborhood, where citizens can undertake various identification procedures related to updates for minors and adults, new copies due to loss, change of address, and passports. For minors' updates, a birth certificate in good condition or the minor's ID plus the father or mother's ID is necessary. For adult updates, the birth certificate and the interested party's ID are required. Birth certificates are not required for new copies of adults, change of address, and adult passports. The new DNI costs $300 pesos, and the new Passport copy is $15,000 pesos.

title: Donate to Angel and Ana Need Our Help, organized by Norma Bowe
summary: Ana Diaz Lopez, a social worker and community activist, and her husband, Angel, are in need of financial assistance. Angel was diagnosed with clear cell sarcoma, a rare and aggressive soft tissue cancer, and has undergone multiple surgeries, including a muscle transplant. He will be unable to work for at least a year and will require ongoing medical treatment. As a self-employed individual, he does not qualify for disability benefits. Dr. Norma Bowe, director of the non-profit organization Be the Change NJ, is organizing a fundraiser to help alleviate the financial burden on the family. The funds raised will go directly to Ana and her family to cover medical expenses and other financial obligations.

title: La PrEP, bajo análisis: cómo superar el estigma y las barreras socioculturales para combatir el VIH
summary: The XIV National Congress organized by GeSIDA has brought together a group of experts to discuss the epidemiological situation of HIV in Spain, its relationship with other STIs, as well as the incidence of policies developed to advance the fight against HIV in our country, including the implementation of PrEP (pre-exposure prophylaxis). The experts discussed how to overcome the sociocultural barriers and stigma associated with PrEP. Dr. Lucio García-Fraile, of the Hospital Universitario de La Princesa, Madrid, spoke about the need to improve healthcare circuits, simplify protocols, and remove administrative and financial barriers for the migrant population. He also recommended expanding the indication to other populations at risk and emphasized the importance of sensitizing healthcare professionals to cultural competencies and managing the adverse effects of PrEP.

title: Veteran Manager-Producer Maritza Cabrera Launches Limitless Management
summary: Veteran manager-producer Maritza Cabrera has started a new company called Limitless Management with her current clients, which include multi-talented artist Juan Francisco Villa, who has appeared in Blue Bloods and To Leslie. Cabrera, who used to work for Zero Gravity Management, will represent several other multi-talented artists and writers. She is also producing her first feature film, Clocked, which stars her clients Danell Leyva and Brandon Hudson. The film is currently on the festival circuit and looking for distribution. Cabrera has always prioritized championing women and diversity in the industry, as well as her roster.

title: Kimpton Surfcomber Hotel Welcomes Amanda Rodriguez as Director of Sales & Marketing
summary: Amanda Rodriguez has been appointed as the Director of Sales & Marketing for Kimpton Surfcomber Hotel, a boutique hotel located in South Beach's Art Deco District. With over 15 years of experience in the hospitality industry, Rodriguez will be responsible for developing strategies to maintain the hotel's position as a market leader. The hotel recently underwent extensive renovations and offers guests over 53,000 square feet of refreshed indoor and outdoor events and meeting spaces, as well as dining and lounge options such as The Social Club and High Tide. Direct beach access and a design-driven environment called "backyard bliss" are also available to guests. Rodriguez graduated from Florida International University's School of Hospitality Management and has previously worked at The Delano and The Standard Miami before joining Kimpton Surfcomber.

title: Opinion: Why Maryland's sex trafficked children need a Safe Harbor law
summary: Maryland has been attempting to address the needs of child sex trafficking victims since 2007 with the establishment of the Maryland Human Trafficking Task Force. Laws have been passed to define trafficking as a form of child abuse and impose harsher penalties on traffickers. However, the state has yet to pass Safe Harbor legislation which would protect sex-trafficked children from being charged as prostitutes. Currently, child victims of sex trafficking can be arrested, detained, and incarcerated for prostitution, which blames them for the sexual abuse they have suffered. Safe Harbor legislation recognizes these children as victims of a crime committed against them. The House has unanimously passed the bill, and the Maryland Coalition for Safe Harbor has submitted over 4,900 constituent letters in support. However, the bill is stalled in the Senate Judicial Proceedings Committee, as some senators struggle to see sexually exploited children as victims. Safe Harbor legislation is long overdue in Maryland, and the Senate must take action. Sex trafficked children are victims and not guilty of anything.

title: María Borrallo, la niñera española con un rol vital en la recuperación de Kate Middleton
summary: María Borrallo, a Spanish nanny, has a crucial role in the recuperation of Kate Middleton, as per La Razón. She has been the nanny to the children of the Prince and Princess of Wales since 2014 and is recognized for her proficiency in child care and discretion. Borrallo, who received training at the Norland College, is the sole nanny employed by the royal couple, and her abilities consist of martial arts, anti-terrorism techniques, and extreme driving. She is anticipated to have a significant part in the Adelaide Cottage, the historic residence near Windsor Castle, where the royal family will be residing during the recovery of Kate Middleton and Carlos III. The article also mentions that Borrallo has access to a confidential mental health service provided by Norland College, which could be beneficial in her demanding role.

title: Río Negro convoca a productores mineros a reinscribirse en el Registro Provincial
summary: The Secretary of Mining of Rio Negro, Joaquín Aberastain Oro, has announced that producers operating in the province must complete the annual registration process for the Provincial Mining Production Registry. The deadline for the process is February 28th, and failure to complete it will result in the automatic expiration of mineral transit guides held by the producers. The current registry is comprised of around 300 producers, mostly specialized in the extraction of aggregates, with a smaller number involved in the production of bentonite, diatomite, and halite. Completing the registration process is a simple procedure, requiring the submission of the corresponding form and a $5,000 stamp from the Banco Patagonia. Producers can submit the form to any delegation of the Secretariat of Mining in the province.

title: Bühler, Givaudan, MISTA open extrusion hub
summary: Bühler, Givaudan, and MISTA have opened an extrusion hub at the MISTA Innovation Center in San Francisco. The new facility advances MISTA's capabilities in driving food innovation and highlights Givaudan's and Bühler's commitment to supporting the transformation of the food system. The hub offers companies the opportunity to conduct innovative and effective product development trials for their extruded products. Equipped with a 30-millimeter twin-screw Bühler extruder, the hub enables both high-moisture extrusion, such as plant-based meat production, and low-moisture extrusion, including snacks and cereals. With an output of up to 50 kilograms per hour, companies can now explore new possibilities in product development with ease. The hub launch coincided with the biannual MISTA in Action program, held at the end of March.

title: Givaudan, Bühler and Mista open extrusion hub for plant-based products
summary: Givaudan, Bühler, and Mista have opened a new extrusion hub in San Francisco, California, US, at the Mista Innovation Center. The facility enhances Mista's capabilities for food innovation and underscores Givaudan's and Bühler's commitment to transforming the food system. The hub features a 30mm twin-screw Bühler extruder capable of high-moisture extrusion for plant-based meat and low moisture-extrusion for snacks and cereals. With an output of up to 50kg per hour, companies can explore new product development possibilities. The collaboration between Givaudan and Bühler provides companies with the chance to conduct product development trials for extruded products. The addition of extrusion capabilities will help generate and accelerate many of the great-tasting food solutions needed to ensure a sustainable food future, said Scott May, founder and head of Mista.

title: Givaudan, MISTA, and Bühler Launch New Extrusion Hub for Plant-Based Products in USA
summary: Givaudan, MISTA, and Bühler have launched a new extrusion hub for plant-based products at the MISTA Innovation Center in San Francisco. The hub features a 30mm twin-screw Bühler extruder that is capable of high and low-moisture extrusion, making it suitable for various products, including plant-based meats, cereals, and snacks. The facility’s extruding equipment is larger than benchtop extruders and offers a high output capacity of 50 kilograms per hour. The hub will provide a platform for conducting product development trials for extruded products. The Global Innovation Network established by Givaudan, Bühler, and other key industry players aims to drive food innovation, disrupt established products, and support the transformation of the food system. The partnership between MISTA, Givaudan, and Bühler provides a world-class technology platform for food innovators to develop and scale the protein sources that will sustainably nourish the world’s growing population.

title: Mista Polish company continues to deliver Oncilla armored vehicles on Ukrainian front | Defense News March 2024 ...
summary: Mista, a Polish company, has successfully delivered 100 Oncilla armored vehicles to Ukraine for use in the ongoing conflict. The company has emphasized its commitment to production efficiency and adhering to delivery timelines for its Ukrainian partners. The Oncilla is equipped with two engine options, the KM DEUTZ BF 4M 1013FC and the IVECO NEF 4 ENTC, giving it excellent driving performance. Its standard armament includes an NSV machine gun of 12.7 mm caliber. The vehicle is characterized by a design that combines strength with functionality, with a wheelbase of 3100 mm and a capacity to accommodate a combat crew of three members plus six additional soldiers. Mista is using information gathered on the battlefield to innovate with the next iteration, the Oncilla II, which is expected to feature a redesigned, larger, and heavier frame, a more powerful engine, and a new remote-controlled combat module capable of accommodating a 14.5 mm machine gun.

title: This Doctor Explains Why Eating Fat Doesn't Make You Fat
summary: Mauricio Gonzalez, M.D., explains that eating the right fat not only doesn't make you fat, it can even help you stay healthy. Eating good fats is essential for balanced nutrition and avoiding bad ones is important.

title: Nicole Wertheim College of Nursing & Health Sciences establishes Jorge M. Perez and Darlene Boytell-Perez 50th ...
summary: The Nicole Wertheim College of Nursing & Health Sciences at Florida International University has received a $250,000 gift from the Jorge M. Pérez Family Foundation to establish the Jorge M. Pérez and Darlene Boytell-Pérez 50th Anniversary of Nursing Scholarship Endowment. The endowment will provide scholarships for full-time nursing students who demonstrate outstanding scholastic aptitude and accomplishments and financial need, with a preference for those who express a desire to stay in the South Florida community after graduation. The endowment is expected to help alleviate the shortage of nursing professionals throughout Florida by establishing a permanent source of funding to help nursing students pay for tuition and related educational expenses. Jorge M. Pérez and his wife Darlene Boytell-Pérez have been integral to FIU’s growth in multiple areas, and this represents their 15th gift to NWCNHS.

title: Poland: IFJ demands humane treatment of Spanish journalist Pablo González while he remains in pre-trial custody / IFJ
summary: The International Federation of Journalists (IFJ) has demanded that Spanish journalist Pablo González, who has been in pre-trial detention in Poland for over two years on charges of spying for Russia, be treated humanely. González is considered a dangerous prisoner and spends 23 hours a day in isolation in his cell. The IFJ, along with other organizations, has repeatedly criticized the harsh conditions under which the Spanish journalist is being held in prison. The IFJ hopes that the new Polish government, which took office in December 2023 and whose plans to restore the rule of law have been welcomed by the European Union, will review González's case and that the Polish judicial authorities will finally bring any charges against him so that he can defend himself. González was arrested by officers of the Polish Security Service while covering the humanitarian crisis on the Polish-Ukrainian border following the Russian full-scale invasion.

title: This Doctor Explains Why Eating Fat Doesn't Make You Fat
summary: Mauricio Gonzalez, M.D., explains in a video that eating the right fat not only doesn't make you fat, it can even help you stay healthy. He emphasizes the importance of adding good fats to the diet and avoiding bad ones for balanced nutrition.

title: Nicole Wertheim College of Nursing & Health Sciences establishes Jorge M. Perez and Darlene Boytell-Perez 50th ...
summary: Florida International University's Nicole Wertheim College of Nursing & Health Sciences has established the Jorge M. Pérez and Darlene Boytell-Pérez 50th Anniversary of Nursing Scholarship Endowment with a $250,000 gift from the Jorge M. Pérez Family Foundation. The endowment will provide scholarships for full-time nursing students who demonstrate outstanding scholastic aptitude and accomplishments and financial need, with a preference for those expressing a desire to stay in South Florida after graduation. The gift comes at a time when the state of Florida is facing a nursing shortage, with nearly 60,000 nurses expected to be needed by 2035. Jorge M. Pérez is the Chairman, Chief Executive Officer and Founder of the Related Group, and his wife, Darlene Boytell-Pérez, is an advanced registered nurse practitioner and clinical researcher at Gastro Health. The Pérez family has given over $2.5 million to FIU to date and the new endowment represents their 15th gift to NWCNHS.

title: Poland: IFJ demands humane treatment of Spanish journalist Pablo González while he remains in pre-trial custody / IFJ
summary: The International Federation of Journalists (IFJ) has demanded humane treatment for Spanish journalist Pablo González, who has been held in pre-trial detention in Poland for over two years on spying allegations. Despite no evidence being made public and no trial in sight, González is treated as a dangerous prisoner and spends 23 hours isolated in his cell. The IFJ, along with other organisations, has repeatedly condemned the harsh conditions to which the journalist is subject in prison. The IFJ hopes that the new government of Poland will review González’s case and the Polish judicial authorities will finally bring the charges against him, if any, so that he can defend himself. González was arrested by officers of the Polish Security Service while covering the humanitarian crisis on the Polish-Ukrainian border following the Russian full-scale invasion.

title: Ignacio Galán Champions Energy Storage for Elevating Renewable Investment at Davos Forum
hco: ASOCIACION VALENCIANA DE VIHSIDA Y HEPATITISPA
summary: During the Davos Forum, Iberdrola’s Executive Chairman, Ignacio Galán, advocated for energy storage to enhance renewable investment. He shared his perspective in the session “Tripling Renewables: Make It Rapid and Responsible” alongside European Commissioner for Energy, Kadri Simson, and US Special Presidential Envoy for Climate, John Kerry. On the goal of tripling renewables, Galán said, “We already have the technology, financial resources and ambition to make it happen. But we need to move faster”. He further emphasised the importance of involving local communities in promoting renewable installations. Lastly, Galan highlighted the importance of transmitting this idea to the population. Communities “have to see an opportunity not in electricity production but in creating a new economy around it,” he noted.

title: AEQ appoints Ignacio Alonso Montull CEO
hco: ASOCIACION VALENCIANA DE VIHSIDA Y HEPATITISPA
summary: Spanish AV equipment manufacturer AEQ ha nombrado a Ignacio Alonso Montull como su CEO. Montull cuenta con más de 25 años de experiencia en la industria electrónica y de telecomunicaciones en I+D, fabricación, marketing, emprendimiento y gestión. Miguel Sancho, Presidente del Consejo de Administración de AEQ, dijo: "El nombramiento de Ignacio es un paso importante para el crecimiento de AEQ". Montull se reunirá con los clientes en la NAB Show en el stand C3106.

title: How Ignacio Galán is Driving Iberdrola's Electrification
hco: ASOCIACION VALENCIANA DE VIHSIDA Y HEPATITISPA
summary: Ignacio Galán, the Executive Chairman of Iberdrola, has transformed the Spanish multinational electric utility company into a firm focused on electrification, environmental protection, and social responsibility. Galán's dedication to international expansion and electrification has enabled Iberdrola to invest over €140bn (US$151.7bn) in renewable energies, smart grids, and energy storage. Under his leadership, Iberdrola has become a leader in clean energy and an owner of electricity grids with operations in Brazil, Mexico, the UK, and the US. Galán's commitment to electrification and diversifying the business for the benefit of the planet has been widely recognized, with the leader receiving honorary awards from the universities of Salamanca, Edinburgh, and Strathclyde. In 2014, he was honored by Queen Elizabeth II with the Commander of the Most Excellent Order of the British Empire for his work to promote the British energy sector and UK-Spain trade and investment relations.

title: OUTCROP SILVER ANNOUNCES BREAKTHROUGH GRAVIMETRIC CONCENTRATION RESULTS FOR SANTA ANA
hco: ASOCIACION VALENCIANA DE VIHSIDA Y HEPATITISPA
summary: Outcrop Silver has announced breakthrough results from the initial gravimetric concentration test work as part of the program to enhance the already high-recoveries at Santa Ana. The gravimetric concentration test confirmed the recovery of silver from mineralized material at Santa Ana before the conventional flotation processing. The resulting silver and gold gravimetric concentrate yielded 2,883 grams per tonne of silver and 164.12 grams per tonne of gold. This phase of testing has proven the effective recovery of silver and gold through mechanical gravimetric processes before conventional flotation. The combination of high recovery rates and high-grade concentrates truly sets Santa Ana apart as a unique project in the mining sector.

title: Spring 2024 grad: Bea Sutton finds her passion in food science – CALS News
hco: ASOCIACION VALENCIANA DE VIHSIDA Y HEPATITISPA
summary: Bea Sutton, a student from Ashland, Wisconsin, will graduate this spring with a bachelor's degree in food science and a certificate in global health. She initially applied as a mathematics major but later found her passion for food science. Throughout her studies, she was involved in clubs and held a job with Dining and Culinary Services, where she worked her way up to head student supervisor at Carson's Market. She also participated in two internships, one of which was with Treehouse Foods in Omaha, NE. After graduation, she plans to intern at a California winery and then pursue a graduate degree in either food science or plant sciences. Sutton advises CALS students to get involved in clubs and to get to know those in their major.

title: Energy storage: Mirova supports Corsica Sole and enters the capital of its Joint Venture "Baltic Storage Platform ...
hco: ASOCIACION VALENCIANA DE VIHSIDA Y HEPATITISPA
summary: Mirova, a subsidiary of Natixis Investment Managers, has invested in Baltic Storage Platform, a joint venture established by Corsica Sole and Evecon, to construct and manage high-capacity battery storage plants in Estonia and the Baltic countries. Mirova's investment in Baltic Storage Platform will guarantee the launch of two storage plants by 2025 and expedite the development of other projects in the area. The two storage plants will have a combined power output of 200 MW and a total capacity of 400 MWh. They will help maintain the stability and resilience of the Estonian electricity grid, and subsequently, the Baltic power grids, in anticipation of their separation from the Russian power grid and synchronization with the European grid, which is scheduled for 2025. The initiative will allow Estonia to shift to 100% renewable energy and meet its electricity demands by 2030.

title: Piedmont Lithium receives mining permit approval for Carolina Lithium project
hco: ASOCIACION VALENCIANA DE VIHSIDA Y HEPATITISPA
summary: Piedmont Lithium has been granted permission to mine for the proposed Carolina Lithium project in Gaston County, North Carolina. The project is a fully integrated operation, including mining, spodumene concentrate, and lithium hydroxide manufacturing. It is expected to provide significant economic benefits and job opportunities to the area. The project is also advantageous due to the competitive corporate tax regime and absence of significant royalties in the United States, as well as the benefits of the Inflation Reduction Act of 2022. The company believes that the project will offer excellent after-tax returns and is not aware of any other jurisdiction that combines the benefits of significant spodumene resources, deep customer markets, and low royalty and income tax rates.

title: UNC Health Celebrates New North Carolina Surgical Hospital | Newsroom
hco: ASOCIACION VALENCIANA DE VIHSIDA Y HEPATITISPA
summary: UNC Health celebrated the grand opening of the new North Carolina Surgical Hospital in Chapel Hill. The hospital, which is scheduled to begin treating patients in July, is the single largest addition to the Chapel Hill campus since it was built in 1952. It will help ensure that patients from across the state will receive the most advanced surgical care and services now and well into the future. The state-of-the-art facility spans seven stories and encompasses 375,000 square feet meticulously designed to offer a comforting atmosphere for patients and their loved ones. Boasting 26 advanced surgical suites and 80 patient rooms, the facility is fully equipped to facilitate the latest procedures, reinforcing our commitment to delivering superior patient care. UNC Health provided more than $800 million in Uncompensated Charity Care during the past five years.

title: Luis Vañó, reelegido como presidente de la Plataforma del Tercer Sector de la Comunitat Valenciana
summary: Luis Vañó has been re-elected as the president of the Plataforma del Tercer Sector de Acción Social de la Comunitat Valenciana (PTS CV) for the next term 2024-2028. He aims to strengthen the internal cohesion of the PTS CV, promote financial sustainability, intensify political impact and encourage strategic alliances. Vañó's vision for the third sector is inclusive and participatory, focused on uniting efforts and resources to collectively face social challenges. He emphasizes the importance of social innovation and analysis as tools to adapt to changing societal needs. The re-election of Luis Vañó represents an opportunity to continue building a more just and equal Comunitat Valenciana, and the PTS CV invites all sectors of society to collaborate in this joint effort.

title: Former Arnold Classic Champion Victor Martinez Advises Bodybuilders to Stay Natural as Long as Possible: “I've Seen ...
summary: Former Arnold Classic Champion Victor Martinez has advised bodybuilders to stay natural for as long as possible. He shed light on the effects of performance-enhancing drugs (PEDs) on athletes' careers and how they harm and affect the whole body as one grows older. Martinez also stressed the importance of building a proper foundation for the body and avoiding shortcuts. He cited Robbie Robinson's training as a perfect example of a foundation for building one's physique. Martinez also discussed the potential risks of using PEDs, including liver damage and thickening of the blood, and emphasized the need for passion and dedication in bodybuilding. Overall, Martinez's insights emphasize the importance of following a proper training regimen and staying natural for as long as possible.

title: ANSL | La Virgen de Luján ya tiene un espacio en el Hospital Central 'Dr. Ramón Carrillo'
summary: The Virgin of Luján, who is the Patron Saint of Argentina, has been given as a donation and placed on the 1st floor of the Hospital Central 'Dr. Ramón Carrillo' in San Luis, Argentina. This was done as a tribute to Sister María Natividad, who died of COVID-19 in the same hospital. The ceremony was blessed by Bishop Gabriel Barba, and attended by Governor Claudio Poggi, Minister of Government Facundo Endeiza, and Minister of Health Claudia Spagnuolo. The image of the Virgin of Luján is an exact replica of the one in the Basilica. The director of the hospital, Adolfo Sánchez de León, expressed his gratitude for the donation and the presence of the officials. The initiative was also in response to the community's request for a religious space in the hospital to make their faith requests. The bishop emphasized the importance of the Virgin's presence to strengthen and preserve life during difficult times, especially for healthcare workers who also suffer and care for others.

title: Espacio Cajal en la Universidad de Zaragoza: Una reivindicación de la formación
summary: The University of Zaragoza has opened an Espacio Cajal, a permanent exhibition that showcases the life and work of Santiago Ramón y Cajal, the Nobel Prize-winning scientist who discovered that the brain was composed of individual cells. The exhibition includes books, scientific objects, models, and a dozen drawings provided by the Cajal Institute, as well as an original work, the Atlas Anatómico, which will only be on display for the first month. The exhibition aims to promote the value of education and research, which Cajal believed were essential for scientific discoveries. The Espacio Cajal is part of a series of events organized to commemorate the Year of Research Ramón y Cajal.

title: Los pequeños hospitalizados tendrán un patio de juego en el Juan Ramón Jiménez en Huelva
summary: The Juan Ramón Jiménez Hospital in Huelva, Spain will soon have a play area for children who are hospitalized. This is thanks to the "Patio del Amor" association, with support from the Hermandad de las Tres Caídas and the local government. The project's goal is to offer a place for children to play and learn while they recover in the hospital. The design of the play area will reflect the nature and culture of Huelva. The play area will include a boat, a whale, a cinema room, and a space for storytelling and theater performances. The initiative has a dual purpose of providing a space for children to connect with nature and receive educational attention within the hospital. The project is currently seeking funding to adapt an unused space in the hospital, and the association is calling on the local community to help make it a reality.

title: Spain passes laws on trans rights, abortion, menstrual leave
summary: Spain has passed new laws that expand transgender rights, access to abortion procedures, and paid menstrual leave for workers. The legislation was put forward by the country's left-wing coalition government and was hailed as a victory by LGBTQ+ activists and women's rights campaigners. The transgender law passed with 191 votes in favor, 60 against, and 91 abstentions, making Spain the first European country to introduce menstrual leave. The laws also allow minors aged 14 and 15 to apply for a gender change with their parents' or legal guardians' approval. However, the laws were passed amid controversy and disagreement. The passage was praised by Spain's largest LGBTQ organization, and Uge Sangil, head of FELGBTI+, called it a victory for the trans community. The laws were passed ahead of scheduled elections later this year.

title: Uge Sangil: "Ayuso consuma con nocturnidad y alevosía el primer retroceso en derechos LGTBI"
summary: The president of the Federación Estatal LGTBI+, Uge Sangil, has criticized the government of Madrid's decision to pass reforms to the region's LGTBI and trans laws, calling it a "step backwards" in LGTBI rights. The reforms include restrictions on the ability of minors to change their gender on official documents, and the removal of LGTBI content from school curriculums and libraries. Sangil accused the government of acting in line with the ultra-right policies of Vox, and of trying to "erase" the LGTBI community. The reforms have been passed by the regional assembly, which is controlled by the conservative People's Party, which has a majority in the assembly.

title: Spain passes law allowing anyone over 16 to change registered gender
summary: Spain's parliament has passed a new law that allows anyone over the age of 16 to change their legally registered gender, without medical supervision. The law also bans conversion therapy and ends public subsidies for groups that "incite or promote LGBTIphobia". It also introduces up to five days of menstrual leave for women who have incapacitating periods and free sanitary products in schools, prisons, and women's centres to tackle "period poverty". The new abortion legislation does away with a 2015 measure introduced by the conservative People's party which required women aged 16 and 17 to obtain parental consent for abortions. The law was passed despite protests from feminist groups and warnings from opposition parties. Uge Sangil, the head of FELGBTI+, Spain's largest LGBTQ+ organization, welcomed the law.

title: RMG – Rediscovering the Sons of Don Bosco who became cardinals: Óscar Andrés Rodríguez Maradiaga
summary: Óscar Andrés Rodríguez Maradiaga, who is a Salesian, bishop, and pastor, is the tenth person from the Don Bosco family to be appointed Cardinal and serve the Church. He is recognized for his dedication to combating inequality and is one of Pope Francis' trusted advisors. Rodríguez Maradiaga was born on 29 December 1942 in Tegucigalpa, the capital of Honduras, and received his education at the San Miguel Salesian school in his hometown. He completed his novitiate in Ayagualo, El Salvador, between 1960 and 1961 and made his first Salesian profession on 3 May 1961. He has held various positions within the Church, including President of Caritas Internationalis, and is well-known for his efforts against drug use and corruption, as well as his criticism of economic systems that lead to exploitation and marginalization. He was appointed Cardinal by Pope John Paul II on 21 February 2001 and was named a Member and Coordinator of the Council of Cardinals by Pope Francis on 13 April 2013.

title: Exclusive: LinkedIn's Oscar Rodriguez Reveals Battle Against Job Scams and Fake Accounts with Cutting-Edge AI
summary: LinkedIn is using AI technologies to combat job scams and fake accounts. Oscar Rodriguez, Vice President of Product Management at LinkedIn, discussed how the company is fighting back against these issues. Rodriguez explained that the company uses AI, machine learning, and deep-learning-based models to detect probable harmful behavior, fake profiles, and take quick action to protect members. The company is also investing in teams, tools, and technology to mitigate the risk of fake accounts, including strengthening registration defenses and challenges. Additionally, LinkedIn is committed to building a skills-first labor market and helping members upskill through LinkedIn Learning. The company is also working to make the platform safe for all members, including women, by not allowing inappropriate behavior and updating automated tools to detect potentially harmful behavior and warn members.

title: laura maria gonzalez cultivates sustainable biocement from microbes for exhibition at MIT
summary: Laura Maria Gonzalez has presented an exhibition called Microbes Make Mountains at MIT's Keller Gallery. The exhibition focuses on the potential of microbes to influence design concepts. Gonzalez aims to change our perception of the unseen microbial world and encourages us to imagine a future where these tiny architects are integrated into our built environment. The exhibition showcases the potential of bacteria to create biocement, a sustainable alternative to traditional concrete. Gonzalez's process involves nurturing bacteria, which are then introduced into 3D-printed molds filled with an aggregate mineral mixture. The addition of urea and calcium creates an environment conducive to the formation of calcium carbonate crystals, resulting in a series of biocemented spheres. The exhibition draws inspiration from the vibrant mineral formations found in places such as Spain's Rio Tinto and Ethiopia's Danakil Depression, where microbial communities significantly contribute to the creation of striking mineral patterns.

title: Dr. Laura Carlin-Gonzalez named Executive Director of Teaching and Learning
summary: Dr. Laura Carlin-Gonzalez has been appointed as the Executive Director of Teaching and Learning for Round Rock ISD. She will be responsible for overseeing the district's teaching and learning programs, which includes curriculum, advanced academics, professional development, and career and technical education. Carlin-Gonzalez has more than 16 years of experience in educational leadership and has previously worked as an assistant superintendent of curriculum and instruction at Del Valle ISD. She collaborated with campus and district leaders to improve the district's TEA accountability rating. She holds a Doctorate of Education in educational leadership and policy from the University of Texas at Austin's Cooperative Superintendency Program and has certifications as a Texas superintendent, principal, and secondary mathematics teacher. Her first day with Round Rock ISD is on Tuesday, Jan. 16.

title: Abogados Cristianos se querella contra los promotores de la campana de la tarjeta T-Droga
summary: Abogados Cristianos has filed a complaint against the Federació de Casals Joves de Catalunya over its "T-Drogues" campaign, alleging that it promotes drug use. The campaign includes the distribution of a "T-Drogues" card with recommendations for the use of cocaine. The Asociación Bienestar y Desarrollo (ABD) provided advice on the campaign as part of its risk reduction programme. Abogados Cristianos has requested that the card be withdrawn and the campaign suspended. The ABD has defended its involvement in the campaign, stating that it supervised it to ensure messages aligned with its risk reduction philosophy. The campaign is aimed at young adult drug users and is distributed at events and specific activities.

title: Proyecto ATENEA, inteligencia artificial al servicio de las personas mayores
summary: The startup Momentum Analytics and the NGO Grupo ABD Asociación Bienestar y Desarrollo have presented Project ATENEA, which is an AI-powered mobile device designed for elderly people and those with dependency issues. The device operates through voice interaction and enables users to perform daily tasks like scheduling medical appointments, video conferencing with family, and calling emergency or social services. The project aims to contribute to the digital transformation of regions, reduce the digital divide, combat loneliness, and promote inclusion, well-being, health, and quality of life. The current phase of the project is subsidized with a budget of €2.3 million by the Department of Social Rights of the Government of Catalonia. The project is supported by the municipalities of Mollet del Vallés, Sant Feliu de Llobregat, Premià de Mar, Manlleu, and Vall d'Aran, and Asociación Bienestar y Desarrollo is one of the leading organizations behind it.

title: Polémica por una campaña juvenil sobre el consumo de drogas
summary: A youth campaign by the Casals de Joves de Catalunya federation for reducing drug risks has sparked controversy due to its use of transportation card-like cards called "T-Drogues" that contain recommendations for safer drug use. The campaign, which began in 2021, was developed with the guidance of Energy Control, a program for reducing recreational drug use risks from the Asociación Bienestar y Desarrollo (ABD). ABD stated that it supervised the campaign to align the messages with its risk reduction philosophy, which involves identifying, evaluating, and managing risk factors to prevent or minimize potential harm. The organization clarified that this type of informative material is always aimed at people who use psychoactive substances and is distributed in spaces where consumption occurs.

title: GLAY+ Maspalomas World AIDS Day Commemoration at La Plaza De La Diversidad a Resounding Success • The ...
summary: GLAY+ Maspalomas association organized a touching ceremony at La Plaza De La Diversidad GLAY+ Maspalomas, located in the south of Gran Canaria, to mark World AIDS Day. The occasion was graced by the presence of local government officials, community leaders, and a large number of attendees. The event was planned in collaboration with Buddies Bar and Cheyenne, Blue Havana, Copacobana, Olive, Mana264, Bar Meicker, and various partners of the Yumbo Plaza, which highlights the joint efforts of GLAY+ and its supporters to raise awareness and funds for ACES (Amigos Contra El SIDA) in the fight against AIDS. Checkpoint Canarias donated a sum of 1,500 euros to ACES and raised a considerable amount throughout the night, while ACES sold candles and ribbons in their Garden of Remembrance to be placed around the permanent red ribbon mosaic. The event not only commemorated World AIDS Day but also exhibited GLAY's constant endeavors to promote inclusivity, safety, and diversity among the hundreds of thousands of visitors to Yumbo and Maspalomas Costa Canaria each year.

title: La vacuna del VIH se prueba en Valencia: "He perdido a muchos amigos por el sida"
summary: The vaccine against HIV is currently being tested in Valencia, Spain. Two volunteers, Albert Staromiejski and Moisés Agustín, are taking part in the trial. The vaccine, named "Mosaico," is in its third phase and is being tested on 3,880 people across Europe and the Americas. It is a preventive vaccine and not a curative one, designed to repel the virus. The trial lasts for two years, during which the participants receive six injections in the first year and medical check-ups in the second year. The vaccine is being tested on men between the ages of 18 and 60 who have sex with men and are at risk of contracting the virus. The trial participants are not carriers of the virus. The volunteers' contribution to the research against HIV is essential in normalizing the disease and reducing the stigma associated with it.

title: ¿Qué es la serofobia, la discriminación que sigue vulnerando a las personas con VIH/Sida?
summary: Serophobia is the irrational fear and discrimination towards people living with HIV, which is based on misinformation about the transmission of the virus. This discrimination affects the human rights of people living with HIV and limits the construction of an inclusive society. According to the organization Amigos contra el Sida, this discrimination started in the 80s when the first cases of HIV were detected, mainly in vulnerable groups such as people living on the streets, sex workers, and members of the LGBT+ community. The fear and rejection towards people living with HIV is due to misinformation about the mechanisms of transmission of the infection. The Comisión Nacional de Derechos Humanos (CNDH) points out that people living with HIV or AIDS in Mexico face discrimination such as denial of health services or lack of access to necessary medications. Amigos contra el Sida is an organization that fights against the discrimination of people living with HIV and provides support to improve their quality of life.

title: Diario HOY | Hay 1.500 casos de VIH al año, y diputada propone eliminar "amigos con derecho"
summary: A Paraguayan lawmaker has proposed eliminating casual sex partners, known as "friends with benefits," as an effective method to combat the spread of HIV/AIDS. The country has 21,000 people affected by HIV, with 1,500 new cases added annually. The idea has generated mixed reactions, with some supporting the notion of safe sex and stable relationships, while others view the proposal as absurd. The proposal comes ahead of World AIDS Day. Amigos contra el SIDA, an organization in Paraguay, has been working to combat HIV/AIDS through education, advocacy, and support for those living with the disease.

title: Insólito: según diputada, evitar los "amigos con derechos" previene contagios de VIH
summary: A Paraguayan lawmaker, María Constancia Benítez, has suggested that avoiding "friends with benefits" can prevent HIV infections. Her comments were made during a session of parliament ahead of World AIDS Day. The country is seeing an increase in HIV infections, with young adults in the 15-44 age range being the most affected. The Ministry of Health offers 17 services for HIV patients across 13 health regions. Amigos contra el SIDA, a non-profit organization, is also working to prevent the spread of HIV in Paraguay through education, testing, and advocacy.

title: El sida todavía pervive en Lleida
summary: The Antisida Lleida association commemorated Memorial Day for AIDS victims in Lleida, paying tribute to almost 300 people who have died from the disease in recent decades. The event included an exhibition of handmade tapestries made by family members of those who have passed away from the infection and a manifesto reading by the president of the Antisida Lleida Foundation, Joan Fibla. Fibla emphasized the importance of getting tested for HIV, as the virus can remain dormant for years and cause serious health issues if left untreated. The celebration ended with a musical performance by Anna Borrego and Josep Cambray. Despite effective treatments, Fibla noted that people still die from HIV, and it is crucial to detect the virus early through rapid testing.

title: La Asociación Ciudadana Cántabra Anti Sida celebra sus 31 años de historia «en defensa de las personas con VIH»
summary: The Asociación Ciudadana Cántabra Anti Sida celebrated its 31st anniversary in Santander, Spain, with a focus on advocating for the rights of people living with HIV. The event highlighted the progress made in both the healthcare and social aspects since the association's inception. The theme of the event was "30 years...a memory," and it was held at the Central Library in Santander. The Asociación Ciudadana Cántabra Anti Sida, also known as ACCAS, has been working to promote awareness and provide support for people living with HIV in the region for over three decades.

title: ACCAS dice que los avances sanitarios en el sida son "abrumadores", pero no tanto en lo social
summary: The Asociación Ciudadana Cántabra Anti-SIDA (ACCAS) celebrated its 31st anniversary by acknowledging the "overwhelming" progress made in the healthcare sector regarding HIV/AIDS. However, it believes that social progress has not kept up with medical advancements. ACCAS recognizes that strides have been made in terms of rights, but they believe that more needs to be done to combat discrimination and stigma. The organization praised those who have dedicated their lives to ensuring the rights and dignity of those living with HIV/AIDS. The anniversary event provided an overview of the progress made in addressing HIV/AIDS over the past 31 years and the challenges that remain. The event was attended by government officials, including the Minister of Inclusion, Youth, Families, and Equality, who highlighted the importance of continuing to educate and inform young people about HIV/AIDS prevention.

title: De la muerte a la vida, ACCAS mira en su cumpleaños su pasado y los retos de futuro para las personas con VIH
summary: The Asociación Ciudadana Cántabra Anti-SIDA (ACCAS) is celebrating its 31st anniversary. The association has been fighting against stigma and improving the quality of life for people with HIV since its creation. They have faced many challenges, including lack of support, discrimination, and the impact of the pandemic, which quadrupled their users with basic needs. ACCAS has been successful in providing support to vulnerable people, educating on diversity, and fighting against stigma. However, the challenge now is to make people aware of the significant medical and scientific advances that have transformed HIV from a death sentence to a chronic disease. ACCAS is well-positioned to continue its work in helping people with HIV and fighting discrimination.

title: La Asociación Ciudadana Cántabra Anti Sida celebra sus 31 años de historia «en defensa de las personas con VIH»
